highly acclaimed first edition , with new chapter on urban design and urban , regional and intercity public transportation , as well as expanded chapter on automobile dependence and equity issue ; automobile city and the car culture ; the history of sustainable and unsustainable transportation ; the interrelatedness of technology , infrastructure energy and functionality ; and public policy and public participation and exemplary place , people and program around the globe .', 'Among the many valuable addition are discussion of autonomous vehicle ( AVs ) , electric vehicle ( EVs ) , airport city , urban fabric , urban heat island effect and mobility as a service ( MaaS ) .', 'New case study show global exemplar of sustainable transportation , including several from Asia , a case study of participative and deliberative public involvement , as well as one describing life in the Vauban ecologically planned community of Freiburg , Germany .', 'Student in affiliated sustainability discipline , planner , policymakers and concerned citizen will find many provides practical technique to innovate and transform transportation .', 'The Russian empire 1450-1801 .', 'Being an empire is inseparable from modern Russian identity and historical experience : the Russian empire was founded in the early modern era and endures in large part today .', 'The Russian Empire 1450-1801 survey how Russia ’ s many subject area were conquered and how the empire was governed .', 'It considers the Russian empire a “ Eurasian empire , ” characterized by a “ politics of difference ” : the ruler and their elite at the center defined the state ’ s need minimally ( control over defense , taxation and mobilization of resource , criminal law ) and otherwise tolerated local religion , language , culture , elite , and institution .', 'The center related to community and religion vertically , according each a modicum of right and autonomy but not allowing “ horizontal ” connection across social , ethnic , confessional , or other group potentially with common interest .', 'This book gives detailed attention to the major ethnic and religious group as it surveys strategy of governance-centralized bureaucracy , military reform , judicial system , tolerance of difference .', 'It pays particular attention to the dissemination of a supranational ideology of political legitimacy in a variety of medium , particularly symbolic , such as public ritual , painting , architecture , and urban planning .', 'Beginning with foundational feature , such as geography , climate , demography , and geopolitical situation , the book explores the empire ’ s primarily agrarian economy , serfdom , town and trade , religion , nobility , and high culture .', 'It tracks the emergence of an “ Imperial nobility ” and a national self-consciousness that was , by the end of the eighteenth century , distinctly imperial , embracing the diversity of the empire ’ s many people and culture .', 'Blue urbanism : Exploring connection between city and ocean .', 'What would it mean to live in city designed to foster feeling of connectedness to the ocean ?', 'As coastal city begin planning for climate change and rising sea level , author Timothy Beatley sees opportunity for rethinking the relationship between urban development and the ocean .', 'Modern society is more dependent upon ocean resource than people are commonly aware of , from oil and gas extraction to wind energy , to the vast amount of fish harvested globally , to medicinal compound derived from sea creature , and more .', "In Blue Urbanism , Beatley argues that , given all we 've gained from the sea , city policy , plan , and daily urban life should acknowledge and support a healthy ocean environment .", 'The book explores issue ranging from urban design and land use , to resource extraction and renewable energy , to educating urbanites about the wonder of marine life .', "Beatley looks at how emerging practice like `` community supported fishery '' and aquaponics can provide a sustainable alternative to industrial fishing practices.Other chapter delve into incentive for increasing use of wind and tidal energy as renewable option to oil and gas extraction that damage ocean life , and how the shipping industry is becoming more `` green . ''", 'Additionally , urban citizen , he explains , have many opportunity to interact meaningfully with the ocean , from beach cleanup to helping scientist gather data .', "Ultimately , he explains that we must create a culture of `` ocean literacy '' using a variety of approach , from building design and art installation that draw inspiration from marine form , to encouraging citizen volunteerism related to ocean , to city-sponsored research , and support for new law that protect marine health .", 'Equal part inspiration and practical advice for urban planner , ocean activist , and policymakers , Blue Urbanism offers a comprehensive look at the challenge and great potential for urban area to integrate ocean health into their policy and planning goal .', 'Toronto and Vancouver bound : The location choice of new Canadian immigrant .', 'Ethnic clustering plays an important role in the location choice of new immigrant to Canada .', 'A concentration of people in the same geographic area who are of similar ethnic background , culture and language can be an important source of financial and personal support , information and guidance , and social more .', 'Evidence is found that , after controlling for a range of other observable and unobservable factor important to the location decision , the concentration of people of a particular ethnic group in a particular area has a significant effect on the chance that new immigrant of the same ethnic group will choose to live there .', 'The size of the effect , however , depends on the personal characteristic of immigrant .', 'The attraction of ethnic concentration of immigrant is significantly smaller for new immigrant with a university degree and for those who normally speak English at home .', 'Characteristic of the local ethnic community related to education and language profile are also significant determinant of location choice .', 'Yanama budyari gumada : reframing the urban to care as Darug Country in western Sydney .', 'In non-urban place of Australia , caring-as-Country frame natural resource management ( NRM ) as a practice of reciprocal , more-than-human care-giving ( S. Suchet-Pearson , S. Wright , K. Lloyd , and L. Burarrwanga .', '2013 .', '‘ Caring as Country : towards and ontology of co-becoming in natural resource management.', '’ Asia Pacific Viewpoint 54 ( 2 ) : 185–197 ) .', 'Caring-as-Country is an idea that encapsulates the entangled , reciprocal relationship that people have with , and as part of , agentic more-than-human world .', 'In more urbanised place , however , practice of caring-as-Country are often unrecognised , undervalued and undocumented .', 'In this paper we make explicit practice of caring , healing and rejuvenation at Yellomundee Regional Park , Darug Country in western Sydney .', 'Our discussion of care , entanglement and reciprocity at Yellomundee focus on two specific activity that embody caring-as-Country : the return of cultural burn and sustained presence on Country in the form of Darug-led culture camp .', 'The Darug principle of yanama budyari gumada , to ‘ walk with good spirit ’ , embodies and invites new way of thinking and practising intercultural caring-as-Country in heavily colonised , urban place like Yellomundee .', 'As we document the practice arising from this invitation , we consider its far-reaching implication for NRM and planning , and we expand on the importance of geography of care for unceded urban place .', 'Planning for sustainable urban area or everyday life and inclusion .', 'This paper discusses the extent to which the diversity and equality agenda is being taken into account at street level as planner and urban designer seek to create sustainable settlement .', 'The paper argues that many design policy inspired by the sustainability agenda do not take into account inclusive urban design consideration , and thus large sector of the population are adversely affected .', 'While attention is given to the need of the disabled , particular emphasis is put in this paper upon the design need of woman and older people who together compose around a third of the population .', 'The impact of compact layout and higher density in residential area is first discussed , along with the problem created by increased car control , without commensurate transport policy alternative , or adequate , safe pedestrian routeways .', 'Second the problem of city centre are discussed where sustainability policy is also being targeted , but other priority including the new urbanism , the 24-hour city , the evening economy and the city of culture jostle for pre-eminence .', "It is concluded that the lack of awareness of people 's need and inclusive design principle are reducing the chance of ordinary people accessing , comfortably moving around and enjoying the city .", 'In order to bridge the gap between sustainability and inclusive design in planning , it is concluded that greater emphasis must be given to user need and the constraint of everyday life .', 'Town planning in postcolonial India , 1947-1965 : Chandigarh re-examined .', 'The objective of this article is to reassess the new town building movement in India from 1947 to 1965 through a re-examination of the making of Chandigarh , to show how nationalism , modernism , and local regional influence affected the design and building of new town .', 'Chandigarh emerged as part of the post-Partition need for a new capital for the Punjab , and involved the effort of several people and level of government .', 'The context of newly achieved nationhood became important in the way it shaped the ideal of both national and local political leader , who wanted architect to transfer these into built form .', 'How successful the architect were in this enterprise was shaped by their professional ideology and understanding ( or lack of it ) of the local .', "Much scholarship exists on issue such as early decision about Chandigarh 's establishment , the Mayer and Le Corbusier plans for the city , and the building comprising the Capitol complex that were designed by Le Corbusier .", 'Much less attention has been given to the residential area of Chandigarh and all that lay beyond the Capitol complex and constitutes the actual town .', 'How did the idea of modernism , the requirement of the nationalist state , and concern for the local shape the built environment ?', 'Was a Western urban design simply replicated here or were there modification to suit locality and culture ?', 'Aquatic system and water security in the Metropolitan Valley of Mexico City .', 'In megacities water quantity and quality are threatened by complex and interrelated process caused by population growth , land use change , unsustainable agricultural practice , deforestation , erosion , destruction of ecosystem , lack of planning , laissez-faire policy , unsustainable water management , political conflict , and increasingly also by the impact of climate change .', 'In the Metropolitan Valley of Mexico City ( MVMC ) located in the high plateau of Mexico City and on former lake , the dry out policy during the last 300 year have been counterproductive , causing scarcity , pollution , health and environmental problem , subsidence and water conflict , particularly affecting social vulnerable people .', 'Megacities require an integrated management of water and aquatic system .', '- integral water resource management , rainwater harvesting , maintenance and replacement of infrastructure , restoration of ecosystem and urban planning .', 'This implies investment and a water culture including a transparent administration and peaceful negotiation of conflict regarding concession , access , and reuse of water allocation .', 'Socio-political and environmental process are complex ; besides technical factor and ecosystem recovery , socio-cultural change must transform human settlement and power structure .', 'The governance of homelessness in the European South : Spatial and institutional contexts of philanthrophy in Athens .', 'This paper aims at shedding some light , by contrasting the discourse and practice of shelter-providers and welfare agency which manage the homeless in Athens , on the way in which culture and power combine to produce segmented response to homelessness in the European South .', 'It is argued that central state , local state , church and voluntary agency resort to different understanding of pity in order to acknowledge responsibility for different group of homeless people and shape action in a variety of local setting .', "Official rhetoric address visible homelessness but conceals exclusion , selecting deserving from non-deserving client and 'clean-ups ' of public space .", 'Radical voice aim at revealing hidden homelessness and sustain inclusive practice such as street or community work , but they fail to secure access for the homeless to housing , income and good quality of care .', 'Street and social life in city : a taxonomy of sociability .', 'Evident in the urban revival of North American city are planning and design strategy focused on attracting the downtown worker , the tourist , the conventioneer and the newly implanted suburbanite .', 'In this wave of revival , many group are marginalized , the reclaimed public space is often sanitized , gentrified and fortified , and not inclusive .', 'However , there are urban public space that defy or at least resist these trend .', 'Examining urban neighbourhood main street reveals that even though the contemporary urban street can never be an unregulated place of unconstrained diversity , there are street that counter the prevalent culture of consumption , and one can find visible sign of spontaneity and diversity of people and activity , and genuine social life .', 'Using research in urban sociology , a taxonomy for sociability is developed , and the existing range of classification of outdoor social activity is expanded .', 'Through empirical examination , this paper explains how these street perform as social spaces—how sociability is enacted , and what is the nature of planning , design and management , which supports social behaviour .', 'Finally , the research emphasizes the role of the street as an ordinary public space in creating affordances for everyday social contact that are crucial to personal well-being and social cohesion .', 'Comparative analysis of utilisation of open space at neighbourhood level in three Asian city : Singapore , Delhi and Kuala Lumpur .', "Planner and urban designer place high value on public open space , because of the latter 's contribution to the quality of life and social interaction of resident in an urban development .", 'Many urban theorist consider open space as an important component of a healthy urban environment .', 'It is well established in the literature that the utilisation of public space varies from context to context .', 'This article investigates whether the utilisation of open space at the neighbourhood level is more associated with the physical and functional property of open space or if it varies across different culture and contexts of city .', 'This research adopts the method of comparative analysis , involving three case study from different culture , and climatic and geographical contexts .', 'In each of these three city , the opinion of resident and visitor about public open space were obtained and observation survey were conducted to measure the utilisation of these space .', 'The research found that the utilisation of public space at various level of neighbourhood significantly differs between city because of the local context , such as culture , social value and climate , instead of just being due to the physical and functional property of open space .', 'Urban infrastructure as materialized consensus .', 'Abstract : Infrastructure that shape and facilitates daily life , such as pathway , conduit and boundary wall , constitutes one of the most dynamic form of architecture in both ancient and modern city .', 'Although infrastructure is conceived and designed with particular goal and capacity , its temporal and spatial scale means that it is a constant work in progress that engages numerous agent : civic authority design and implement infrastructure ; designated agency maintain and repair infrastructure ; and ordinary people utilize , modify , ignore or destroy it .', 'Infrastructure can be thus analyzed as a materialization of ongoing communication , in which there are often conflicts among different constituent to achieve consensus .', 'The linguistic concept of expert language and turn-taking are utilized to assess three brief case study : historical New Orleans ; a multipurpose micro-park in Vienna , Austria ; and the archaeological city of Sisupalgarh , India .', 'Visual pollution : Advertising , signage and environmental quality .', 'In recent year , there has been considerable interest in the problem that public space face because of the design of commercial sign .', "The negative consequence that commercial sign can have on the visual quality of urban area and further more , on people 's quality of life , has been studied from both architectural , planning and psychological perspective .", 'While the issue of visual pollution , as this phenomenon is commonly described , has been widely debated , there is as yet no clear conclusion as to how best to control commercial signage and whether different urban contexts and people from different background and culture have universal or distinct preference .', 'Several different commenrcial signage approach are currently applied to different historic city , but these initiative are not based on principle derived from the perception and evaluation of user .', 'Drawing on a range of comparative and contrasting empirical study of historic city centre in the UK and Brazil , this book examines question of commercial signage control management , the preservation of historic heritage and user preference and satisfaction .', 'The author takes an environment behaviour approach to this research , involving theory , concept and methodology related to environmental psychology , architecture , planning and urban design .', 'In doing so , it argues that there are in fact visual preference common to the majority of people , independent of their urban context and that these common view can be useful to the development of a general theory of how to control commercial signage .', 'In conclusion , the book suggests that the best way of controlling signage is not only to recommend general guideline related to the operation of commercial signage , but also to recommend design principle that can create commercial streetscapes evaluated positively by different user .', 'Human futuristics and urban planning .', 'Human futuristics , as a study of future cultural alternative , limitation , and choice , will not be another branch of “ science ” in the traditional sense .', 'Its function-will differ from that of science in many respect .', 'First , future culture are not existing “ object ” to be observed , analyzed , and explained .', 'Second , future culture can not be predicted by extrapolating the past pattern of change , the past rate of change , or even past rate of acceleration of change .', 'There are too many unprecedented innovation taking place which render extrapolation invalid .', 'Third , culture change do not just happen .', 'People make them happen .', 'Therefore culture change are subject to people ’ s goal , imagination , will , and choice .', 'Application of the eight perceived sensory dimension as a tool for urban green space assessment and planning in China .', 'Several evidence from the Nordic country suggest that the eight perceived sensory dimension , which are serene , nature , rich in specie , space , prospect , refuge , social and culture , can be used as a reliable tool for urban green space assessment and planning , but whether or not this is the case for China is unknown .', 'Using an onsite questionnaire distributed to green space user in Hefei , China , this study is the first to examine the representation of the eight sensory dimension as perceived by Chinese people in different type of green space , and to identify the relationship between the eight sensory dimension and preference , including the factor that most influenced their perception .', "The result showed that : ( 1 ) Social was common , while culture and rich in specie the least common—which was not in line with the previous European study ; ( 2 ) The popularity of green space type was positively related to the number of highly perceived sensory dimension ; ( 3 ) Type of green space was a key determinant of perception of the eight sensory dimension , and certain socioeconomic and green space use variable also had a great impact on people 's perception .", 'The result grant potential to the method in assessment and planning of urban green space in China .', "Indigenous Rough Sleeping in Darwin , Australia : 'Out of Place ' in an Urban Setting .", 'Much of what is known of street homelessness is informed by account from urban centre throughout North America and the UK .', 'The nature of the problem and the way in which it is addressed are implicitly assumed to be similar across diverse major city .', 'The street homeless are thought to be highly marginalised and vulnerable .', 'In turn , contemporary policy aim to provide housing/accommodation and welfare to address this form of homelessness as deep exclusion .', "Based on empirical research in Australia 's northernmost capital city , Darwin , this article demonstrates the role of culture in how homelessness is experienced and addressed .", 'It argues that cultural mobility and mode of behaviour that normalise rough sleeping are embedded within condoned poverty and discriminatory legislation directed towards Indigenous people .', 'Indigenous people are constructed as out of place in urban environment and rather than housing and welfare , the focus is directed towards moving the problem .', 'Virtual study abroad and exchange studio .', 'The digital design studio has an area of application where conventional medium are incapable of being used ; collaboration in learning , design and dialogue with people in place other than where one lives .', 'This distinctive opportunity has lead the author to explore a form of design brief and virtual design studio ( VDS ) format not well addressed in the literature .', "Instead of sharing the same design brief , student in this alternative format design a project in the other student ' city and do not collaborate on the same design .", 'Collaboration with other student takes the form of teaching each other about the city and culture served by the design .', 'The author discovered these studio produce a focus on site context that serves our pedagogical objective - a blend of architectural , landscape architectural and urban design knowledge .', 'Their student use a range of commercial CAD and computer supported collaborative work ( CSCW ) software common to that used in many VDS experiment reported on in the literature .', 'However , this conventional use of technology is contrasted with a second distinctive characteristic of these studio , the use of custom software tool specifically designed to support synchronous and asynchronous three-dimensional model exchange and linked attribute knowledge .', 'The paper analyzes some of the virtual design studio ( VDS ) work between the Swiss Federal Institute of Technology , the University of Toronto , and the University of Melbourne .', 'The author articulate a framework of VDS dimension that structures their teaching and research .', 'Why Gayborhoods Matter : The Street Empirics of Urban Sexualities .', 'Urbanists have developed an extensive set of proposition about why gay neighborhood form , how they change , shift in their significance , and their spatial expression .', 'Existing research in this emerging field of “ gayborhood study ” emphasizes macro-structural explanatory variable , including the economy ( e.g.', ', land value , urban governance , growth machine politics , affordability , and gentrification ) , culture ( e.g.', ', public opinion , societal acceptance , and assimilation ) , and technology ( e.g.', ', geo-coded mobile apps , online dating service ) .', 'In this chapter , I use the residential logic of queer people—why they in their own word say that they live in a gay district—to show how gayborhoods acquire their significance on the street .', 'By shifting the analytic gaze from abstract concept to interaction and embodied perception on the ground—a “ street empirics ” as I call it—I challenge the claim that gayborhoods as an urban form are outmoded or obsolete .', 'More generally , my finding caution against adopting an exclusively supra-individual approach in urban study .', 'The reason that resident provide for why their neighborhood appeal to them showcase the analytic power of the street for understanding what place mean and why they matter .', 'Enablers and Barrier of Lean Implementation in Construction Projects .', 'Lean aim to maximize customer satisfaction while minimizing waste .', 'However , Lean philosophy has not been well understood yet in the construction industry for the fact that the complexity and dynamic nature of construction project bring up uncertainty that may be hardly handled by construction practitioner .', 'Moreover , project-based nature of construction business makes Lean implementation even more challenging for construction people .', 'Even though Lean effort in construction have recently increased , there are problem with the implementation processes .', 'It is undeniable that successful Lean implementation strongly affects project performance .', 'Therefore , it is essential to reveal enablers and barrier in Lean implementation so that the construction industry practitioner might conduct project more effectively and satisfy project requirement ( i.e .', 'schedule , budget , safety ) .', 'This study aims to provide a set of core enablers and barrier of Lean implementation in construction project and guide construction professional to better satisfy project requirement .', 'Within this context , the study proposes seven major enabler and barrier group , namely the financial , managerial , technical , workforce , culture , government , and communication and twenty-seven component for each group .', 'Moreover , a survey was designed and administered to Lean practitioner to rank the enablers and barrier based on importance level .', 'Clear understanding of technical requirement in Lean practice was ranked as the most important enabler of Lean implementation whereas lack of top management support was ranked as the most important barrier in the Lean implementation .', 'However , the average ranking were not found to be diverging indicating that selected component of enabler and barrier group are properly chosen .', 'The study is expected to lead Lean practitioner with creating value to customer while preventing them from experiencing waste .', 'Recognition of urban unsustainability in Iran ( case study : Sanandaj City ) .', 'Rapid urban growth and urbanization in recent decade have caused change in the structure of human habitation such as social and economic change that would further clarify the importance of sustainable development and urban sustainability .', 'Urban sustainability should create a balance between different aspect of economic , environmental , and social development .', 'Therefore , this study aimed to determine various aspect of unsustainability in Iranian middle-large city in order to provide strategy to improve the indicator and to achieve sustainability by finding the cause of failure to develop these indicator .', 'Accordingly , first , urban sustainability indicator in four social , economic , physical and environmental aspect were presented .', 'Then , the process of changing was determined through the study of these indicator in Sanandaj during two different period ; and indicator such as job , green urban economics , housing , nongovernmental organization ( NGOs ) , social participation , culture , public service and facility , transportation , leisure , and medical care and health service were specified as unsustainability indicator in Sanandaj and other similar city .', "Then , the following strategy are provided to improve urban sustainability in order to analyze the reason for the decline or stagnation of these indicator : ( 1 ) strategy to revise the urban planning system in Iran ; ( 2 ) strategy to improve the city 's economy ; and ( 3 ) strategy to improve the condition and status of poor people .", 'The declining trend of unsustainability indicator could be reversed by applying these strategy .', 'Furthermore , with the promotion of indicator , sustainable city could be achievable .', 'Information technology and civic engagement : Perspective from librarianship and planning .', 'Urban planning and librarianship are parallel field in many way .', 'Both have theoretical and practical underpinnings driving each discipline ; are interdisciplinary in focus ; and both profession gather and disseminate information to stakeholder .', 'Essential to the success of each discipline is an engaged user population .', "The author use a case study from the Village of Oak Park to examine and reflect upon the effect of the Internet and other technology in the public 's ability to participate in an open planning process .", 'The Village of Oak Park is known for its architectural heritage and outspoken community .', 'Within its 4.5 square mile live a diverse population of approximately 52,000 people from different culture , race , ethnicity , profession , lifestyle , religion , age , and income where a majority of the population have some advanced education and over 80 % of the household report home Internet use .', 'How does a community like the Village of Oak Park engage in the planning process ?', 'What role does information play in this process ?', 'Can modern Information Technologies facilitate civic engagement ?', 'These question are examined during a year-long case study conducted by the University of Illinois at Chicago ( UIC ) in cooperation with the Village of Oak Park ( VOP ) .', 'Specifically , the investigator examined how information is gathered and used in the planning process and how the introduction of Information Technology ( IT ) tools influenced public participation and introduced many citizen to e-government through the planning process .', 'The use of these tool is compared to the traditional planning process .', 'Data from the project is presented to demonstrate a different kind of role librarian play in the research process .', 'Last , the author discuss the role of privacy in the gathering and sharing of information with the reliability of that information and the impact of privacy on the public planning process .', 'Chicago sociology and urban planning policy - Sociological theory as occupational ideology .', "This account has provided one illustration of the possibility of an alternative approach to the sociology of knowledge other than the `` reductionist '' analysis of idea as mere epiphenomena of material interest .", "If the sociology of knowledge can not be pursued in any other fashion , the field 's oft-lamented neglect seems entirely justifiable .", 'But sociologist of knowledge can choose to define the purpose of their work , not as the exposure of perceptual distortion conditioned by social position , but as the elucidation of factor which lend certain formulation plausibility within a given socio-cultural context .', "Ironically , such explication of the relationship of ideology to work has been consonant with the developing Chicago tradition , although not unique to it , for Chicagoans have been concerned to elucidate the mean by `` which people respond creatively to the limitation of their institutional context . ''", 'As we have seen , the pre-World War II manifestation of that tradition has permitted urban bureaucrat to maximize their possibility for action within the constraint of their formal obligation .', 'Not only has their faith in the accuracy of evolutionist prediction sustained civil servant in the belief that they have maintained value-neutrality , but it has also allowed them to enjoy the pleasure of power and concrete accomplishment .', 'For the city is conceptualized as an ever-expanding frontier , perpetually subjected to cycle of devastation and construction .', 'Hence , while ostensibly acting as instrument of inexorable historical force , urban bureaucrat are constantly provided with opportunity to raise tangible monument to their personal authority .', "And evolutionist sociology has sanctioned a viable occupational strategy for the bureaucrat qua bureaucrat , for it justifies the civil servant ' favored relationship with powerful client , allowing them to negotiate their continued occupational survival .", 'Although Chicago sociology has proved useful to planning professional , I do not mean to suggest that its creator would have approved of the consequence of bureaucratic activity .', "In fact , both in method and substance the practice of government agency have violated the human ecologist ' ideal ; Chicagoan Louis Wirth deplored planner ' operational category , arguing that they should be replaced with more sophisticated sociological one .", "More importantly , federal official used Chicago sociologist ' projection to support policy counter to the Chicagoans ' prescription for civilized society .", 'Government policy has been effectively anti-urban .', "Based on the Chicago evolutionist ' model , and in the name of sound business practice , central city decline has been assured and suburban expansion facilitated .", 'Chicago sociologists saw conflict arising from large-scale urban migration and rapid industrialization , but they accepted conflict as necessary to progress ; the highest development of civilization required diversity and an urban milieu .', 'Within the city various group created homogeneous community , but heterogeneity of the population as a whole was essential to urban culture .', "Federal agency , while adhering to the sociologist ' premise , turned the model on its head ; they sought to minimize conflict by eradicating social heterogeneity , and encouraged the growth of homogeneous suburban neighborhood in which resident were protected from alien person and lifestyle .", 'A sociotechnical approach to cause of urban blight using fuzzy cognitive mapping and system dynamic .', 'Urban blight often is prominent in urban environment .', 'It consists of real estate degradation to the extent that blighted residential property , unfortunately , may provide housing only for the poorest social class .', 'Urban blight reduces real property value in urban neighborhood and urban center , reduces business investment and increases unemployment .', 'Urban blight is not static , but continuously changing , either getting worse or improving .', 'Thus , it is an issue of growing concern for urban decision maker who may attempt to determine its cause .', 'Determining cause of urban blight facilitates the development of strategic measure for the prevention and potential eradication of this phenomenon .', 'This study seeks to bolster the identification of factor that cause urban blight and makes important contribution to both the academic community and society at large .', 'By combining fuzzy cognitive mapping and the system dynamic approach , our proposal facilitates the identification of urban blight determinant and the development of alternative to control and eradicate them .', 'Data used in our study were provided by a panel of urban blight expert , and allowed for the identification of the following major cause of urban blight : deficiency in sociability and/or culture ; unfavorable economic and financial factor ; policy and/or administrative shortage ; lack of urban regeneration ; insecurity for people and asset ; and building and/or surroundings defect .', 'The result of our decision-support system were analyzed and validated by an independent expert who works for the Lisbon City Council in Portugal .', 'Recommendation for future research are also provided .', 'Investigating learning and diffusion strategy for sustainable mobility .', 'Purpose : The purpose of this paper is to examine the concept of learning and diffusion within the context of urban development and sustainable active mobility .', 'A model is proposed , which treats learning as a diffusion process in a dynamic way , so that key strategy and their effect are investigated over time .', 'Specifically , the question being examined is how learning and information technology strategy can change the mindset of people to be more physically active in their mobility around a city .', 'This is carried out by developing a system dynamic ( SD ) computer simulation model , where learning strategy that promote walking can be tested prior to implementation .', 'Design/methodology/approach : Based on the specific key stage of knowledge , persuasion , decision , implementation and confirmation , the proposed SD model incorporates individual citizen and group level learning and diffusion process in a unified integrated approach .', 'The SD model gives a clear picture on how learning and changing mindset occur in the context of a city , whereby we can explore the main driver to learn new sustainability related habit .', 'A case study is used to contextualize and demostrate the active mobility issue , in order to develop practical scenario for promoting a walking mindset .', 'This is done in order to demonstrate the capability of the model and show its practicality .', 'Through the model we investigate the relationship among variable such as awareness , contact , communication and adoption and evaluate their impact on city policy to promote a walking mindset .', 'Finding : The developed SD model exhibit important dimension , such as social learning , motivation to change behaviour and an analysis of the effect of plausible strategy for promoting sustainable active mobility .', 'The author have proven that through simulation experimentation , we can significantly accelerate the shaping and diffusion of a walking mindset , by influencing individual and community learning via the introduction of Information and Communication Technology in conjunction with an awareness campaign strategy .', 'Research limitations/implications : The diagrammatic representation and the quantification of the factor that contribute to active mobility give rise to better understanding of how policy maker could promote a walking culture in a city .', 'The implication are that the proposed SD model could be used by city planning authority as a framework for shaping mindset towards active and sustainable mobility .', 'Originality/value : This paper contributes to the further understanding of learning , diffusion of new idea and strategic planning within the city context .', 'Through the proposed SD model , a number of strategy are formulated and tested using scenario planning , sensitivity analysis and optimization , in order to develop a walking mindset and an urban culture of sustainability .', 'Minecraft as a tool for engaging child in urban planning : A Case study in Tirol Town , Brazil .', 'The as an innovative tool to tackle the present lack of engagement and involvement of key societal actor such as child and young people in urban planning .', 'Thus , how can game support child to study , Minecraft is the tool which we use to explore youth engagement .', 'We designed two experiment , which tested Minecraft as a geogame environment for engaging young people in urban planning .', the other .", 'Published by Informa UK Limited , trading as Taylor & Francis Group .', "Urban music and entrepreneurship : Beat , rhyme and young people 's enterprise .", 'Youth unemployment in the UK remains around the one million mark , with many young people from impoverished background becoming and remaining NEET ( Not in Education , Employment , or Training ) .', 'However , the NEET categorisation covertly disguises and obscures the significance of the diverse range of activity , achievement and accomplishment of those who operate in the informal creative economy .', 'With grime music and its related enterprise a key component of the urban music economy , this book employs the inherent contradiction and question that emerge from an exploration of the grime music scene to work and labour , education and employment , ethnography , music , and cultural study .', 'Below the double bottom line : The challenge of socially sustainable urban water strategy .', 'Recent interview-based research on how Australian urban water professional grasp the social aspect of sustainable water management suggests that interest in these dimension outstrips understanding of them , and that more culturally intelligent , socially realistic and ethically sensitive notion of people , culture and society are needed .', "Despite lip-service to `` triple bottom line '' assessment of policy and development , Australia 's policymakers have advanced no further than a `` double bottom line '' based on economic and environmental value , the latter preferably expressed in dollar term .", 'The economic ( or market relation ) also substitutes for the social dimension in a continued policy emphasis on customer rather than citizen or community member .', "An overemphasis on behavioural economics , a lack of social , political and cultural theory , and neglect of people 's actual practice means that much policy and research around water fails to grapple with such basic social element as gender , different role and access to resource within household , cultural diversity , or ethical orientation .", 'A major challenge is to mobilise rather than ignore the altruistic and socially-oriented human capacity for adapting to change beyond the customer relation or the confines of technical and economic rationality ; including by collective innovation in value and practice of caring for water .', 'Sustainable Cultural Space in the Global City : Cultural Cluster in Heritage Sites , Hong Kong and Singapore .', '[ No abstract available ]', "Urban renewal and the creative underclass : Aboriginal youth subculture in sydney 's redfern-waterloo .", "Redfern-Waterloo , on the edge of Sydney 's CBD , has long been an important center for the city 's Aboriginal population , as a place to live , socialize , work , and/or access service provided by the area 's numerous Aboriginal organization .", 'State plan to regenerate Redfern-Waterloo , to realize its latent potential , far from seeking to displace the socially disadvantaged Aboriginal community and erase its cultural legacy , stress the importance of a continuing indigenous presence .', "Planning and policy document generally suggest that Aboriginal people can contribute to , and reap the benefit of , the area 's renaissance .", 'This article will explore construction of minority culture in planning discourse in Sydney and in particular the way indigenous culture and citizenship is delineated in the discourse of urban renewal .', "The vision of Aboriginal culture ( and residual communal presence ) is narrow and circumscribed by conventional `` touristic '' representation ( fine art , dance , and other performance ) around national heritage and consumption .", "This excludes many of the area 's youth who , like their counterpart throughout the world , identify more with street culture-hip-hop , graffiti art , skateboarding , etc.-than with traditional arts/high culture .", 'These activity have little place in the vision for urban renewal .', 'This article will argue that civic booster strategy that fail to recognize the complex and ambiguous character of public space and their importance as site of resistant/underground/avant-garde/youth subculture will inevitably generate sterile landscape ; their vision of local communal heritage is little more than tokenistic .', 'Beside downtown : Global Chinatowns .', "For much of the nineteenth and twentieth century , in Barcelona 's barrio chino/barrixino , decaying tenement and crowded street housed thousand of immigrant worker slaving in aging factory or seeking day- to- day opportunity at the nearby port .", "Only the broad , tree- lined Rambles , a promenade beloved of flâneurs , separated the middling class and elite of the historic city center from this `` Chinatown '' ( this boulevard , in fact , had replaced an earlier urban wall ) .", 'After dark , however , exotic nocturnal amusement including prostitution , drug , and gambling lured adventurous bourgeois men , bohemian artist , journalist , and even transnational revolutionary into the barrio chino .', "In the twenty- first century , nonetheless , as Barcelona 's post- Olympic urban revitalization has spread from the port and historical core outward , this `` Chinatown , '' rechristened as the historic Raval , has been demolished in favor of neoliberal development of sanitized public space , new hotel and tourist ser vice , gentrified residence , and cultural facility including museum , foundation , and the Universitat de Barcelona .", 'The Raval has displaced the chino , its older inhabitant , its bar , social center and memory ( McDonogh 1987 , 2002 ; McNeill 1999 ; Magrinyà and Maza , this volume ) .', 'While this may seem to be a stereo typical Chinatown in location , function , and imagery , it differs from others where we have worked in a fundamental demographic element- the absence of Chinese .', 'Barcelona had few Chinese until the 1990s .', 'Instead , many inhabitant of this dense central zone had arrived from poorer Spanish region of Andalusia and Aragon .', "Journalist Paco Madrid borrowed the sobriquet `` Chinatown '' in 1927 from his reading of San Francisco , using barrio chino as an urban metaphor to evoke an ambience of cosmopolitan mystery and Barcelona 's status as a world city ( McDonogh 1987 ) .", 'When the first wave of Chinese arrived in Spain in the late 1990s , in fact , they settled elsewhere , including an important cluster next to the downtown area of a suburban Barcelona satellite city , Santa Coloma .', "Nonetheless , Barcelonans ' metaphorization of the early twentieth- century location and imagery of Chinatowns , like the demand and pressure of center city development that continue to change the area , are familiar and even suggestive phenomenon for global downtown .", "For more than a decade we have lived , worked , and studied in Chinatowns worldwide , including Chinese enclave in and around Chicago , New York , Sydney , Lima , Los Angeles , Bangkok , Havana , Paris , San José , Panama City , and São Paulo , in addition to our anchorage in Wong 's native Hong Kong and our home in Greater Philadelphia .", 'These Chinatowns sometimes have been background for other project in urban study , mass medium , architecture , and visual culture ( for example , Wong 1991 , 1999 ) ; they also have become interwoven with life of our family and friend .', 'Our experience and investigation underpin the complexity of multisite downtown ethnography through which we have examined shared characteristic of place , function , ideology , and evolution ( McDonogh and Wong 2005 ) .', 'These social , special , and cultural feature embody both Chinese agency and evolving Chinese globalization , although we do not develop such a phenomenological exploration here .', 'Instead , we argue that Chinatowns are deeply enmeshed with the structure and nature of central district that such Chinatowns often border , a relationship mapped decade ago by Burgess and the Chicago School ( Burgess 1925 : 56 ) .', 'Chinatowns provide a multivalent vantage from which to illuminate critical feature of global downtown , including the evolution of central space and function , the competitive market for people and capital they embody , and the play of locality , region , nation- state , and transnational articulation shaping downtown as well as Chinatowns .', 'To analyze the dialectic of Chinatowns and global downtown , we consider five specific theme : ( 1 ) the emergence and movement of Chinatowns in relation to urban core ; ( 2 ) the imagery of Chinatowns as cultural space that illuminates race , immigration , gender , and morality in downtown ; ( 3 ) competing contemporary demand for land , development , and movement , both Chinese and non- Chinese ; ( 4 ) the meaning of Chinatowns in relation to suburban and global network ; and ( 5 ) new Chinatowns as a counterpoint to future downtown .', 'Together , these theme underscore the fact that Chinatowns are not exotic alternative space but offer fundamental insight on downtown as urban/regional place of political economic power , social structure , and cultural meaning constituted by multilayered and contested global flow of good , people , knowledge , and imagery .', 'What is the urban without physical mobility ?', 'COVID-19-induced immobility in the mobile risk society .', 'Since the World Health Organization ’ s ( WHO ) declared the Coronavirus outbreak a global pandemic , the virus has invaded life around the globe .', 'The ongoing health , social and economic crisis that followed forced urban life , business , culture , community etc .', 'into idle mode for week resulting from mandated immobility .', 'What was once taken for granted as the essence of urban experience such as cultural activity , meeting friend , relative and colleague in public space or in professional encounter , disappeared overnight .', 'Free movement became significantly restricted all over the world .', 'It seemed that immobility , social and physical distancing , and isolation were the only antidote to the fast-moving virus .', 'For many people , working from home while also schooling their child and providing social care at a distance , peak activity at maximum physical immobility became the “ new normal.', '” A culture emerged where rule and norm of mobility previously taken for granted were re-negotiated and re-defined .', 'Before the crisis and despite the negative ecological side effect , mobility has been positively connotated as a signifier for progress and success .', 'Under the Corona regime mobility turned into a life-threatening risk .', 'The theory of reflexive modernization , risk society and the mobility paradigm are used to discuss these contemporary shift and transformation .', 'Urban afforestation and favela : A study in A community of Rio de Janeiro , Brazil .', "More than half of the world 's population inhabit urban area , causing significant environmental change .", 'In underdeveloped country this fact is expressed in a subnormal cluster of house of economically poor people ) .The favelas are composed of a mosaic of culture which reflects even in urban afforestation .', 'In this work we characterize the afforestation structure of a favela to understand its ecological and social functionality .', 'The survey was conducted in the favela Morro da Formiga , with an area of approximately 30 ha .', 'It was conducted through a census and using the list of specie , a classification based on 11 parameter was carried out .', '1,042 individual were found , belonging to 110 genera , 148 specie and 42 family .', 'The most abundant specie shows that the planter intend is , leastwise partially , generating an extra-support for community in term of feeding fruit ( 62 % of the subject had this purpose ) .', 'In relation to the nature thereof , the native specie represents 54 % of the total , while the exotic specie 39 % .', 'About 50 % of the tree are in the backyard of house and a few in square and street .', 'It was found that 70 % of individual were planted by resident .', 'Study are needed to identify which native specie can replace community demand currently supplied by exotic specie that have been used for decade .', 'The “ forestation ” in favelas is quite distinct from that implemented by the city hall in more urbanized area .', 'In favelas , the specie reflect more about the knowledge of the obstacle to get good and/or people across to the other side .', 'Bridge are often viewed as an indicator of progress in technical capability , engineering skill as well as a symbol of economic potential of a particular city , region or a country .', 'Often , this is the reason why many urban bridge become the most important infrastructure in some city .', 'This paper discusses several example of bridge which have made a significant impact on the perception of a city and resulted in substantial change to landscape configuration .', 'The following available research method of planning system to resist their closure but , at the same time , demand further controls over high-street bar .', "This paper explores the reason for the decline and the rationale for supporting the continuation of the `` traditional '' English pub .", "Using evidence drawn from a wider study of the relationship between place and youth drinking culture , the paper discusses young adult ' use of pub .", 'While recognising the adverse effect of heavy drinking , argument are put forward in support of the traditional pub as a site for restrained and responsible social interaction for young adult .', 'The paper discusses the issue this raises for the UK planning system in the context of responsibility for social sustainability and public health .', 'Right to the diverse city : Challenge to indigenous participation in urban planning and heritage preservation in Sydney , Australia .', 'Western city are becoming increasingly culturally diverse through the intersection of process such as international migration and the political resurgence of Indigenous people .', 'The challenge remains , however , to shift from physical copresence to equal right to the city .', "This article explores this challenge in an empirical case study of Aboriginal participation in plan for urban development on the fringe of Sydney , Australia 's largest city .", 'The finding from this research highlight the limit of official attempt at recognition that focus on a narrow definition of culture to the detriment of economic and political equity .', 'It provides empirical support for a reconceptualization of recognition to incorporate redistribution in order to redress historical marginalization and dispossession that currently limit participation in the urban polity for diverse group .', 'Conflict Activity in the Neighborhoods of Quebec City ( Canada ) , 1989-2000 .', 'This research focuses on the analysis of the spatial distribution of 149 urban conflict occurring between 1989 and 2000 in Quebec City , Canada .', 'Specifically , the article explores the relationship between the spatial dynamic of the conflicts-in term of frequency , duration , and intensity-and the following four dimension of urban space : social composition ; built environment ; propensity to associate and to voice ; and accessibility to various urban resource .', 'The result of statistical analysis by mean of a Kruskal-Wallis test and a Mann-Whitney test show , regardless of the dimension considered , to what extent certain area are characterized by frequency , duration , or intensity of the conflict activity .', 'Specifically , the result suggest that the degree of involvement of local people in a conflict varies very much depending on the nature of the social composition .', 'Other finding show a relationship between area with a high propensity to associate and to voice and a conflict activity that is more intense , more frequent , but not necessarily longer .', 'These form of social practice are thus testimony to the existence of know-how , i.e.', ', a culture of conflict activity oriented towards efficiency .', 'Extending boundary with meta-design and culture of participation .', 'Human-computer interaction ( HCI ) has refocused many research effort within computer science from a technology-centered view to a human-centered view .', 'The development so far , however , have seen human mostly as user and consumer rather than as active contributor and designer .', 'This paper provides a conceptual framework based on meta-design and culture of participation that democratize design and allows all stakeholder to evolve system to fit their need .', 'It establishes a new extended discourse for HCI research in which information technology are interwoven with human life in all aspect of our existence ( at home , working , teaching , learning , and being a citizen ) .', 'Specific socio-technical environment instantiating the framework in different application domain are described , including : ( 1 ) environment for people with cognitive disability , ( 2 ) table-top computing system for framing and solving complex urban planning problem , ( 3 ) modeling the building of the world in 3D , and ( 4 ) using Smart Grids to support energy sustainability .', 'These example show how metadesign and culture of participation are design approach that allow researcher and practitioner to extend boundary by allowing all stakeholder to have more control over their artifact and by providing opportunity to encourage and to support contribution by many people in personally meaningful activ ities .', 'La Belle Mort en Milieu rural : A report of an ethnographic study of the good death for Quebec rural francophones .', 'An ethnographic study was undertaken in two rural area of Quebec to conceptualize the good death .', 'The finding reveal that a good quality of life for the dying person and his or her family and friend is essential for a good death .', 'The resulting conceptual model emphasized four dimension : physical , spiritual , social , and emotional/psychological .', 'These dimension were determined to be similar to those discovered through a previous urban study , indicating that there may be considerable overlap between good death in rural and urban area .', 'Some finding of this Quebec French-language rural study were similar to those of an Alberta English-language rural study , indicating that rural people may have some common need and interest with regard to the good death .', 'As such , there could be some common element of the good death that transcend culture or ethnicity .', 'Chief among these is the desire of rural people to die at home or in their home community .', 'Public art in Canada : Critical perspective .', 'Arguably , public art is experienced daily by more people than most offering in gallery , yet our notion of what constitutes public art is surprisingly limited .', "Public Art in Canada broadens the critical discussion by exploring public art 's varied mean of engaging with public space and the public sphere .", 'Annie Gérin and James S. McLean have assembled contribution from new and established Canadian scholar , curator , and artist .', 'Each contributor enlivens our understanding of public art as a practice and its place in the social and aesthetic formation of which it is a part .', 'As a result , the book provides an overview of the current debate in the field of public art that are informed by the theory and critical literature of art history , communication study , cultural study , sociology , and urban study .', 'The rigorous essay and original work of art collected in this volume present a compelling demonstration of the strategy , aesthetic and otherwise , used by artist to elicit intellectual , sensual , or emotional response that can only be obtained through artistic practice in public place .', 'Public Art in Canada is a major contribution to the study of Canadian art and culture .', 'Racial projection : cyberspace , public space , and the digital divide .', 'Scholar of critical race study , urban history , and information and communications technology ( ICTs ) share an interest in the relationship between spatial and racial disparity , including the quality of basic infrastructure , degree of connectivity , and participatory culture .', 'However , contemporary research on the digital divide struggles to link historical legacy of uneven development , as well as social justice strategy , with digital participation in urban space .', 'By examining contemporary digital art that critiques the spatial inequality encountered by U.S. racial minority , this article illustrates how public intellectual use ICTs in way that draw upon past strategy to territorialize space for political end .', 'It focuses on digital pop-up , open-air installation that cast image onto public space using projector .', 'Historicizing these new effort illustrates a continuity of tactic engaged by community of color in response to socio-spatial inequality in the urban United States , such as the 1970s mural movement ’ s effort to re-politicize space of exclusion .', 'While existing literature finds that digital inequality result in differential digital human capital , this research indicates that place-based claim , such as digital pop-up , are important site for combatting racial injustice and creating more inclusionary space , especially among youth adult .', 'Disruption , resilience , and vernacular heritage in an Indian city : Pune after the 1961 flood .', 'This paper offers insight into production of vernacular architectural heritage that result from disruption caused by disaster such as a flood in a city .', 'To understand the complexity surrounding vernacular heritage , this paper proposes a conceptual approach derived from Lefebvre ’ s theory of production of space constituting the triad of spatial practice , representation of space and representational space .', 'The strength of this approach in explaining resilience and vernacular architectural heritage is illustrated by examining rehabilitation settlement that evolved after the devastating flood of 1961 in Pune ( a city with a population of 4.5 million ) .', 'The paper focuses on the rehabilitation process that was undertaken in response to the flood and relies on secondary data and primary field observation in the rehabilitated settlement .', 'It was found that these settlement had twofold characteristic ; externally , they directed the trajectory of growth and expansion of the city owing to their strategic location in the periphery around the old core , and internally within , they contributed to reshaping of urban form and vernacular architecture as the affected people reconstructed their house and everyday life .', 'A significant contribution to the making of these rehabilitation space was the state ’ s provision of land for rehabilitation and encouragement to the mechanism of Cooperative Housing as a representation of space incorporating contemporary planning ideology .', 'These settlement comprised the ‘ architecture of the dispossessed ’ where material culture and imagery informed different and hybrid form of house but these were a departure from the past as they needed to accommodate rebuilding and expansion while serving aspiration of those affected .', 'The right to walk in city , a comparative review of Macau , Lisbon and Las Vegas .', 'Purpose : The purpose of this paper is to analyze walking activity and recent effort at augmenting walkability condition in the city of Macau , Lisbon and Las Vegas .', 'Design/methodology/approach : The methodology consisted mostly of in-loco observation , pedestrian count and extensive review of the literature , city plan and regulation .', 'Finding : The finding include the need to properly design , maintain and retrofit pedestrian facility , while reducing safety conflict among street user as well as the establishment and the nurturing of a culture of walking .', 'Research limitations/implications : A fivefold international walkability research agenda with implication for other city around the world is established : the value and the need for comparative study and best practice ; the need for urban design intervention ; the cultivation of attractiveness and aesthetic ; the implementation of safety , construction and maintenance criterion ; and responsible funding program .', 'Practical implication : This paper has twofold implication for stakeholder with direct responsibility in the design , planning , building and maintenance of street and public space , and for those who simply use those place at their own discretion .', 'Social implication : A succinct set of recommendation include the need to augment endogeneity , the need to make city for people and not for automobile and commitment to resolving pedestrian safety concern .', 'Originality/value : This paper discusses the factor affecting street vibrancy from both a stakeholder ’ s and a user ’ s perspective .', 'The fundamental and inalienable right to walk is analyzed using the WPPFUS framework ( walking level , purpose , primacy of walking , facility , unique feature and safety concern ) .', 'Festive City : Multi-Dimensional Perspective .', 'Until recently there has been limited attention paid in urban study to feature that relate to sensory , not material feature , to consumption not production , pleasure not work , and to episodic rather than permanent characteristic .', 'However festival , episodic event lasting a few day , do provide such function .', 'They take people outside their routine behaviours of work , leisure and family , providing joy , excitement and new experience , sometimes linking to historical tradition .', 'Although such event have always been part of the life of the bigger place , new valuation of their utility have led to an enormous growth in such activity in recent decade , both in number within city , and many other urban place , adding to their vitality and often providing major economic return .', 'A review of the variety of festival show that most fall into six main type , linked to temporal or cyclical , religious , political , tradition-heritage , new culture and lifestyle function , although some may overlap the category and others have morphed from one type to another through time .', 'A multidimensional model of the nature of festival based on eight component provides a basis for assessing their varied character and reveals their often contradictory nature and conflicted consequence .', 'Small business and the vitality of main street .', 'People use the neighborhood Main Street for shopping but also for other leisurely activity , active and passive engagement , social affiliation and interaction , sensory stimulation , and relaxation .', 'Traditionally , small business have made up a fair share of business on Main Street .', 'Small business have been an integral part of the American culture of entrepreneurship , individualism , and self-reliance and have played an important role in American economic development .', 'Community development program recommend supporting small business for their social and economic benefit .', 'This paper examines the role of small business in supporting public life on the neighborhood Main Street .', 'The study urn conducted in two city and one town in the Boston , Massachusetts , metropolitan area .', 'Extensive behavior mapping and interview were conducted to determine the relationship between social interaction and small business .', 'The finding expand our understanding of the social value of small business and suggest a strong relationship between small business and the vitality of Main Street as a result offour quality of small business : uniqueness , engagement , friendliness , and responsiveness .', 'These finding have implication for urban design , community planning , and economic development policy because they suggest that small business influence their immediate public space by paying more attention to it than large business .', 'Small business provide quality that help make Main Street a good place for people to interact .', 'Julius Caesar in Western Culture .', 'This book explores the significance of Julius Caesar to different period , society and people from the 50s BC through to the twenty-first century .', '• This interdisciplinary volume explores the significance of Julius Caesar to different period , society and people .', '• Ranges over the field of religious , military , and political history , archaeology , architecture and urban planning , the visual art , and literary , film , theatre and cultural study .', '• Examines representation of Caesar in Italy , France , Germany , Britain , and the United States in particular .', "• Object of analysis range from Caesar 's own commentary on the Gallic war , through Shakespeare 's Julius Caesar , and image of Caesar in Italian fascist popular culture , to contemporary cinema and current debate about American empire .", '• Edited by a leading expert on the reception of ancient Rome .', '• Includes original contribution by international expert on Caesar and his reception .', 'On the trail of comparative urbanism : Square dance and public space in China .', 'Civic culture in public space occupy a central place in the theorisation of social relation and social interaction in the modern city .', 'But theoretical perspective formulated in Western urban context tend to assume clear-cut distinction between Gesellschaft and Gemeinschaft , and between the public and private realm , and assume that encounter automatically steers people towards the ethic and politics of difference .', 'These optic represent epistemology which for the most part address the socio-spatial nexus in Euro-American urban modernity , and are ill equipped for elucidating the contingent , improvised relationship between public space and multiple urban modernity beyond the West .', 'This paper works on the trail of the comparative urbanism and delves into configuration of publicness in “ square dance ” in reform-era urban China .', 'Starting from historical conception of publicness in China but being mindful of how they are reconfigured and renegotiated amid a rapid transition towards urban modernity , this paper argues that publicness in reform-era China is of a largely experimental , negotiated nature .', 'On the one hand , square dance exceeds sociological account and category which produce epistemological opposition between stranger and community , between public self and intimate affiliation .', 'It incubates sentiment of collectivism that overcome anonymity and strangeness but do not contradict the ethos of individualism in the modern city .', 'On the other hand , square dance can be conceptualised as an active process of urban learning , in which people are motivated to reflect over what code , rule , and ethic are needed for governing urban public .', 'In all , this paper aims to broaden the conceptual spectrum of the idea of public space and urban civic culture through comparative analysis and theorisation .', 'The information , practice and view in this article are those of the author ( s ) and do not necessarily reflect the opinion of the Royal Geographical Society ( with IBG ) .', 'Decolonial Hip Hop : Indigenous Hip Hop and the disruption of settler colonialism .', 'Contemporary Detroit has gone through many changes–or so it appears .', 'From street lined with vehicle made by Chrysler , Ford , and General Motors and driven by the nearly 2 million people who called the city home in 1950 to certain part of the city looking like ghost town ; from a population that dwindled to 670,000 to the revival of downtown .', 'Yet , what has been remarkably consistent is the invisibility of the Motor City ’ s Indigenous population .', 'Indeed , Indigenous erasure , combined with rhetoric and policy that continue to marginalize and subjugate African Americans in Detroit , create a place rooted in multiple colonialism .', 'This essay examines how Detroit ’ s Indigenous Hip Hop artists resist settler colonialism through art , creativity , and culture as well as the practice of Detroit 2.0 , a rhetoric and policy used by Detroit elites to reimagine it as a place of opportunity .', 'By making visible the connection between blackness and indigeneity , as well as by linking the struggle of colonized people in Detroit to those in Palestine , Indigenous artist are not only asserting their humanity and challenging the longstanding idea of their erasure , but also constructing pathway for artist and activist to disrupt the effect of multiple colonialism that continue to marginalize people of colour in urban area .', 'Detroit ’ s Indigenous Hip Hop artist make socially conscious music and also participate as activist in the city of Detroit .', 'They serve as a window onto contemporary Indigenous identity , represent an exemplar of the urban Indigenous experience , and combine activism with art in a variety of way .', '« Smart settlement » : The development concept in a new socio-economic and informatiologic condition .', 'Strengthen the tie between rural and urban area is very important for sustainable development : because « Smart Villages » can not develop in isolation , they should be included in development strategy of region and territory .', 'In accordance with « Smart Settlement » concept , the existing rural settlement should be coherence in the new socio-economic and informatiologic condition .', 'Review on the Traditional Us and Potential of Totora ( Schoenoplectus Californicus ) as Construction Material .', 'The recent advance in the wood construction field have demonstrated the feasibility and advantage of using wood-based material in tall building structure and other constructive us , which could lead to a net reduction in CO2eq emission of the construction sector by replacing high-energy consuming material like concrete or steel , with wood and biomass-based material .', 'Among these biomass-based material .", "Envisioned in 1947 but not completed until the mid-1960s , the arch today attracts million of tourist annually and is one of the world 's most widely recognized structure .", 'By weaving together social , political , and cultural history , historian Tracy Campbell uncovers the complicated and troubling history of the beloved structure .', 'This compelling book explores how a medley of player epistemological step introducing this technology and the possibility for those studying the health effect of landscape .', 'Yet , as in similar interdisciplinary effort there are always risk : question are very general or result are misinterpreted .', "The present commentary aim , using example and a simple but rigorous language , to help the audience of Landscape and Urban Planning boldly be involved in this exciting interdisciplinary effort to help neuroscientist understand how the brain work .", 'Constructing the dynamo of dixie : Race , urban planning , and cosmopolitanism in neighbor and public official .', "Knapp suggests that `` diasporic placemaking '' -defined as the everyday practice through which uprooted people create new community of security and belonging-is a integral lens on Patrick Geddes .', 'Patrick Geddes is a significant figure in the landscape and urban planning canon .', 'In addition to situating city within a regional context and advancing a socioecological understanding of urbanization , he viewed city as the principal artifact of , and theater wherein , human culture evolves .', 'This expansive view of city may be one of the more challenging aspect of Geddes ’ legacy to assimilate .', 'Working during a late 19th and early 20th century period when the limitation of modernity were becoming increasingly apparent , much of Geddes ’ aspirational thinking can be seen as an effort to create what he described as a “ larger modernism.', '” In this regard , Geddes can be counted amongst those whom we portray as integrative holistic thinker , people whose worldview draws them toward meaning-making narrative and framework that include the many dimension of the human condition .', 'Today , a new generation of holistic approach called “ metatheories ” – and “ integral theory ” in particular – provides an orienting lens through which to review , assess , and potentially extend the work of Geddes in the 21st century .', 'Towards that goal , this article first provides an introductory primer to some of Geddes ’ noteworthy “ thinking machine ” as well as integral theory .', 'We then assess correspondence between the two , focusing on Interdisciplinary Holism ; Evolution , Development and Complex Systems ; Human Agency and Ethics ; and Spirituality .', 'A closing discussion addresses prospect for future research , environmental challenge and the concentration of human in city .', 'Eco-development and environmental spatial planning .', 'Development is directly related to the spatial planning ( regional and urban ) .', 'Nowadays , humanity faces a multidimensional crisis , socio-economic crisis , cultural crisis , which is directly related to the environmental one .', 'In the last few decade , the current development model has been questioned by international organization and scientist of various specialization .', 'Sustainable development or ecodevelopment approaching interdisciplinary the problem explores the exit from the socio-economic and environmental crisis .', 'The purpose of this study is to comprehensively examine the content of ecodevelopment and to express it in simple word , so as to be understood by people .', 'In particular , it aims to review and clarify the concept of eco-development , defining its content in its entirety , considering it together with the role of spatial planning ( regional and urban ) and suggesting method of organization of society , to provide better quality of life and achieve the exit from the crisis .', 'A need to create a new model based on the concept of ecosystem arises from the research , where the law of nature and culture of each place will be seriously considered in formulating development policy .', 'A key-element for ecological spatial planning is the carrying capacity of ecosystem .', "The aim of spatial planning appears to be the sustainability of natural system in order to be able to sustain and supply the anthropogenic system , meeting the 'real ' human need .", 'For the implementation of these and the exit from the crisis of utmost importance the role of education is highlighted in creating active citizen , who are required to undertake , through self-organization [ 1 , 2 ] , to promote eco-development and eco-design .', "Urban survey and planning in twentieth-century Japan : Wajiro Kon 's `` Modernology '' and its descendant .", "Since the nineteenth century , the survey of people 's way of life were the basic method to study big city .", 'Even though the survey were motivated by social awareness , the result was mainly analyzed by scientific , political and economical interest , and often was devided from the cultural and psychological research of urban phenomenon .', 'However , as it is obvious that these are closely integrated , the method and idea of the urban survey reflect the bilateral relationship between perceiving and conceiving urban space .', 'This study will explain how urban survey transformed and reflected the idea and interest in urban space and its study in Japan from the end of the nineteenth century to the 1980s .', "Especially in examining a research named ``
