create urban study with cultural identity by conducting survey and integrating with international theory .", "`` Modernology '' described the emerging urban space and people 's way of life in Tokyo , and was often recognized as a method of popular culture .", 'However , Modernology represented critical aspect of social space and encouraged people to be more engaged with it .', 'While modernist architect distanced from urban reality to solve its problem scientifically , Modernology was often recognized as their counter part .', 'When we recognize its primal objective and influence on later generation in seeking the social ethos in the dialectical progress with the bilateral approach between surveying and planning , we can understand the alternative aspect of Japanese urban study .', 'From the First Five-Year Plan to the Cultural Revolution : the pre-reform urban transformation of Hangzhou , China .', "Pre-reform Chinese city base their uniqueness in urban transformation on Mao 's duality of utopian and revolutionary ideal and pragmatic and economized approach in practice .", "Through the lens of urban economy , population management , and city planning , this paper examines China 's pre-reform urban transformation .", "By the case study of Hangzhou , this research reveals that urban development was driven by a diverse set of force devised by the communist state to configure the urban condition and control people 's daily life in pursuit of radical socialist goal .", 'The control from the state and other pertinent force led to the actual outcome of political-economic ambition and spatial policy rhetoric .', "It was an inherent feature of the society and economy to go outside of the state 's control , and the unintended consequence were unavoidable .", 'The state had to revise their strategy , the outcome of which were again to be tested by time .', 'An iterative process determined the urban transformation of Chinese city .', 'CulTech2015 : Cultural diversity and technology design .', 'With globalization and technological advance , people are increasingly coming into contact with others from different cultural background , particularly in place-based and virtual community .', "Yet , cultural diversity - the diversity of community member ' cultural background - offers both significant benefit and challenge in the design , usage and evaluation of technology .", 'In this one-day workshop , we explore the role of cultural diversity in potentially informing , supporting , challenging or impacting the design of such as computer science , urban design , interactive art , anthropology and social science who share a common interest in exploring the design space of ICTs , culture and community .', 'Gender and encounter and exchange where group with different interest converge .', 'Accessible and open to everyone , they are designed for a variety of us where people can participate in public life .', 'They also contribute to the collective identity of the community as they represent the culture and value of its user .', 'In recent decade , the different way in which public space are used have been the subject of study from different discipline including but not limited to anthropology , geography , sociology , architecture , and urban planning .', 'It has been argued that the way in which urban life is lived and experienced change according to demographic of its user such as age , sex , and social class.In this study , the use of public space based on gender difference is analyzed using space syntax methodology .', 'The context of the study is the city center of a small Anatolian town , Balikesir , which is located in western Turkey .', 'The methodology of the study includes a visibility analysis of the historic city center and pedestrian movement observation on the selected location within this center .', 'The result indicate that male user dominate the city center at all time while the density of woman user is much lower , and is even lower than that of teenager .', 'A major contribution of this study is the finding that there is a discrepancy between the most integrated street in term of visibility and the most densely used one .', 'Given that the user of this small Anatolian town are mostly its resident , this finding suggests that for route-choice decision , pedestrian utilize prior knowledge and experience of the city center more than the visual information provided to them via the geometry of the space .', 'Sým-bolon : Symbol-action-context .', 'The Greek root for the word symbol are sým ( thrown ) and bolon ( together ) .', "In the recent idealized and abstract turn of the social science towards 'discourse ' , it has been forgotten how in their production meaning carried by symbol are precisely thrown together with material , social , and interactive circumstance .", "Urban ethnographer are well equipped to see the signifier not as 'free-floating ' but as always engaged - through its intransigent opacity as well as its transparent relevancy - in socially situated context and social action as it finds its signified .", 'Utilizing example from my own ethnographic work , this article presents an urban and class-specific view of how symbol are thrown together with the circumstance of material want , social pressure , and ideological abjection suffered by young people at the bottom of social space in deprived urban area .', "The struggle for survival here produces cultural form and meaning which are no less creative and complex than the recognized formal creation of 'art ' but are formed in quite different way under pressure and compression , rather than in 'choice ' and 'freedom ' .", 'Toward diversity that works : Building community through art and culture .', 'City , neighborhood , college campus , and even business often herald diversity-the tolerance and celebration of difference-as a selling point , making the case that it broadens perspective , enriches life , promotes compassion and even leads to innovation .', 'But just what does it take to have diversity , particularly racial and ethnic diversity , in a context where racial and ethnic group have been divided by racism , discrimination , competition for resource , and fear of change ?', 'How can tolerance and celebration of difference that leads to compassion and innovation thrive in such a context ?', 'Within urban planning and related field , concern for fostering racial and ethnic diversity has resulted typically in attention to eradicating housing segregation and redistributing wealth and economic opportunity ( Cashin 2004 ; De Souza Briggs 2005 ; Rawlings et al .', '2004 ) .', 'While these are area that warrant analysis and action , not enough attention has been paid to understanding or affecting the actual process by which people express or work to change racial ethnic dynamic within and among different group .', 'Much of this is being achieved through art and cultural participation .', 'This chapter uses example of art and cultural activity in community around the United States to discuss how art and cultural activity-through which people affirm , preserve , challenge , and transform racial ethnic identity and dynamics-is a precondition for true diversity , the tolerance and celebration of difference , and how that precondition is being achieved on the ground .', 'Based on these example , the chapter also discusses important implication for urban planner and policymakers concerned with effort to create more equitable and diverse community .', 'My ultimate argument is that , without consideration for and inclusion of art and cultural activity , such effort are inherently flawed .', 'I draw in my discussion from a decade of research on the presence and role of art and cultural activity in many different type of community around the United States , including moderate- and low-income neighborhood , community of color , and immigrant community .', 'This research has included participant observation in cultural event , hundred of interview , and score of focus group discussion with neighborhood resident , community leader , artist , people who run cultural organization and others involved in a range of community institution .', 'The research-which focus always on the kind of cultural activity that people value in their community and the reason why these are valued- is being done by the Art and Culture in Communities Project ( ACIP ) .1 Before launching into a discussion about how cultural participation contributes to diversity in community , a few word are in order about how we interpret art and culture in our work .', "A high-rise vernacular in Singapore 's housing development board housing .", 'Vernacular architecture is commonly believed to be a quaint representation of the history and tradition of a culture , built by average people using traditional technology over a long period of time but in Singapore there are several indication that the Modernist high rise housing and new town have become a new vernacular .', 'The factor that support this point of view are : 1 ) the ubiquity of the high rise and new town way of life ; 2 ) a shared value system and culture within the new town that is shaped by and reflected in the architecture and planning of the new town ; 3 ) the importance of relationship between space in the new town ; 4 ) the ability of the architecture and planning of new town to adapt to change within Singaporean society ; 5 ) the acceptance , legitimacy , and identification of the high-rise way of life by Singaporeans .', 'A vernacular in Singapore based upon high-rise housing and new town profoundly impacts the understanding of vernacular architecture , Modernist planning , and the industrialization of former Third World country in response to the globalism .', 'The study of urban history in the People ’ s Republic of China .', 'Since the establishment of the People ’ s Republic of China in 1949 , most of the topic associated with the study of urban history have languished largely unstudied beneath a pall of ideologically based neglect .', 'The list of understudied subject includes urban population , physical structure , social structure , economic activity , urban politics , urban planning and the environment , and urban culture .', 'This lack of interest in urban history directly reflects the emphasis on the role of the peasantry as a creative force in Chinese history .', 'The history of Chinese peasant uprising and war became the focus of attention and left little interest for what change might have taken place in urban setting .', 'Today , a combination of force has generated considerable change in the institutional structure of historical study in China , as well as compelling historian to reconsider established research preference .', 'In this atmosphere it appears that for the first time since 1949 topic that concern urban historian in the West and Japan are receiving serious attention in the People ’ s Republic of China .', 'While it is still too early to speak of urban history in China , continuation of current trend in historical research over the next five to ten year will almost certainly bring this specialization into existence .', 'A people-based density perspective on physical/virtual world space in the microcosmic city .', 'Electronic and cyber-based method of conducting transaction have reduced the role of propinquity across a large spectrum of civic activity .', 'Simultaneously , however , technological advance affecting many realm of commerce and culture have increased the necessity and desire for face-to-face contact .', 'Ceding substantial portion of our time to the virtual realm has , curiously , enhanced the importance of local-scale , physical world interaction .', 'In this paper we focus on an elemental concept in urban development and planning : population density .', 'Given that individual life are now carried out within both physical and virtual space , we detail the advantage for land use policy of deploying density measure that are “ people-based ” rather than areal based .', 'Such metric provide a rich perspective reflecting planning-relevant geography of spatial interaction .', 'Rather than restricting density calculation to pre-specified areal unit , such as municipality , neighborhood , census tract , city block , or land parcel , we propose the deployment of “ perceived ” density surface that into the formulation and evaluation of land use decision .', 'In addition to being useful for many practical purpose , threshold-based perceived density provides an interesting conceptual framework for examining how individual experience and interact within a spectrum of surrounding , microcosmic world space .', 'Using decision support system to enable crowd identify neighborhood issue and its 'However , due to security problem in such war-ravaged country as Afghanistan , the traditional form of public participation in the planning process are untenable .', 'In particular , due to gathering space difficulty and culture issue in Afghanistan , woman and religious minority are restricted from joining male-dominated powerholders ’ face-to-face meeting which are nearly always held in fixed quality is one of the important aspect of urban design .', 'It is usually evaluated based on how loud the urban environment is .', "However , this approach does not consider people 's perception of the urban acoustic environment .", 'Therefore , a different method has been developed based on the perception of the acoustic environment using the concept of soundscape .', 'Soundscape is defined as the acoustic environment perceived by people who are part of the environment .', 'This approach considers the relationship between the sound source , the environment , and the people .', "The analysis of soundscape considers many aspect such as cultural aspect , people 's expectation , people 's experience of space , and social aspect .", 'Soundscape affects many aspect of human life such as culture , health , and the quality of life .', 'Urban soundscape management and planning must be integrated with the other aspect of urban design , both in the design and the improvement stage .', 'The soundscape concept seeks to make the acoustic environment as pleasant as possible in a space with or without uncomfortable sound source .', 'Soundscape planning includes the design of physical feature to achieve a positive perceptual outcome .', 'It is vital to gather data regarding the relationship between human and the component of a soundscape , e.g.', ', sound source , feature of the physical environment , the function of a space , and the expectation of the sound source .', 'The data can be measured and gathered using several soundscape evaluation method .', 'Soundscape evaluation is usually conducted using in-situ survey and laboratory experiment using a multi-speaker system .', 'Although these method have been validated and are widely used in soundscape analysis , there are some limitation in the application .', 'The in-situ survey needs to be done at one time with many people at the same time because it is hard to replicate the acoustic environment .', 'Conversely , the laboratory experiment does not have a problem with the repetition of the experiment .', 'This method requires a room with a multi-speaker reproduction system .', 'This project used a different method to analyse soundscape developed using headphone via the internet .', 'The internet system for data gathering has been established ; a website has enabled to reproduce high-quality audio and it has a system to design online questionnaire .', 'Furthermore , the development of a virtual reality system allows the reproduction of virtual audio-visual stimulus on a website .', 'Although the website has an established system to gather the required data , the problem is the validation of the reproduction system for soundscape analysis , which needs to be done with consideration of several factor : the suitable recording system , the effect of headphone variation , the calibration of the system , and the perception result from internet-based acoustic environment reproduction .', 'This study aims to develop and validate a web-based urban soundscape evaluation method .', 'By using this method , the experiment can be repeated easily and data can be gathered from many respondent .', 'Furthermore , the simplicity of the system allows for the application by the stakeholder in urban design .', 'The data gathered from this system is important for the design of an urban area with consideration of the acoustic aspect .', "'Auraldiversity ' : Defining a hearing- centred perspective to socially equitable design of the built environment .", 'Historically , sound , soundscape and human hearing have collectively received litt le att ention in the design of urban space and place , particularly with regard to the psychological and sociological impact of hearing on the experience of individual in the built environment .', "It is proposed that the sonic consideration which have been made in urban design are commonly developed within an assumption of otologically normal hearing , and , more broadly , without the acknowledgement of the actual diversity in people 's auditory and sensory ability .", "Existing consideration of sound and hearing within inclusive design research , particularly in the built environment , are grounded in an 'auraltypical ' perspective where the primary focus is hearing individual or those with hearing loss .", "This position supposes to some degree that an idealized otological profi le and consistent model of hearing profi ciency is shared amongst all citizen and engenders a culture of urban design driven by 'good/bad ' ear and homogenized sonic interaction .", "This paper introduces the theoretical paradigm of 'auraldiversity ' - an emerging agenda that acknowledges the diversity of human hearing and the multitude of element that place the hearing modality within a state of constant fl ux .", "The paper situates this theoretical perspective within the context of the built environment through the mapping of three 'auraldivergent ' hearing profi le .", 'Each profi le charts the lived sonic experience of a d/Deaf or disabled individual in the built environment .', 'The paper concludes by positioning the auraldiversity paradigm as a catalyst in the development of a hearing-centred approach to inclusive design research , a new agenda where the opportunity for more socially and sonically equitable design of the built environment is established .', "Lewis Mumford 's Urbanism and the Problem of Environmental Modernity .", 'This essay reconsiders the early career of Lewis Mumford and the ) and their inherent hierarchy ( H ) .', 'To verify this approach , we conducted a series of case study applied to eight pair of image including Leonardo da Vinci ’ s Mona Lisa and Jackson Pollock ’ s developed vehicle choice model identifies the effect of the built environment characteristic on vehicle type based on vehicle size , controlling for socio-economic attribute .', 'People residing in neighborhood characterized with higher density in population , employment , and intersection and with fewer single detached housing are more likely to own smaller vehicle as compared to the one living in suburban area .', 'A good transit accessibility would decrease the probability of owning pickup truck .', 'The SAR model reveals how the vehicle a household owns is used is still slightly positively associated with his/her neighbour ’ s vehicle use after controlling for the effect of the built environment and socio-economics .', 'The model will enable decision maker to estimate potential change in vehicle fleet composition under changing built environment scenario and neighborhood culture in using private vehicle .', 'Although the model result and estimated coefficient may be different for different urban area , the methodology is transferable to other community , locally and nationally .', 'Resonating the ‘ culture ’ debate in urban planning .', 'In this era of rapid urbanisation , an understanding of the role of culture in advancing urban planning and development is important for effective urban management , especially in Africa where the culture of informality is dominant .', 'Yet , there is a dearth of research on the relationship between the culture of informality and urban planning in Africa .', 'The purpose of this paper is twofold : ( i ) to analyse the influence of the culture of informality on urban planning and development in Kumasi , a rapidly urbanizing city in Ghana ; and ( ii ) to explore how local people perceive and consider their culture of informality in the context of urban planning as a tool for development .', 'Using mixed method research approach ( survey , agency interview , document review , and participant observation ) , finding indicate that four out of five identified value of the culture of informality have statistically significant positive influence on urban planning and development .', 'However , there is institutional neglect of the culture of informality in urban planning due to limited understanding of the relevance of informality in urban development , contributing to environmental and socio-economic challenge ( e.g.', ', slums proliferation , extinction of green space ) .', 'Youth culture and identity in northern thailand : Fitting in and sticking out .', 'Youth Culture and Identity in Northern Thailand examines how young people in urban Chiang Mai construct an identity at the intersection of global capitalism , state ideology , and local culture .', 'Drawing on over 15 year of ethnographic research , the book explores the impact of rapid urbanisation and modernisation on contemporary Thai youth , focusing on conspicuous youth subculture , drug use ( especially methamphetamine use ) , and violent youth gang .', 'Anjalee Cohen shows how young Thai people construct a specific youth identity through consumerism and symbolic boundary – in particular through enduring rural/urban distinction .', 'The suggestion is that the formation of subculture and “ deviant ” youth practice , such as drug use and violence , are not necessarily form of resistance against the dominant culture , nor a pathological response to dramatic social change , as typically understood in academic and public discourse .', 'Rather , Cohen argues that such practice are attempt to “ fit in and stick out ” in an anonymous urban environment .', 'This volume is relevant to scholar in Thai Studies , Southeast Asian Studies , Anthropology , Sociology , Urban Studies , and Development Studies , particularly those with an interest in youth , drug , and gang .', 'The role of social and cultural interaction between Russian and Chinese student in changing the educational space of the Russian University .', 'Student as a special social group can be considered as a guide of interaction between the partner country of Russia and China as representative of different culture and different mentality .', 'Interaction between Russian and Chinese university in the scientific and educational sphere has specific feature and reflects the general mechanisms of functioning in social and cultural environment .', 'The socio-cultural context of such interaction is the life activity of megalopolis , regional feature and it is related to the socio-cultural tradition of people relationship .', 'The general purpose of the study was to identify change in interaction between Russian and Chinese student studying in a Russian University .', 'The study conducted in Russian and Chinese University .', 'The research methodology combined both qualitative and quantitative approach .', 'The primary data was collected using questionnaire and in-depth interview .', 'Three hundred and ninety respondent - Russian student and five hundred respondent - Chinese student , were questioned on the basis of quota sampling .', 'Depth interview were conducted with 20 expert .', 'The study has revealed some actual issue and tendency of social interaction in the educational sphere .', 'It has a temporal character and it is developed in a single educational environment of universities-partners of Russia and China .', 'The study has identified the structure of social interaction , consisting of five level : 1 .', 'At the level of connectivity , social relation between social and ethnic group ( in this case , Russian and Chinese student ) are established on the basis of their value .', '2 .', 'At the level of translation , understanding of the value of another ( different ) culture through the interpretation of cultural code ( cultural sign ) takes place .', '3 .', "At the level of transcendence , transition from one 's cultural system to another , the development of positive experience and knowledge of another cultural system take place .", '4 .', 'At the level of adaptation , an interiorization , application in behaviour and activity of value of other cultural system take place .', '5 .', 'At the level of inter cultural dialogue , an organization of effective and fruitful cooperation between social and ethnic group and their representative based on an understanding of the universal value takes place .', 'The five level of social interaction identified by research in the joint educational environment of Russian and Chinese university allow not only to find out the content component of the structure of social and cultural interaction , but also to consider its dynamic and development .', 'Our research has identified a set of factor that affect the functioning of the interaction between Russian and Chinese student structure : geopolitical situation , cost and quality of education , adaptation of training course for foreigner , comfort of the educational environment of University , the complexity of learning of the host country language , the prestige of education .', 'This model of interaction between social and ethnic group of Russian and Chinese student being representative of partner university is confirmed by the real practice of scientific and educational cooperation between Russian and Chinese university .', 'Joint form of University work have been successfully tested and activity that have become event of inter cultural dialogue have been organized .', 'Myth and Reality of Adaptable city .', 'Contemporary City as Adaptable Hybrid .', 'Global space - both natural and cultural - is the greatest good belonging to the human community .', 'The said community has , therefore , the right and responsibility to protect it , wisely and in solidarity , from wasteful exploitation .', 'The postulate of public utility of this good must also presume such mutual conditioning of the right and obligation of private owner that would minimise the chance of their infringement of collective interest .', 'The culture of space management became an important measure of cultural level of society at the turn of the 20th century , perhaps one of those moment which decide upon the future of our civilisation .', "The conclusion that large agglomeration in particular are `` incorrigible zone of spatial and social pathology , from which we need to escape into pristine area and there create a more perfect living environment '' is unacceptable , also from the ethical point of view , both as regard the people living in those agglomeration and nature .", 'As far as what has been created by man is concerned , we need to assume that we are able to control and improve this material creation of our civilisation .', "Such is the fundamental requirement of sustainable development - a difficult , but probably the only way of managing `` the global village '' in the millennium that has just commenced .", "The spatial structure of the contemporary city as a whole is a broken form : it has formally expressive and perfectly composed element , it has mutilated composition , chaotic arrangement and `` lost space '' , finally , it has space that as yet have not been properly used compositionally and are still waiting for their role in the whole .", 'A broken form - in compliance with the principle of irreversibility - may not return to its original composition .', 'Thinking about the future of the city and taking into account the irrefutable fact that a considerable part of the built environment of tomorrow already exists today , we should ask ourselves the question : can it adopt , as a whole , a composition of a different kind ?', 'If the urbanised environment , being the basic one , is also to become a full-value environment for human existence , it will require continuous and universal improvement of its quality , as well as new strategy , method and scenario for rational organisation of urbanised space that will be able to meet new challenge .', "It seems that `` dramaturgically consistent logic of composition '' may become an original formula of urban public space .", "Scenario built on the basis of the city `` genotype '' , in which urban `` layer of memory '' are the basis for adaptive transformation .", 'Overview of relevant regional culture study ( the Krasnoyarsk krai ) : Challenge and approach .', 'This article presents the result of the analysis of relevant regional culture study .', 'The purpose of this analysis was to determine which area of cultural research in the modern world are the most promising one in term of studying the culture of the region .', 'Not only the article of foreign author were particular example therein , but also culture study conducted directly in the Krasnoyarsk Krai .', 'The overview allows to conclude that study in the following area are relevant for the Krasnoyarsk Krai at the moment : ethnocultural process , ethnic identity and its development , transformation of ethnic identity , language and culture of indigenous people of the North , migration process , urban study , contemporary art , art mediation , musical folklore , the concept of “ war ” and “ peace ” .', 'From urban national park to natured city in the global south : The quest for naturbanity .', 'This important volume focuses on the sensitive issue of interrelationship between national park situated near or within urban area and their urban environment .', 'It engages with both urban and conservation issue and and compares four national park located in four large city in the global South : Rio de Janeiro , Cape Town , Mumbai , and Nairobi .', 'Though primarily undertaken as academic research , the project has intensively collaborated with the institution in charge of these park .', "The comparative structure of this volume is also original and unique : each of the chapter incorporates insight from all four site as far as possible.The term `` naturbanity '' expresses the necessity for city endowed with a national park to integrate it into their functioning .", 'Conversely , such park must take into account their location in an urban environment , both as a source of heavy pressure on nature and as a nexus of incentive to support their conservation .', "The principle of non-exclusivity , that is , neither the city nor the park has a right nor even the possibility to negate the other 's presence , summarizes the main argument of this book .", "Naturbanity thus blurs the old `` modern '' dichotomy of nature/culture : animal and human being can often jump the physical and ideological wall separating many park from the adjacent city .", 'The 13 chapter and substantive introduction of this volume discuss various aspect of naturbanity : the history of park creation ; interaction between people and park ; urban governance and park ; urban conservation model ; wildlife management ; environmental education ; and so on .', 'This is a must-read for student and researcher interested in social ecology , social geography , conservation , urban planning and ecological policy .', 'Use of Daylight and Aesthetic Image of Glass Facades in Contemporary Buildings .', 'The paper deal with the architecture of contemporary building in respect to their aesthetic image created by the use of natural light .', 'Sustainability is regarded as a governing principle of contemporary architecture , where daylighting is an important factor as it affects energy consumption and environmental quality of the space inside a building .', 'Environmental awareness of architecture , however , involves a much wider and more holistic view of design .', 'The quality of sustainable architecture can be considered in its aesthetic and cultural context with regard to landscape , local tradition , and connection to the surrounding world .', 'This approach is associated with the social mission of architecture , i.e .', 'providing appropriate space for living , facilitating social relation and having positive impact on people .', 'The purpose of the research is to study the use of daylight in creating an aesthetic image of contemporary building .', 'The author focuses mainly on public building largely dedicated to art and culture which satisfy high functional and aesthetic requirement .', 'The paper examines the genesis and current trend in the aesthetic image of modern building which use daylight as the main design strategy , focusing on the issue of glass facade .', 'The main attention is given to the shaping of representative public area which feature the glass facade .', 'The research has been based on a case study , critical review of literature review , observation and synthesis .', 'The study identifies and classifies different approach to using daylight in these area and highlight change in the aesthetic of architecture made of glass , which uses daylight as the main design strategy .', 'These change are primarily caused by the development and spreading of new glazing material and the use of digital method of design .', 'The influence of light and its mode depends on glass material but also on the local condition of the site , and has a significant impact on the relationship between architecture and its natural and cultural environment .', 'The subordination of architectural concept to the idea of natural lighting builds the relationship between form , function and the context of architecture , and is expressed in its structural , material and spatial property , and in the resulting aesthetic order .', 'Search for new architectural solution is defined by local topographical , climatic , biological and cultural condition .', 'The architecture subordinate to the conception of contribution of light corresponds to the aesthetic aspiration of sustainability .', 'Modality environment : A concept for sustainability and vitality in the multi-modal city .', 'This paper reviews an idea of vital local high-street place with their walking space and economy founded in interface between neighbourhood and city ( between walking and public transport/bicycle movement infrastructure ) .', "It then extends this idea to higher scale , considering interface between city and region , which have already been theorised as 'mobility environment ' ( Bertolini & Dijst 2003 ) focusing on place and modal transfer point in new regional city of high mobility .", 'High-streets and mobility environment are both central place and our way of describing them suggests a new definition of central place as interface between normative ( but also technically-infrastructually supported ) political space ( neighbourhood , city and region ) .', 'It also clarifies the role of scale in place theory and we will deal with this in a following paper .', "Here we introduce idea of 'modality place ' and 'modality environment ' .", "The 'modality environment ' is concerned with areal and network transportation form in whole fabric and resulting condition of sustainability and urbanity .", 'Modality environment are understood in term of transportation network and the social and functional factor ( like sustainability and urbanity ) they produce .', 'Modality environment are seen as lived environment built around movement infrastructure grid that distribute everyday urban function .', 'Ideally modality environment would be simple clear grid that distribute all or close to all the function of everyday life so that a walking grid or a bicycle grid that gets adult to work , their child to school and includes shopping and recreation would be walking or bicycle modality environment .', 'They would be expected to have high level of direct visibility-legibility in the way urban element present themselves to a mobile community .', 'Modality environment would also include the central place ( like high-streets or mobility environment like station ) at which people would transfer to other modality environment .', "We will use a notion of 'movement culture ' to indicate the convergence of land us and mobile community mediated in information-rich network .", 'We are concerned first with how modality environment ( for cycling or walking for example ) may afford more sustainable lifestyle .', 'We are concerned in addition with the way they can be designed to include central place as zone of urbanity and vitality and as socially and culturally mixed centre .', 'We start not with a principle of accessibility of/from node in an extensive space but with the idea that particular social and political territory ( community and polity ) are already articulation of distinct modality environment .', 'We demonstrate using the case of the Amsterdam metropolitan area .', "Fostering a More 'Cultured ' City through Inclusion : Metric for Sense of Belonging for Migrants in Chinese Urban Areas .", 'Over the past four decade , infrastructural and economic development in Chinese city has outpaced its cultural development .', 'As the proportion of people living in city in China quintupled from 1950 to 2014 , from 11 % to 54 % according to a 2009 report by McKinsey , while at the same time various challenge have paved the way to limit cultural prosperity and quality of life in city .', 'City currently face number of problem : Vehicle-oriented street are not friendly to pedestrian ; public space are designed without user in mind [ 1 ] ; community are isolated from one another [ 2 ] ; and finally creative industry are lagging behind other industry according to a 2014 Forbes report .', "It seems that China 's urban development states a condition of `` survivability '' rather than `` livability '' .", 'What is understood from the notion of livability within a city today is to be able to sustain quality of life through holistic planning strategy rather than purely economic one .', 'Such city create robust natural environment as well as built environment , social equity as well as social stability .', 'And as a result both a more reliable creative prosperity and economic prosperity have been maintained .', 'This paper will seek to establish a 3-pillar approach to social inclusion and will examine each of these through issue related with migrant in China facing today .', 'It seems that there is a great potential in using mobile and web-based technology to generate rapid and sustainable solution for migrant .', "There is also an enormous potential to develop feedback mechanism for these solution that can become part of the 'culture ' of living in big city in China .", 'Colonial architecture , urban planning and the representation of portuguese imperial history .', 'This article proposes a critical analysis of recent interpretation made to the history of architecture and urban planning in the Portuguese colonial context in the twentieth century , particularly in the former African territory .', 'More generally , it intends to explore how the internal history produced by specific field of activity , such as architecture or urbanism , can reinforce the logic of a national and nationalized history .', 'This effect is due partly to the fact that the legitimacy of these field is largely dependent on the national identification in the context of activity that are internationalized .', 'I will argue that the specific field of activity , while creating this internal discourse , can directly or indirectly produce representation of the nation , its history and its people on a larger scale , penetrating popular culture and influencing a shared common sense .', 'In the case in question , the internal discourse on architectural and urbanistic work , on author and style , eventually reinforces an idealized and idyllic image of Portuguese colonialism .', 'The perception to the symbolic meaning in landscape designing .', 'It is believe that the experience of landscape for people is the complex content in many way , which is based on the sight people looks , the body perception and the experienced aesthetic object are regarded as the landscape , yet , what the focus of the landscape perception researches has changed from biology to social culture as the foundation .', "This paper points out that the landscape is not only a space place , but also can reflect people 's ideology , moreover , landscape is even more a kind of meaning experience foe people .", "Using Saussure 's Signifier and Signified Theory and Pierce 's three theory of type to discuss the meaning of the landscape symbol , the landscape is regarded as a symbolic text , referring to the relationship between signifier and signified , emphasizing on the landscape symbols to show the meaning recognized by the audience by mean of the the specific form .", 'On this basis , the meaning representation of the landscape symbol can be divided into three type : image symbol , indexing symbol , symbolic sign , and point out the complexity of the symbol is the highest , which needs the viewer has the relevant cultural background .', 'Finally this paper states the ambiguity and openness of the landscape significance , and the relationship with the context design , aiming to provide reference and inspiration for the related designing .', 'Future metropolis .', 'Florida is an American urban study theorist , head of the Martin Prosperity institute at the Rotman school of Management , university of Toronto , and a doyen of the urban planning sector , so when he speaks the community listen .', 'Modern city are at the heart of economic growth , driving innovation and delivering a breeding ground for culture .', 'With greater size comes enhanced efficiency , but for large city to maximize this potential they need to attract innovative people and investment to make the idea happen .', 'They need to find a way to leverage the benefit big city bring , while managing the inevitable challenge they face .', 'Social and economic pressure , plus these technological opportunity , create challenge for city that engineer working in a multidisciplinary environment are well placed to address .', 'These are simple example of city system being made more efficient through an integrated approach and the use of technology .', 'This is a growing opportunity for the engineering community to work collaboratively and innovatively with technology partner to find real world solution .', 'Low-carbon space in urban and rural area : Ecological greenway planning of Shanhaiguan district , Qinhuangdao city , China .', 'With the rapid development of urbanization , more intensive urban building and crowded space resulted in the declining of the environmental quality in urban area , and also eroding the natural and cultural resource both in urban and rural area , which requested the desire for healthy living and natural environment .', "Greenway , with the low-carbon to meet people 's desire , is a dedicated `` way '' linking the urban , natural and cultural landscape .", 'With ecological protection , exercise , recreation and leisure , historical and cultural continuity , and other function , it is one of the special low-carbon space .', 'Greenway , sharing and integration of urban and rural resource , plays the role of effective protection of urban and rural local cultural and ecological environment .', 'The design of the Shanhaiguan Greenway , for example , is not only to meet the basic requirement of the greenway , but also combined with the history and culture , to further Improve the urban quality of the historical and cultural city of Shanhaiguan and build an urban and rural low-carbon space .', 'Staying too long at the fair : Philadelphia planning and the debacle of 1976 .', "In 1682 , 1776 , or 1876 , the optimism of Edmund Bacon 's remarkable 1959 vision for Philadelphia 's future- '' Philadelphia in the Year 2009 '' -would have surprised no one .", "From its founding , Philadelphia 's unfolding future were consistently dynamic , focusing the energy of colonial expansion , democratic governance , and industrialization in one urban crucible .", 'No other city in America exhibited each trend so dramatically .', 'It was the Centennial Exhibition in Philadelphia in 1876- with the glass and steel dome of its Memorial Hall , its display of telegraphy and the telephone , its prototype steam automobiles-that first demonstrated to Americans what an industrialized nation might really look like .', "Ed Bacon was an enthusiast of world 's fair and public exhibition , writing and speaking of them throughout his career to illustrate and promote trend in urban development , and working in the genre himself to advance a far-reaching planning agenda for Philadelphia in the postwar decade .", 'Philadelphia emerged from World War II burdened by creaking infrastructure and a housing shortage , its Center City business district underperforming against rival city .', "Deindustrialization was already noticeable by the mid-1950s , an emerging economic reality that foretold difficulty in achieving the social goal of a new and aggressive generation of reform-minded political leadership.1 Resident were embarking for the suburbs at a steady clip , with the city falling by 1960 from third to fourth in population behind Los Angeles.2 Bacon 's 50-year vision projected against this backdrop might have struck the reader as cheerful but unrealistic , even naïve .", 'But what good is a prophecy if it does not reveal a hidden future , a future obstructed ?', "Bacon 's future was a city revitalized , beautified , and modernized in time to host the nation 's Bicentennial celebration and a simultaneous 1976 Philadelphia World 's Fair .", "Imaginative planning was his method , enabling the political gatekeeper along with the citizen of the city to see with him decade ahead and to grasp the occasion of a fair to accomplish lasting change for the city 's built environment and its people .", "`` Philadelphia in the Year 2009 '' builds its case on this one powerful idea : A world 's fair could transform it into a model of humane urbanism.3 Considering his vantage point in 1959 , it is possible to imagine why Ed Bacon might predict the future of Philadelphia with such mesmerizing flourish .", 'The Philadelphia City Planning Commission ( PCPC ) , under his directorship , was in the midst of one of the longest winning streak any urban planning body had or has ever achieved .', 'With Penn Center , Society Hill , Independence Mall , the neighborhood of Eastwick and the Far Northeast each underway or finished , Bacon and his team of young planner were totally in their stride in 1959 , working to think , dig , and build the city out of its rut .', "The Market East transportation center , a pedestrian-friendly Chestnut Street , and a tourist-friendly Delaware waterfront were all on Bacon 's drawing board , too .", 'These were the varied piece , described in turn by each of the author in this volume , of a full urban-renewal portfolio advanced consistently over more than two decade by the PCPC .', "Postwar federal legislation enabled city official for the first time to broadly exercise eminent domain power , moving mass of resident and bulldozing whole section of the city , planning and building anew.4 Ed Bacon 's PCPC was certainly of its time in this respect and forceful in its place , stirring up both wonder and backlash .", 'The old industrial city , the city that had lain fallow through the Depression and World War II , was awakening slowly to the possibility of highrises and integrated transportation hub , and at the same time rediscovering its walkable character and the vernacular beauty of its historic neighborhood .', "Bacon 's idea was to liberate William Penn 's grid from over a century of industrial-age clutter and to make the city simultaneously auto- , pedestrian- , and investment-friendly .", 'Bacon understood the power of display and salesmanship as key to making his idea of the next Philadelphia into something tangible .', "In this spirit , his `` 2009 '' essay arrived on newsstand in 1959 .", 'Could new high-rise and a suburban-style shopping center downtown reverse massive job loss and a suburban exodus ?', "Whether the PCPC 's project were comprehensive enough remained an open question in 1959 .", "In this context , the Philadelphia World 's Fair could provide a shared goal , a focused way for Bacon to complete the project he wanted .", "Market East , the Chestnut Street pedestrian mall , and even the heliport and Kabuki dancer really pale in comparison , though , to his essay 's boldest claim .", 'In 2009 Philadelphia will not have any bad neighborhood , suburbanite will have moved back bringing their vitality and tax dollar with them , greenway will ring the city , transportation option will be rational and varied ; the entire metropolis will reflect the best and brightest idea that modern urban planning can deliver .', "Bacon 's prediction still astound with their self-confidence , and throughout the 1960s and into the 1970s , from City Hall to the hall of academia and elite architecture firm and banker ' office , from newsroom to neighborhood across the city , Philadelphians would grapple with the idea that a world 's fair could help deliver the future city they desired .", 'This chapter examines the fair-as-urban renewal formula that Ed Bacon worked with to promote his long-range planning objective in Philadelphia .', "The `` 2009 '' essay was just one of the many publication and speech he used to stimulate and sustain interest in the manifold project of the PCPC .", 'But here was a truly seductive model of development .', "If a world 's fair could leave useful permanent structure behind while simultaneously rejuvenating public faith in the city , then what was the downside ?", 'Ed Bacon and score of Philadelphians would take up this challenge , shaping it over a 15-year period to fit their own vision for the future of their city .', "From London 's 1851 Crystal Palace Exhibition to New York 's 1939 World 's Fair , such event periodically announced new era in technology and science , in business , and in culture .", 'As Bacon and other key player in Philadelphia intuited , they also offered host city opportunities to innovate in urban design .', "Starting with Brussels in 1958 a new generation of postwar world 's fair began , and the planning for the Philadelphia Fair took place as fair were held in Seattle ( 1962 ) , New York ( 1964 ) , Montreal ( 1967 ) , San Antonio ( 1968 ) , and Osaka ( 1970 ) .", 'The difficulty of the New York Fair and the success of the Montreal one especially played defining role as the Philadelphia planning process went forward .', "Learning and applying lesson from fair in other city and other era proved difficult for Philadelphia 's planner .", 'The chapter develops two main analytical point .', "First , world 's fair have historically proven as different and mercurial as the city and time period of their creation , and have rarely inspired large-scale urban renewal in host city in predictable , linear way .", "The historical lesson and legacy of world 's fair for urban planner were ( and remain ) decidedly ambiguous .", 'But by studying the period of gestation for a fair , and perhaps by extension any large-scale civic undertaking , we gain critical insight into the dominant conflict shaping the modern city .', "As the planning process moved into the 1960s and early 1970s , it became more and more evident that the Philadelphia World 's Fair of 1976-if it was to happen-would not recreate the 1876 Centennial Exhibition or launch an urban renaissance so much as reflect the clashing ambition of citizen caught in a declining American industrial metropolis .", "The final plan , to the extent there ever was one plan , deviated starkly in both intention and design from Bacon 's 1959 vision .", 'This leads to the second point .', "The deviation from Bacon 's `` 2009 '' vision shows two quite specific urban historical process working in conjunction : The decline of the `` master planner '' and by extension New Deal/Great Society urban liberalism , and the rise of a consensus-seeking planning model driven by the maturation of urban community-based protest movement .", "The evolving plan for the World 's Fair vividly show these trend defining one another , with plan for ( and protest against ) the Fair emerging from all quarter of the city , diluting the strength of Bacon 's 1959 vision , while at the same time adding element more desirable , more democratic , to the multiple community affected .", 'Between 1970 and 1972 planning for the Fair broke apart amid a prolonged season of racial strife , intergenerational resentment , federal disinvestment , and a creeping urban pessimism .', 'Combined with hesitant municipal leadership this climate of urban uncertainty clouded the vision of a fair-as-catalyst to a utopian `` Philadelphia in the Year 2009 .', '`` .', 'Transit-oriented-development ( TOD ) suitable for China .', 'Transit-oriented development ( TOD ) combines transit infrastructure with urban land utilization in way that optimize the long-term benefit of urban mass transit ( UMT ) .', 'TOD has been successfully implemented in the USA , Europe , Singapore , Hong Kong and many other place ; however , its practice in China is so uncommon that few people understand it well .', 'Although it is worthwhile to study the foreign TOD model , Chinese city can not simply copy these example because of how its politics , economic condition , and regional culture differ from the country where TOD has previously been used .', 'Chinese city should analyze the successful TOD case to determine how the various aspect of TOD apply to condition existing in China and ultimately develop TOD design and procedure appropriate for China .', 'Residential environment evaluation system considering environmental quality and environmental load for sustainable development of residential district ( part I ) : Residential environment quality .', 'Residential environment is one of the most important element for the quality of life , as well as the main support for the activity of economy , culture and society .', 'However , the improvement of residential environmental quality also has been increasing the consumption of energy and the emission of pollutant .', 'First , a systematic methodology for the evaluation of sustainable residential environment is established , considering both the residential environmental quality ( Q ) and the residential environmental load ( L ) .', 'The part of Q is constructed by safety , health , amenity , convenience and community of residential environment .', 'The part of L is about the environmental impact of the lifecycle of housing and community .', 'Then , the region of Yangtze River Delta of China is selected as the research area , because it is the most highly-growing area of China and gives great influence on other city .', 'As the first part of the research , the author performed questionnaire survey in Hangzhou and Shanghai focusing on the residential environmental quality ( Q ) , and analyzed the residential environmental satisfaction of people .', 'In the next step , the study on the index part of environmental load ( L ) will be performed , and the weight of each factor will be determined .', 'A desirability of the author is to obtain the result contributing to the sustainable development and improvement of urban residential environment for the rapidly developing China .', 'Whither aboriginal education ?', '.', 'Taiwanese government is continuously putting significant effort into educational , cultural and community resource to develop tribal wisdom and shape a collective will in tribe .', 'The 1876 centennial in Philadelphia : Elite network and political culture .', 'AT NOON on May 10 , 1876-after year of controversy , construction , and fuss-President Ulysses S. Grant and Emperor Dom Pedro of Brazil entered Machinery Hall to open the Centennial Exhibition of 1876 in Philadelphia .', "Since early morning , the day 's 186,000 attendee had been streaming through the gate .", 'The president and the emperor stood in front of thirteen acre of motionless machinery , all connected by pulley , shaft , wheel and belt to the giant Corliss engine in the central transept .', 'Several hundred invited guest , already waiting there , made room for the ceremonial party to climb upon the concrete base of the huge metal monster towering forty foot above their head almost to the trussed roof of the Hall .', 'Machinery Hall was one of five major building put up by exhibition organizer in Fairmount Park ; outside group built dozen more .', 'The Main Building was the largest in the world at the time-over a third of a mile long .', "Visitor marveled at the item on display : A typewriter , Hires root beer , the Statue of Liberty 's torch , the Westinghouse air brake , Fleischmann 's yeast , cable from the Brooklyn Bridge , Bell 's telephone , and Otis 's elevator.2 The Centennial was a resounding success , dramatically displaying Philadelphia 's wealth and industrial might .", "Over nine million people-nearly one-fifth of the country 's population-attended before its close in November .", 'It was the first international exposition held in the United States and probably the single most important cultural event of its era .', "Foreigner flocked to Philadelphia-inaugurating mass tourism to the United States-to see American industrial innovation and dozen of foreign exhibit from Britain , Norway , Belgium , Russia , Japan , China , Sweden , Germany , France , Italy , Canada , Mexico , Brazil , and `` two large Arab tent . ''", "This influx of visitor and national culture also opened Philadelphia andthe United States to a world of new influence ; the Japanese exhibit in particular stirred an Oriental design fashion in the United States.3 Beyond the pomp , the fanfare , the hotel receipt , and the visitor , the Centennial also helped restructure the city 's politics .", 'The event both cemented network of alliance among previously divided elite and marked the ascendance of a Republican hegemony in local political culture that would be virtually unchallenged for the next sixty year .', "The Republican regime that coalesced in the 1870s combined several element : party bossism centered in control of several city agency , an electoral machine that came to trade vote for public construction contract , business support based in ideological solidarity ( support for protectionist legislation ) , and reliance on rail- And port-related industry as the engine of the city 's economy .", "In Philadelphia 's case , the irony is that those Republicans who did the most to make the Centennial happen-large , reformist civic organization like the Union League that played crucial role in event planning and in promoting commitment to the Republican Party-did not necessarily enjoy the political fruit of their labor .", "Over time , the elite 's cultural and ideological commitment to Republicanism became a straitjacket , and they lost control of the polity they had helped build .", 'More broadly , I use the example of the Centennial to examine the role that cultural project play in urban governance .', 'These project , and the planning effort that produce them , contribute to the emergence and consolidation of governing regime out of situation of extreme political discord and fragmentation .', 'They connect process of elite network formation ( social capital ) and ideological consolidation .', "These two process in turn are the building block of hegemony in local governance-cultural and social leadership that shapes people 's political commitment and the extent to which they are willing to consider or pursue alternative to prevailing arrangement .", 'The World Urban Forum III : Vancouver .', "`` Better information for better city ! ''", 'is the call that leads this special issue .', 'Urban indicator and performance measurement are the answer , aiming to improve local performance on key trend and contribute to solving global problem .', 'Better information , according to the rational model that predominates in urban policy , is the surest path to improve action .', 'The World Urban Forum ( WUF ) III , meeting in Vancouver in June 2006 , considers dimension , challenge , and practice in the use of urban indicator in the Vancouver region .', "Patrick Geddes , writing in the early day of the town and regional planning movement , insisted upon the value of what he called a synoptic view , `` a seeing of the city and this as a whole ; like Athens from its Acropolis '' ( Geddes , 1949 , p. 6 ) .", 'Working from a synoptic view did not simply mean gazing down on the city from atop a hill .', "Geddes strove to help people express `` simultaneity '' of their own being .", "Understanding that people living in a given region have a multitude of different perspective , simultaneity of being meant `` one-ness with the social ideal , the scientific development and the physical condition of [ their ] own time and place '' ( Geddes , 1949 , p. x ) .", 'He believed a region could be created and planned to aid people in accomplishing all these thing .', "As one of the forefather of town and regional planning , Geddes himself was a maker of `` great map and diagram and chart '' ( Geddes , 1949 , p. xiii ) -but his most lasting contribution to the profession and practice of planning was his notion of the Civic Exhibition .", "Geddes was less concerned about expert training to make great plan and planner than he was `` concerned that the ordinary citizen should have a vision and a comprehension of the possibility of his own city '' ( Geddes , 1949 , p. xi ) .", "A periodic Civic Exhibition , during which citizen could gather in a festive atmosphere to peruse plan , gaze at large map and model , discuss and interpret these publicly , was one part of Geddes 's key contribution to this goal .", "The other part was his drive to create a permanent and public centre for Civic Studies in every town in the form of an `` Outlook Tower '' ( Geddes , 1949 , p. xi ) .", "The Outlook Tower was to be the `` incipient Civic Observatory and Laboratory together '' in which the Science of Cities was advanced to its proper rank amongst academic and life pursuit ( Geddes , 1949 , p. 96 ) .", "The institution Geddes sought to create placed `` its effort towards correlation of thought and action , science and practice , sociology and moral , with its watchword and endeavour of `` Civic Survey for Civic Service '' '' ( Geddes , 1949 , p. 69 ) .", "Fastforward to late 2004 , when the Urban Studies Program at Simon Fraser University 's downtown campus initiated the Regional Vancouver Urban Observatory ( RVu ) , with a vision akin to that of Geddes .", "In the context of the new millennium , RVu was established as the first local observatory within UN-Habitat 's Global Urban Observatory network in a developed country .", "The Global Urban Observatory was established in 1997 to institutionalize UN-Habitat 's pioneering work in the generation and tracking of urban indicator , initiated with the Urban Indicators Programme in 1993 .", 'Following the creation of the Habitat Agenda at the Habitat II Conference in Istanbul in 1996 , the mission was set for the Global Urban Observatory-to create and maintain a Global Urban Indicators Database that would permit UN member state and their city to monitor and report on urban trend on a regular and reliable basis .', 'The Millennium Development Goals , established by UN member state in 2000 , and the indicator established for tracking these eight goal in 2003 , update the mission of the Global Urban Indicators Database ( UN-Habitat 2004 ) .', 'The MDGs represent a global compact for poverty alleviation and sustainable development , to be attained by 2015 .', "RVu 's work to date is being presented to the international community for the first time at the World Urban Forum III .", 'The work thus far has constituted both expert-based and public participatory component .', 'Expert affiliated with RVu have conducted regional and international research on urban indicator-related work , with some bearing on the Vancouver region and on specific indicator used by a range of project in the major area of urban capital : health , economy , environment , governance , culture , and infrastructure .', 'Work in progress toward these research article was presented at the first RVu public event , Focusing ouR View , in October 2005 ; and the best finished result are presented in this issue of Cities .', 'Key to the design of Rvu , and in particular its public participatory process , are presented in the first article in this issue , Urban Indicators and the Integrative Ideals of Cities , by Meg Holden .', "The paper presents the practice in progress of RVu 's stance on urban sustainability as a community-based struggle to learn , indicator as a means for long-term learning , and the role of value-based citizen participation , within a theoretical perspective .", "Sustainable development , as a framework for long-term planning , has value in the Vancouver region for its `` constructive ambiguity '' ( Robinson , 2004 , p. 374 ) , its pointer toward greater linkage among environmental , social , and economic priority , without forcing a premature set of quantitative trade-off .", 'This integrative , vague , idealistic thrust also leaves sustainable development open to clash with incremental , specific , and realist demand competing for time on the public agenda .', 'Indicator can help bridge the gap ; the article in this issue begin to explain how .', 'One article presents a bridge from the perspective of environmental economics , illustrating the complexity of measuring natural capital but also the need and precedent for this .', 'The next article presents a way of thinking about indicator of governance for sustainable development from a starting point of allocating equal value to democratic inclusion of each citizen .', 'Moving from the individual to the group , the final two article ask for greater attention to socially , culturally and demographically-specific case : new immigrant and Aboriginal people .', "Nancy Olewiler offers an economist 's perspective on the design and utility of an urban indicator project , with a particular focus on natural capital .", 'Her article , Environmental Sustainability for Urban Areas : The Role of Natural Capital Indicators , expands on one of the theme from Holden , the difference between descriptive indicator , which proliferate in policy contexts , and diagnostic indicator , which are rare .', 'Olewiler presents the Driving Force-Pressure-State-Impact-Response framework and reminds us of the need to consider different indicator at each point in the chain .', "Her treatment of natural capital indicator issue locally includes useful information on Greater Vancouver 's adjacent Fraser Valley Regional District .", 'She looks south to the city of Santa Monica , California for an example of natural capital indicator development and institutionalization .', 'Building on a theme introduced by Holden , Olewiler reminds us that indicator alone are not enough ; effective indicator are those presented in a reasoned context with a clear path to action .', 'Indicator belong at the beginning , not the end , of a good governance process .', 'The next article specifies much more clearly what might be meant by the notion of good governance .', 'In Designing Good Urban Governance Indicator : The Importance of Citizen Participation and its Evaluation in Greater Vancouver , political scientist Kennedy Stewart makes the case for inclusion of governance consideration in any definition of sustainability .', "The political aspect of sustainability is poorly developed , compared to economic , environmental , and social aspect and this article moves the thinking ahead through treatment of democratic theory , along with work on defining 'good governance ' advanced by the United Nations .", 'Stewart draws on evidence of voting pattern in the Vancouver region to raise the spectre of systematic disenfranchisement , that seems to be on the rise .', "As Canada 's only unamalgamated major metropolitan region , led by municipal appointment rather than direct election , advance in sustainable development policy made by the Greater Vancouver Regional District are at risk if voting trend can not be reversed .", 'Stewart calls for stepwise moral reasoning , based on the premise of universal equal right to rectify this wrong .', "The final two article examine the limit of belonging to the project of sustainability in the Vancouver region , from the perspective of the region 's newest resident and its ancestral resident .", 'Robert Fiedler , Nadine Schuurman and Jennifer Hyndman , in Hidden Homelessness : An Indicator - Based Approach for Examining the Geographies of Recent Immigrant At-Risk of Homelessness in Greater Vancouver , focus on the dimension of risk of homelessness amongst one particularly vulnerable group , new immigrant .', 'This investigation brings to the fore the interaction of policy , economics , and culture in explaining the complexity of homelessness and immigration trend in the region .', "Since about half of the region 's population growth in the foreseeable future will come from international immigration , and an increasing proportion of new arrival face socio-economic difficulty upon arrival , understanding these interaction is key to sustainability in a context of increasing cultural diversity and decreasing affordability of housing .", 'First Nations researcher Nathan Cardinal puts an Aboriginal lens on indicator in his concluding article , The Exclusive City : Identifying , Measuring and Drawing Attention to Aboriginal and Indigenous Experiences in an Urban Context .', 'Along with immigrant , Aboriginal group constitute fast growing demographic cultural group in British Columbia .', 'Noise , music , and the meaning of modernity .', "Emily Thompson has shared her view on a revised version of a talk from 'The Soundscape of Modernity : Architectural Acoustic and the Culture of Listening in America ' that was presented to the Société de Physique et d́Histoire Naturelle de Genéve on 22nd October , 2004 .", 'She states that organic sound created by human and animal that have always accompanied human civilization helps to understand it .', 'But as the city noise rose with urbanization , people started escaping it .', 'Organization and commission were formed to control city noise and to provide a noise-free environment .', 'Modern architect of America constructed the Philadelphia Saving fund Society in 1932 to control sound by acoustically isolating people from the city noise .', 'The modern solution was achieved to the problem of noise by turning building into placeless artifact thereby defying their location in the world .', 'Designing a DNA for adaptive architecture : A new built environment for social sustainability .', 'The paper explores innovative environmentally responsible and socially proactive way to build in developing country .', 'The proposed methodology was tested with the design of a Smart Village in Egypt , awarded the second prize in an international competition .', 'Our design approach is based on environmental and social sustainability and works as a genetic algorithm .', 'This process generates the sustainable architecture of the village using the behaviour of biological creature in artificial system .', 'The design ultimately ensures that our architecture is nurtured by renewable energy and built with re-cycled material .', 'The disposition of public space and the flexible organization of different function are conceived in order to stimulate social sustainability , allowing the community to be interdependent as much as an ecosystem .', 'Local culture , typology , material and climate build the DNA of both the village and its building .', "We apply concept from artificial life , using `` creature '' that follow simple low-level rule in order to get high-level group behaviour .", 'By combining the principle of artificial life and architecture , we get both high energy-efficiency and optimal placement of built unit on a specific site .', 'As in any ecosystem , a fractal , coherent , continuous fluctuation at every scale of the system is vital , and this kinetic flexibility is achieved at four level : 1 ) decentralized urban planning ; 2 ) reconfigurable space ; 3 ) modular building block ; 4 ) kinetic structure that respond to light , climate and people .', 'MINIMIZING ENERGY DEMANDS IN MEDIUM SIZE CITIES : GLOBAL PROSPECTS .. developing country , and increasingly prefer to live in advanced country ; total economic requirement for infrastructure development may be lower than that of larger city ; and in general , medium size city appear to be more manageable for both administrator and resident .', 'Case study of medium size city suggest that they also suffer from uncontrolled growth and energy intensive development pattern .', 'On the other hand , aspect of these city provide example of efficient development pattern which appear conceptually adaptable to emerging need .', 'In this paper it is suggested that many of the city pattern in developing country have evolved to suit condition of local culture , climate and geographical resource , and provide fruitful ground to derive solution for future development in both developing and developed country .', 'Exploring City and Country of the World .', 'Volume 3 .', 'This edited volume consists of six chapter that describe the culture , lifestyle , and perspective falling attendance from a branding perspective .', 'Chapter Three presents the challenge encountered while developing design strategy for historical city center and construction project over two case study .', 'Chapter Four discusses narration as a design methodology as well as a means of representation and present example of proposed urban design project for five different city .', 'Chapter Five describes how the people in Costa Rica perceive edible flower , if and how they consume them , how they buy them and how much they are acquainted with possible health risk associated with their space , the people within the city will have bigger chance to fulfill their social need .', 'The development of public open space which based on the social need and city instrument oriented will help , ” and “ space ” “ People ” in the “ space ” can process “ activity , ” therefore , activity and space can influence each other .', 'In this research , we aim to obtain insight on urban morphology by analyzing the change in urban space ’ “ activity ” pattern .', 'We aim to explore the relationship between urban spatial configuration and functionality .', 'Space syntax methodology is applied to actual urban condition , and thus affirms our analytical framework of having a creditable comprehension of the advantage and disadvantage of urban spatial integration and its functionality .', 'Therefore , our research methodology can be applied as an efficient preliminary evaluation tool for conceiving the merit of city district .', 'Based on the finding of our research , authority will be able to discuss the urban development agenda in greater detail with higher efficiency .', 'Critical Analysis of Urban Livability Measures Based on the Perspective of Placemaking .', "The livability level of an urban area is a substantial measure of one 's sense of connection to their neighborhood .", "Urban livability is often measured based on various measurable aspect such as stability , healthcare , culture and environment , education , and infrastructure as stated in EIU 's Global Liveability Ranking .", "However , these indicator often neglect the nature and process by which place are made that form people 's sense of place much more than the physical availability of urban amenity .", 'Therefore , this paper aims to analyze the critical perspective and contribution that placemaking principle of being community-driven , local asset , bottom-up , and trans-disciplinary to enhance the human-environment quality of urban livability .', 'Offending sight and urban governance : Expectation of city aesthetic and spatial response to the unsightly .', 'The problem of incivility seems to be considerably connected to the visibility of unsightly behaviour .', 'Factor such as urban attractiveness and visibility of the homelessness play important role in urban social control and have led to the sanitisation and gentrification of city centre .', 'Visual exposure is
