pursue .', 'A multi-staged sampling technique was adopted for the study .', 'On-site qualitative approach was majorly employed through the interview conducted assessing the major mobility corridor and street from 1st to 7th avenue .', 'A sample frame of 15 major road with outdoor open space along the selected road all within the selected avenue and major street road .', 'The instrument for data collection were oral interview and personal/physical observation .', 'The activity profile , locational data and geospatial coordinate of each avenue were imported into ArcGIS ( Version 10.5 , ESRI ) for various land-use analysis .', "The sustainable eco-mobility strategy will reduce transportation impact , create civilized street that meets environmental design standard of commuter 's safety and comfort that are compatible with the unique urban structure and culture of metropolitan Lagos .", 'This study evaluated the issue relating to sustainable eco-mobility , the connection between climate change and transportation system , the impact of urban mobility on public health and wellbeing .', 'It further outlined policy framework to be considered in other to have a sustainable neighbourhood street mobility network within a mixed-use community .', 'Cognitive-Cultural Looping Mechanism of Urban Space Conceptualization .', 'A crucial point for urban design is the acknowledgement that urban material structure are not only constituting a set of cognitive-cultural affordances that shapes people ’ s behavior and experiential world , but likewise that the design process itself is an expression of cultural conceptualization possibly evoked by ongoing cultural practice and perception , thus forming a dynamic loop .', 'In this paper , we outline a framework for the study of material , cultural and social mechanism interacting with human cognition , behavior and emotion .', 'We attempt a conceptual model that integrates dynamic interaction between cognitive-cultural affordances and our conceptualization of the environment and provides a few illustrative case example .', 'The model proposes a set of dynamic relation between cognitive and cultural process at shorter time scale modifying conceptualization and environmental affordances on longer timescales , while these – in turn – come to guide and constrain process at the shorter timescales .', 'The model has important implication for our understanding of the role of environmental design , especially urban design , as bridging between aspect of human situated experience , behavior , social and cultural norm and material culture .', 'Spectacle of the Temporal City : An Analysis of the Effect of Festival on Identity in an Urban Context .', 'City around the world are becoming complex system wherein every city possess unique identity manifested through its people and activity that occur in its urban space .', 'The sense of urban space is an ever-changing concept and to understand the fabric of urban space , knowledge of the concept of space and its interrelation is required .', 'Reading a city in a time where change is the norm , with urban space gaining new meaning and function with change in cultural practice conveys the hybrid urgency of metropolitan India .', 'An analysis is thus , particularly relevant in India , as in the post-industrial scenario , city in India have become some of the largest urban conglomerate with a dualist identity of static and kinetic pervading their urban landscape .', 'The static city is the conventional physical entity of a city whereas , the kinetic city is perceived as a city in motion , temporary in nature and the emerging symbolic image of urban India .', 'Understanding these multitude of identity in the backdrop of traditional event and festival , as temporal transformation of urban space will thus highlight the dominant visual culture of Indian city .', 'This Temporal City enables a better understanding of the blurred line of contemporary urbanism and the changing role of social space in the urban fabric .', 'This study focused on the ancient festival of Ambubachi in the historic Kamakhya Temple in Guwahati , India , through visual ethnography , participant observation , open-ended interview , photography and document analysis .', 'The central concern of this paper is to develop a critical stance on understanding the identity of city through the study of urban spectacle such as festival in a bid to illustrate the fluid and dynamic aspect of one ’ s identity that is being constantly redefined and reconstructed with time , space , activity and context .', 'Through the analysis of this ancient festival of Ambubachi in the light of ‘ identity ’ and ‘ place attachment ’ of the festivalgoers , the emerging notion of identity will be explored .', 'The fieldwork sought to analyse two major aspect : The first was the generic , spatial characteristic of festival space and the second was the temporal , fleeting event that occur in their physical setting following the parameter of event-space relationship by Frenchman in a bid to understand how such eventful urban space manifest in the negotiation of one ’ s identity .', 'Governing with conversation culture–conditioning organizational interaction in a digital social movement .', 'Digital platform support form of collective action with varying degree of organizationality–that is , with organization-like attribute such as identity , actorhood , and decision-making .', 'These form include seemingly non-organized online group , which can be easily dismissed as informal chatter .', 'Building on communicative theory of organizing and Luhmann ’ s Theory of Social Systems , we explore the communicative organizationality of a Facebook group related intertwined to produce and curate digital political discussion .', 'Our finding illustrate how technological affordances built for moderation also support the strategic organization of discussion to orchestrate political talk .', 'We conceptualize such operation as discursive conditioning of organizational interaction and suggest that political action online can be propelled not only by connecting people , but also by the powerful yet concealed tactic of conditioning public online discussion .', 'Published by Informa UK Limited , trading as Taylor & Francis Group .', 'The relation need of the user by introducing the hypothesis that the behavioral pattern in any designed space relies on the designer personal perception and understanding of the behavioral and usage pattern of the individual within it , the understanding of which positively reflects on both the spatial quality and the individual 's perception of it .", 'The question of this research are as follows : ( 1 ) What conclusion , this paper offers recommendation for the redesign and development of the building 's regulation in the downtown to achieve the proper relationship between urban planning and urban development , deal with the modern city development and reflect the relationship with its own culture .", 'Of pirate driver and honking horn mobility , authority , and urban planning in late-colonial accra .', 'This article attempts to bridge two literatures—the African history of urban life and the colonial history of urban planning—in order to better understand the politics of African mobility .', 'In doing so , it situates colonial history of urban planning and emerging African culture of auto-mobility within a broader critique of colonial technology and infrastructure .', 'This article city given by the World Health Organization and the international document dealing with sustainable development oblige building designer and urban planner to reconsider their social role and become “ infrastructure .', 'Ha Long Bay had suffered the pressure of environmental pollution and resource degradation .', 'Since 2014 , in order to protect the UNESCO World Heritage Site , the local authority has planned a project to demolish the floating village and move these community to the mainland .', 'In fact , the demolition project has caused the loss of cultural heritage and a tourist attraction Cua Van is provided in this study .', 'The analysis does not only accumulate precious traditional value that need to be preserved and developed in the proposed concept but also illustrate its weakness that need to be addressed to optimally design the future sustainable floating village .', 'Based on these study , as well as on general principle of a sustainable floating community and promoting ecotourism , the study proposes a living space concept for Cua Van , including solution to both a sustainable floating community adapting to climate change and ecotourism development .', 'The proposed concept would ensure stable and permanent living on the water for water dweller and reduce human-induced impact on the environment as well as an increasing livelihood income by tourism development .', with institutional and tax measure and establishing a Reconstruction Agency to undertake task regarding integrated national measure ( Art .', '1 ) .', 'The Basic Act 2011 then prescribes its basic purpose .', 'This used library document and has a comparative-analytical method .', 'The basic data and the research background information have been gathered through documentative method and from library resource .', 'For the fieldwork , the descriptive method ( describing the phenomenon ) has been used .', 'Then , people pattern of behavior were studied by an interpretative-qualitative method in each climate to analyze and infer the discussion in order .', 'And at last , a comparative method has been used to analyze the result in order to set out urban design criterion .', 'In this comparative method , it was tried to compare people pattern of behavior in two cold-mountainous , and hot and humid climate , and to analyze its result to elicit criterion for urban space design considering the effect of climate on the user behavior .', 'In this research , the people behavior were studied , analyzed and compared in two different season of the year ( the hottest and the coldest season ) by the use of serial photography .', 'Thus , people different pattern of behavior in different climate and the way they use the space were investigated , by the observation a set of design criterion could be developed to be applied in the design/redesign of urban space to improve their quality .', '( Figure Presented ) The theory In general , people us of urban space may have two stage : 1 .', 'Presence in urban space .', '2 .', 'Tendency to continue to stay in the urban space .', 'There are two kind of quality in urban environment .', 'First , the quality which are the main requirement of people presence in public space , i.e .', 'primary quality .', 'Second , the quality encouraging people to stay in the space for a longer time .', 'Meanwhile , there are some quality like climatic comfort which play effective role in both primary and secondary quality .', 'This very important factor is in full adaptation with human physical characteristic and is the main requirement of people presence in the space .', 'It also plays an undeniable role in the way people use the space and behave there .', 'Climatic comfort can increase the number of opportunity to use the space .', 'If the space is designed with consideration of all aspect , including the user behavior , it can be used by all people in various period of time during the day , and in different season .', 'Result and discussion : Design guideline in hot and humid climate are formulated .', 'They emphasize on the role of climate to determine people pattern of behavior .', 'Here , regarding the achievement of local observation and the recognition , the design criterion are proposed at two different scale , the city scale and the site scale .', 'A ) The city scale : Location of the space in the shade : This is the most important factor affecting the use of space in hot and humid climate .', 'If the open space includes shaded part , people preference to stay there will increase .', 'Therefore , location in the shade can be considered as an important requirement for people use of space in this climate .', 'Other factor is natural ventilation and the space orientation parallel to the wind flows : This is the second factor affecting the use of public space in hot and humid climate .', 'Natural ventilation of open space happens by the airflow coming from the sea .', 'It helps the local reduce the high unpleasant humidity in this climate , so it encourages passersby to stop and stay in the space .', 'B ) The site scale : • To avoid designing vast urban open space in hot and humid climate .', '• Making orientation of the open space toward the sea to moderate the hot weather and reduce the humidity by the sea airflows .', 'Local observation also verify that successful space in this climate have perpendicular orientation to the sea to benefit from its cool airflow for natural ventilation .', 'Formulating design guideline in cold and mountainous climate emphasizes the role of climate to determine people pattern of behavior : Local observation in Shahr-E-Kord show that the two fallowing factor have determined the role of people use of space in cold and mountainous climate .', '1-Maximizing the direct sunshine : It is a positive point for the open space in the cold winter weather of mountainous climate , because it helps the space to be more welcoming and favorable for people .', '2-Not to be windward : This factor also has direct effect on how people attend and behave in the space .', "The researcher 's observation and note in cold and mountainous climate show that the space which are exposed to direct wind flow are not favorable for people .", 'A ) The city scale : • For designing open space and its proposed land uses , it is better to locate attractive us at the southern and east-southern side of the space , because it helps to provide favorable sunlight for the space during cold winter day and facilitates the use of space for people .', '• In the cold and mountainous climate , it is better to design urban space in form of small square because it reduces the entrance of wind flow and provides people with climatic comfort .', 'It must be mentioned that vast square in this climate can benefit from the increased direct sunlight and heat .', 'But the effect of the increased airflow in these space is highly unfavorable and disturbs the climatic comfort .', 'Thus , they are not recommended .', 'B ) The site scale : • It is better to design crowded space as semi-open space , because enclosed and covered space are more favorable in all season for their shelter from the sun , wind , rain and snow .', '• In cold climate , it is important to use type of plant which prevent space from undesired wind , while not casting shade during cold season , since tree can provide favorable shade for summer time .', 'Conclusion : The result and finding of this research are presented in a set of operational and applicable recommendation , some of which might seem unimportant .', 'But they are undeniably essential .', 'Simple solution for ordinary problem of existing urban space can lead to significant improvement in the space vitality and people social life .', "William White expresses the extract of his long term study in one sentence : `` people seat where the seating exists . ''", 'This sentence might seem clear and typical , but it is very important and can notably change the life of a city .', 'Thus , the simplicity of change does not mean that they are inconsiderable .', 'It might be possible to change the destination of a space simply by adding shelter and awning or providing sunny space in cold and mountainous climate and shaded space in hot and humid one .', 'Preface to Part 5 .', 'The chapter in this Part of the book are concerned what are amongst the most critical challenge facing contemporary city and urban planning – how to support , understand and manage the cultural practice of urban population .', 'At stake is the creation of environment where different social group can live , work , mingle , and express their culture and value .', 'Also important is the equitable distribution of urban resource .', 'When contemplating such issue , attention frequently turns to public space because this is where the texture , complexity and diversity of urban life is most readily revealed .', 'And so it is with the chapter here , which in differing way acknowledge that the quality , use and presence of urban public space are central to the way in which people experience and relate to the city as resident or visitor , and whether encountering it in the context of work , education or leisure ( to name but three ) .', 'Public space is also linked to the development and maintenance of civic culture .', 'Park , footpath , beach , the verge of river and waterway are all important in this respect , as are road and thoroughfare – the site of intersection , movement and transportation .', 'Cultural planning and sustainable development .', 'A decade or more has elapsed since the notion of cultural planning was distinguished from the more functional planning for art and culture within amenity , heritage , land use and economic resource planning system .', 'The ‘ cultural turn ’ in town and spatial planning which emerged from the 1970s and 1980s has taken longer to establish itself than say in geography ( Barnes 2001 , Crang 1997 ) , political economy ( Soja 1999 ) and sociology ( Chaney 1994 ) .', 'Planning as a hybrid practice has adopted culture - at least partially - to better inform more sustainable approach to scarce land use and amenity need and to respond to diversity and planning culture .', 'On the other hand it has also rediscovered culture in order to address aspiration and vision of city planning itself as a ‘ work of art ’ ( Boyer 1988 , Munro 1967 , Talen and Ellis 2004 ) .', 'Different approach and rationale for cultural planning have therefore emerged , rather than a single grand theory or conceptual model ( see also Bianchini , Chapter 22 , this volume ) .', 'This is in part due to the epistemological and definitional difference evident in these approach towards ‘ culture ’ and ‘ planning ’ and their combination , and in part to cultural politics that views the very idea of planning for culture as inherently instrumental in maintaining cultural and growth hegemony - both market and state-led .', 'Kunzmann ’ s aspiration ( above ) towards creativity in planning also conflates the practice of town planner withcomplex notion of city culture , environment and identity .', 'The notion of the creative city has also extended the cultural planning sphere to the creative industry ( ‘ economy ’ ) and issue of place-making , design quality and sustainability .', 'Place-making - like New Urbanism ( CEU 2004 ) - whilst usefully focusing on the street , urban design , mixed-use , local accessibility , ‘ sense of place ’ and so on , can also be seen as a rejection or failure of planning in term of the wider scale and the whole , distributed population ( Evans 2010 ) .', 'Everywhere is a ‘ place ’ , not just the valorized space which tend to feature in place-making agenda and guidance ( APA 2011 , Markusen and Gadwa 2010 ) , and which are preoccupied with town centre and regeneration site ( physical , economy ) at the expense of the everyday , residential area and cultural activity ( people ) .', 'Right to public space : Law , culture , and gentrification in the American west .', 'This book examines the role that public space play in gentrification .', 'Considering both cultural norm of public behavior and the municipal regulation of behavior in public , it shows how commonplace act in everyday public space like sidewalk , street , and park work to establish neighborhood legitimacy for newcomer while delegitimizing once authentic public practice of long-timers .', 'With evidence drawn from the formerly Latino neighborhood of Highland in Denver , Colorado , this ethnographic study demonstrates how the regulation of public space plays a pivotal role in neighborhood change .', 'First , there is often a profound disharmony between how people from different cultural complex interpret and sanction behavior in everyday public space .', 'Second , because regulation , code , urban design , and enforcement protocol are deliberately changed , commonplace activity longtime neighborhood resident feel they have a right to do along sidewalk and street and within their neighborhood park sometimes unexpectedly misalign with what is actually possible or legal to do in these publicly accessible space .', 'Research on historical district soundscape and city design .', "This paper study the soundscape and the surrounding environmental characteristic in a large urban historic district of Guangzhou - `` Xiguan Area '' , explores people 's perception on the soundmarks in this region and estimate the surrounding environment through method of soundwalk and on-site interview .", "The study result show that : the local language and drama its control in reclaimed water .", 'Shifting gear : The intersection of race and sustainability in Memphis .', 'Memphis is a city of dichotomy and disparity , a perplexing city of illustrative idiosyncrasy and instructive irony .', 'The city roils with a sweaty , gritty , creative energy , yet it has struggled to find a creative solution to overcoming its challenging past .', 'As a global center of commerce and trade , the prosperity of the United States relies heavily on Memphis , yet Memphis is home to some of the nation ’ s most impoverished community .', 'The city is stretched geographically , fiscally , and socially in so many direction that gaining a sense of unity around any shared cultural ideal is a daunting exercise , one that Memphis has only recently begun to undertake .', 'This chapter explores the emergence of “ sustainability ” in policy making and cultural perception in Memphis through conversation and controversy surrounding a proposal to institute a multi-use trail network across a geophysical landscape marked by socioeconomic and racial segregation .', 'As Wanda Rushing ( 2009 ) puts it , “ for more than one hundred year , changing view of space and place , conflicting value of ‘ progress ’ and preservation , as well as division of race , class , and gender have affected the physical and symbolic production of urban landscape in Memphis ” ( Rushing 2009 ) .', 'How does the concept of “ sustainability ” as a social ideal play into the policy and decision making that are going to shape the future of a global city mired in a history of especially poor race relation , white flight , and cultural isolationism ?', 'A conversation on “ sustainability ” can not occur without first dismantling a racialized “ culture of fear ” that impacts nearly every aspect of urban life in Memphis ( Glassner 2000 ) .', 'To accomplish this , we dissect the discourse and practice associated with “ community ” and “ safety ” as they relate to transportation policy , urban planning , and alternative transportation infrastructure project .', 'We demonstrate how “ safety ” and “ community ” take on different meaning , even in adjoining neighborhood , and provide ethnographic snapshot of people and community affecting ( or affected by ) various connectivity and livability project .', 'The urban environment design and environmental pollution effect to the health .', "Urban environment Design is the core of the urban construction , urban environment can beautify the city , promote the city culture , improve people 's standard of living .", 'In environment design , the resulting health hazard caused by environmental pollution is becoming increasingly serious .', 'In some area has the serious influence to the local economic development and social stability .', 'Strategic countermeasure and suggestion are put forward to establish environmental health management system based on the analysis of the effect of water pollution , heavy metal pollution .', 'Innovation and creativity in a design of high quality public space .', 'Case study of Poznan , Poland .', 'The paper deal with the question of a public space creation through the implementation of art and design .', 'The idea of promotion the cultural feature within a public space helps to increase the city space attractiveness .', 'The author presents the case study of a downtown area of a city of Poznan in Poland , Wielkopolska region .', 'As a result of an observation that there is a lack of a public space of culture and art in Poznan city centre , there is presented a proposal of an innovative and attractive function implementation .', 'There is also presented the research method of public space activization through art and design .', 'The art is understood not only as temporary event but as the piece of a small architecture and built area of a cultural function as well .', 'There was created an idea of a MAD city for people - which means searching for meaning , action and design in a city centre space .', 'This idea is to be used as a tool to identify the existing and potential space for art in a city centre and to define whether it is a space of sacrum or of profanum .', 'The tool helps to define what is the best use and purpose of a space in a context of an art implementation .', 'It is also to create a functional system of socially and spatially attractive public space within a city centre .', 'Impact of rail technology in 21st Century U.S. Cities .', 'This presentation analyzes the impact of transit technology on the urban environment and evaluates land use , station design , and transit cost as a means of projecting the best option for intermodal station and transit-oriented development .', 'Several commuter rail , AMTRAK , and freight rail corridor may be used in the future to accommodate heavy , light and/or high-speed rail system in the United States .', 'Diesel/electric locomotive , which populate urban rail corridor , have heavy load requirement and are industrial and/or utilitarian in appearance .', 'However , diesel multiple unit ( DMUs ) with lighter weight , increased fuel efficiency , ease of accessibility , additional capacity , enhanced performance and lower cost are competing for their market share .', 'Currently , monorail , people mover , and streetcars - along with the traditional light and heavy rail system - have public acceptance to enrich the urban environment surrounding the existing corridor , and enhance commuter experience .', 'Many city , however , are at a crossroad regarding transitioning from an automobile culture to a rail culture .', 'Therefore , local city willingly embrace opportunity for better environment .', '5th KKU International Engineering Conference .', 'Urban concept of a healthy city : Case study - Tripoli , Libya .', 'At a time when there is a close relationship between the occurrence of many type of disease and a city urban environment it
