place ' that generate an environment that people of all culture can have associative relationship with .", "This paper explores the notion of Cultural Literacy and the impact of design decision on the cultural life of Australia 's diverse community .", 'Method Cultural Literacy can be understood as the ability to read , understand , find significance , evaluate and compare local culture .', "As Lefebvre [ 1996 ] states `` Cultural Literacy can be seen as the skill base associated with understanding both the encoding and decoding required to develop culturally meaningful product , place or program '' .", 'The paper will present a cultural literacy framework for seeing , planning and designing through an intercultural lens .', "Result By understanding the community multiple 'place narrative ' and seeing thing through an intercultural lens it is possible to plan and develop more inclusive and culturally sensitive public space .", 'Conclusion As culture is what gives meaning to our life then everything we do should have a cultural dimension .', 'Therefore , all planning is or at least should be cultural , and be at the very centre of thinking about city , not just about our social or civic life but also about the environment , infrastructure and economics of the city .', "The presenter will explore the potential of responsive planning and understanding the consequence and implication of urban planning on a community 's cultural life and highlight a range of Cultural Literacy tool for planner and urban designer .", 'Using of indigenous knowledge in agriculture .', 'Experience shows that indigenous knowledge not only has no contradiction with formal knowledge but different indigenous knowledge feature , put it as well complementary for formal knowledge .', 'Indigenous knowledge is accessible , useful and cheap .', 'Its perspective is holistic and its transmission is verbal .', 'Knowledge is dynamic and time-tested , and while it has grown within local natural and social environment , so it is very sustainable with indigenous condition .', 'Indigenous knowledge refers to both component and whole part of culture of each nation and this component and whole integration is so that stop to change traditional society of life without indigenous knowledge out of its cultural origin and therefore would lose it concept and effectiveness .', 'in recent decade following issue had been recognized very essential : programming and performing development plan , indigenous knowledge at farming , pest control , ranching , veterinary , nutrition , medicine , watershed management , foresting , architecture , urban planning , social association and decision making method as sustainable technology .', 'At on hand , reason of this great evolution can be found due to wrong policy and at the other hand in undesirable environmental consequence of these policy .', 'Indigenous knowledge is different with scientific knowledge that was established by university and scientific community .', 'This knowledge is basis for decision making at field of agriculture , health , education , food and natural source Indigenous knowledge is set of all knowledge and skill that people enjoy in one geographical area ( in one environmental condition ) that most of their skill and knowledge be transmitted to next generation , and new generation would be adapted with them and add to it Since , each knowledge is consequent of individual interaction with environment , so indigenous knowledge is consequent of indigenous people interaction with their environment .', 'Urban environmental management and traffic improvement .', 'As an important part of urban environment , urban traffic environment is one of the key factor that cause urban environment pollution .', "This kind of pollution is comprehensive and involves natural environment , ecological environment , social environment and humanistic landscape , even people 's mentality , etc .", 'So it is a complicated system engineering to solve the urban traffic environmental problem , and traffic environment improvement is crucial for the urban environmental management .', "In this paper , the author illustrates the opinion of considering policy , regulation , management , technology and culture in urban environmental management , meanwhile , we should advocate green traffic , cultivate noble urban traffic culture , make the urban traffic convenient for people 's living and working , so it can maintain the harmonious environment and realize the harmonious development between human and nature .", 'The method of livable environmental evaluation based on remote sensing technology .', 'Livable environment is one of the hot topic within the realm of the international research in urban science , and it recently becomes the focus of global government and city resident .', 'The evaluative content of a livable city came out more earlier in developed country , and got rapid development.Presently , the developed country have set up one and another representative of livable city , while China is still in the process of urbanization and industrialization.When we are cheering the tremendous success during the reformation , we should also realize the harm as a result of those achievement to environment.So , a livable city has become the development target by more and more cities.When evaluating a livable city , we should make sure the evaluation index system.Presently ?', 'relevant research of theory about the evaluation index from home and aboard are based on economic , society , environment , landscape , culture , safety and so on .', 'Those data are gathered either statistic or through questionnaire and investigate .', 'While livable city is a complex system with biological integrality , just one or two outstanding index can not show that the residential environment is on a high level.Therefore , the paper sets up the evaluative framework and method of a livable city focusing on remote sensing data .', "Then discusses how to gather and choose information with RS and GIS technique , confirm the definition , quantify all the index to make them meaningful and comparative.And when we are choosing their index , we should take account of the way of how to get these data , the method of handling and quantifying those information.The index system based on multi-scale remote sensing information includes content as follows : traffic density and convenience , distribution and volume ratio of urban building , analysis on the landscape pattern of urban green-space and ecological construction , spatial configuration of urban city , urban heat effect , monitoring and evaluation of wetland area , assessment of ecological environment and security , vegetation fraction estimation , distribution of infrastructure , land use and land cover , terrain and physiognomy , geological disaster-prone area analysis , water conservation district , urban open area and so an.And the paper integrates these information with that of non-remote sensing , such as people 's identify with the residential environment , amenity of nature environment , convenience of public establishment , satisfaction of human relation and so on.After analyzing , quantifying and evaluating those data , the paper then brings forward a comprehensive index system.Moreover , the paper presents the comprehensive evaluation model aiming to assess the residential environment of Chongqing city .", 'The model includes a large amount of factors-factors on remote sensing and other assistant factor coming from statistic data.When building the model , we should take the consistency and standardization process between different remote sensing data , and between remote sensing data with non-remote sensing data into account , also the independence , representative and importance of these factors.Therefore , we should analyze and evaluate all the factor to make sure the remarkable one , eliminate redundancy information , and make certain the power of the factor which are used in the model.Thus , the paper sets up the comprehensive evaluation model , and does research and evaluation on the residential environment .', 'At last the paper puts forward the measure about how to improve human settlement , and give suggestion for the urban planning , reformation and development for a livable city .', 'Word and music .', 'Aboriginals-related publication in Taiwan are becoming richer in content and style due to the growing concern for aboriginal issue and the effort to promote aboriginal culture .', 'Aboriginal songwriter have started to create new work , often combining aboriginal and non-aboriginal element .', 'The Shung Ye Museum of Formosan Aborigines has been translating texts written by Spanish and Dutch colonist during their stay on the island in the 17th century to have a more complete understanding of indigenous people in earlier time .', 'Aside from producing its own publication , the museum is promotes those released by other publisher from time to time and makes special edition for exhibition it holds annually to focus on aboriginal-related theme .', "The Taiwan 's Indigenous Peoples Resource Center ( TIPRC ) , an agency commissioned by CIP , is collecting publication and establishing a digital archive of everything aboriginal .", 'Giving indigenous people a voice .', "The Taiwan Indigenous TV ( TITV ) , the first TV station devoted to the Taiwan 's aboriginal , is performing a vital task to help aborigine to keep their language and culture alive .", "TITV 's news department often offers break story concerning aborigine , while the station also tackles sensitive issue .", 'Program at TITV are diverse , ranging from cooking show featuring traditional recipe from the various tribe , rarely shown on mainstream TV , to segment educating child about their native language and culture , to talk show and interview covering serious issue including the health , economic and educational problem faced by aborigine .', 'TITV regularly invites distinguished aborigine such as respected scholar to speak on air about matter concerning indigenous people , including unemployment , alcoholism , inadequate health care , fading custom and the sense of isolation felt by youth unable to assimilate into mainstream Taiwanese society .', 'Strengthening the root .', 'Indigenous movement in Taiwan , intended to make both indigenous people and Taiwan as a whole more competitive , is promising Taiwan a brighter future through reviving the traditional wisdom of indigenous people , which can contribute significantly to the promotion of many highly promising venture such as eco-tourism and leisure culture .', 'The government is trying to design a new partnership that be defined in constitutional revision , with an entire chapter devoted to indigenous people , a significant step to safeguard the status of aboriginal in accordance with their will .', 'The Council of Indigenous Peoples ( CIP ) works legally as the coordinator of aboriginal affair among different ministry .', 'The council has began to take charge of management of some 250,000 hectare of land reserved for habitation and cultivation by aboriginal .', 'North Americas first civil engineer construct seventh century suspension bridge at yaxchilan .', "A millennium before Europeans reached the Americas , the Maya had developed one of the world 's longest lasting civilization .", 'This society reached its peak during the classic period , which extended from 250 BC to 900 AD .', 'During their 2000-year history , the Maya held domain over a powerful Empire ruled by City States .', 'The Maya Empire established a scientifically based culture while Europe languished in the Dark Ages .', 'During their classic period , the Maya developed numerous scientific and engineering advancement .', 'These ingenious people developed a mathematical system that recognized the concept of the number zero seven hundred year before the Europeans ; a calendar system that is more advanced than our current calendar ; ingenious engineering application including manufacturing of cement , clear span cast-in-place concrete structure ; and a complex infrastructure that served the need of their sophisticated and highly populated ceremonial urban center .', 'Around 700 AD the Maya achieved an exceptional feat in civil engineering history with the construction of a long-span suspension bridge across the Usumacinta River at the ceremonial center at Yaxchilan .', 'The 63 meter center span was the longest in the world until Italian engineer constructed a 76 meter bridge over the Adda River in northern Italy in 1377 .', 'Life in Long Beach .', 'Long beach , with almost a half a million people is the second largest city in the Los Angeles basin .', 'The city has grown into a modern center of culture , entertainment , and commerce .', 'It is best known for its wide beach extending from harbor , next to shore-line village to south along the coast .', 'The city is constitutes diverse cultural group and consists of largest Cambodian community outside Cambodia .', 'The long beach is connected to Los Angeles by light-trail trollys , which connects other trolley and subway line .', 'The development strategy of sustainable regional level water management plan : An agenda for Bangladesh perspective ..', 'In common with current global concern over wise use and effective management of water , the Government of Bangladesh is committed to exploring , developing and using its water resource to the benefit of all user .', 'To this end the Ministry of Water Resources published the first National Water Policy in 1999 , whereas the paper focuses the Regional Water Management Plan ( RWMP ) with the intention of guiding both public and private action in the future for ensuring optimal development and management of water that benefit both individual and the society at large .', 'This Paper aims to ensure progress towards fulfilling national goal of economic development , poverty alleviation , food security , public health and safety , decent standard of living for the people and protection of the natural environment .', 'The Plan is presented in three phase : in the short-term ( 2000-05 ) it is considered a firm plan of ongoing and new activity ; in the medium-term ( 2006-10 ) it is an indicative plan , and in the long-term ( 2011-25 ) a perspective plan .', 'Implementation of the plan is to be monitored regularly and it will be updated every five year ( IWRM , 2002 ) .', 'Water is central to the way of life in Bangladesh .', 'Indeed , the river system , many of which emanate from outside the country , have shaped much of the history , economy , literature and rich culture of the people .', 'However , with a burgeoning population of 129 million expected to rise to 181 million by 2025 and to 224 million by 2050 ( IWRM , 2002 ) , the country faces many challenge ahead in an era of increasing globalization .', 'Rapid urbanization is expected with 40 % of people living in the town and major city by 2025 , and 60 % by 2050 ( WARPO , 2001 ) .', 'Poverty is still endemic with over half the population classified as poor .', 'In addressing these and other related issue , this paper sets new paradigms for the water sector , which include : decentralized water management ; cost sharing and cost recovery ; private sector participation ; community participation ; nontraditional financing modality ; regulation separated from supply ; and new right , obligation and accountability .', 'Inter-organisational co-operation in improving access to activity centre by public transport .', 'The accessibility to city centre and large attraction park increasingly becomes an issue of concern for location owner .', 'They seek possibility to offer transport service as an alternative to car use .', 'In doing so , co-operation with public transport company is important .', 'These company do not yet have the culture and opportunity to develop tailor-made service .', 'Institutional change yielding more market incentive and good information sharing should help to bridge the gap between these party .', "In particular a shared view on the service level to be offered , based on investigation of visitor ' preference , should be the starting point for inter-organisational co-operation .", 'Tokyo life .', 'Culture , people and government .', 'This largely promotional and pictorial book represents an overview of current issue facing the city of Tokyo and the Tokyo Metropolitan Government .', 'It features the culture , lifestyle and administration of Tokyo , as seen from the viewpoint of its citizen .', 'The book is intended to give visitor an insight into contemporary urban life .', 'It achieves this is seven part , each devoted to a particular topic , including : the role of park and outdoor recreation in the metropolis ; a day in the life of Toyko ; the family-run and small business sector ; a geographical overview of the city and the prospect for the urban environment and development of Tokyo .']

['Autonomous adaptation to global environmental change in peri-urban settlement : Evidence of a growing culture of innovation and revitalisation in Mathare Valley Slums , Nairobi .', 'The growth of peri-urban area is increasingly recognised as a dominant planning and urban design challenge for the 21st century .', 'In burgeoning poor urban settlement growing on city margin , autonomous adaptation strategy are often the only measure to respond to increasing climatic and compounding stressor .', 'Yet , in both research and practice there remains lack of understanding regarding the dynamic of adaptation and risk reduction at the level of the community .', 'In this paper , we argue urban slum are ideal place to consider adaptation because they offer example of more extreme social-ecological stress than one finds in more established community - the kind we can anticipate more broadly in the face of climate change .', 'A framework for identifying local adaptation processes is presented and applied to analyse the case of Mathare Valley Slums in Nairobi , Kenya - a densely populated suburb , where resident are regularly exposed to flooding from heavy rainfall .', 'Finding reveal that slum , often viewed as illegitimate , makeshift , and temporary settlement , are place experienced by many resident as permanent community characterised by rapid environmental change .', 'Process of adaptation in Mathare have become institutionalised through time , as a new generation of people imagine themselves staying and ( re ) organise to achieve a higher level of functioning through various strategy to reduce risk .', "Innovative and revitalising adaptation occurs as resident shift from employing more generic and expected coping strategy , such as evacuating home or economic diversification , to creating `` gated '' community and saving scheme to maintain and improve the settlement , despite uncertain tenure .", 'Both formal and informal institution , such as youth group , play an important role in governing such heterogeneous locality , incrementally upgrading the slum and providing critical public service .', "Long-term resident ' increasing recognition of the permanence of the slum community and its stressful condition appears to lead to more collective action toward adaptation pathway .", "However , this is in marked contrast to the dominant non-local perspective of Mathare 's status as both impermanent and illegal , which prevails among government official .", 'As such , strategy are generally not incorporated into planned intervention .', 'While progressive policy designed to reduce risk exist , they remain nascent in their establishment and fail to benefit slumdwellers .', 'The case illustrates the need to incorporate the wealth of knowledge , technique , and experience extant at the community level in the development of adaptation planning .', 'Slum upgrading and inclusive municipal governance in Harare , Zimbabwe : New perspective for the urban poor .', 'The story of the urban poor in Harare and Zimbabwean city in general is a story of eviction , fear and misery .', 'In May 2005 , at the behest of the Government of Zimbabwe the infamous Operation Restore Order , a house demolition campaign left more than 700 thousand people homeless .', "Nearly a decade later , there are increased opportunity for improvement and change in the life of the urban poor in Harare , Zimbabwe 's capital city .", 'The purpose of the paper is to present how the Harare Slum Upgrading Programme is creating and strengthening municipal and community partnership to tackle city challenge in an inclusive manner .', 'This research indicates the housing struggle of the urban poor and the emerging City-community engagement in urban service provision ( water , sanitation , tenure security and road ) and changing municipal attitude towards the urban poor .', 'In particular , the article presents participatory urban planning and development , slum upgrading institutional structure , profiling and enumeration , and slum upgrading impact ( resilience of the urban poor , living in slum without fear , expansive pool of beneficiary , review of planning regulation and land ownership ) as major issue promoting inclusive municipal governance .', 'Inclusivity is implemented through incremental development , which is allowing people to settle on land first and access municipal service gradually over time .', 'Two main factor explain such positive step towards inclusive governance in Harare .', "First are indication of gradual institutional change in which the City of Harare 's governance culture is changing through 'opening up ' and embracing the urban poor .", 'Second , over the year , the urban poor have built a strong and vibrant alliance which is acting as a medium of participation in City governance .', 'The paper concludes that slum upgrading sustainability at city-wide level requires active City participation and institutionalisation as opposed to a project based approach .', 'Lastly , addressing concern of the urban poor is susceptible to political contestation , requiring strong impartiality to counter such force .', 'Population and climate change .. To review , the four broad dimension of any complex human problem , including climate change , are the human population , economics , culture , and environment .', 'These dimension interact with one another in all direction and on many time-scales .', 'From 2010 to 2050 , the human population is likely to grow bigger , more slowly , older , and more urban .', "It is projected that by 2050 more than 2.6 billion people ( almost 94 % of global urban growth ) will be added to the urban population in today 's developing country .", "That works out to 1.26 million additional urban people in today 's developing country every week from 2010 to 2050 .", 'Human alter the climate by emitting greenhouse gas , by altering planetary albedo , and by altering atmospheric component .', "Between 1900 and 2000 , human ' emission of carbon into the atmosphere increased fifteenfold , while the number of people increased less than fourfold .", 'Population growth alone , with constant rate of emission per person , could not account for the increase in the carbon emission to the atmosphere .', 'The world economy grew sixteenfold in the twentieth century , accompanied by enormous increase in the burning of gas , oil , and coal .', 'In the last quarter of the twentieth century , population grew much faster in developing country than in high-income country , and , compared with population growth , the growth of carbon emission to the atmosphere was even faster in developing country than in high-income country .', 'The ratio of emissions-to-population growth rate was 2.8 in developing country compared with 1.6 in high-income country .', 'Emission of CO2 and other greenhouse gas are influenced by the size and density of settlement , the size of household , and the age of householder .', 'Between 2010 and 2050 , these demographic factor are anticipated to change substantially .', 'Therefore demography will play a substantial role in the dynamic of climate change .', 'Climate change affect many aspect of the living environment , including human settlement , food production , and disease .', 'These change will affect poor people more severely than rich , and poor nation more severely than rich .', 'Yet not enough is known to predict quantitatively many detail that will matter enormously to future people and other specie .', 'Three kind of response are related to demographic issue that affect climate change : universal secondary education , voluntary contraception and maternal health service , and smarter urban design and construction .', 'These response may prevent , reduce , or ameliorate the impact of climate change .', 'They are as relevant to rich country as to poor , though in way that are as different as are rich country and poor .', 'They are desirable in their own right because they improve the life of the people they affect directly ; and they are desirable for their beneficial effect on the larger society and globe .', 'They are effective response to the twin challenge of reducing poverty and reducing greenhouse gas emission .', 'Scale , regime , and the urban governance of Glasgow .', 'Over the last two decade , urban regime theory has become one of the most dominant paradigms of thought in urban study .', 'In particular , regime theory offers a complex account of urban governance , or how local government , the business community , and community organization gain the capacity to shape the policy that affect city , that is , govern .', 'Although regime theory is a dominant theory in urban study , it does , nevertheless , have its share of detractor , and one criticism has been its failure to take into account geographical scale .', 'While there is an acknowledgment in urban regime theory of wider economic process , such as the broad transformation in international and national trade , investment , finance , etc.', ', or the role played by federal or state government , the bias has remained mostly local , particularly in regard to urban governance .', 'In urban regime theory literature the policy and action of international and national institution either nicely conjoin with local interest or are nearly totally absent .', 'Due to this oversight , urban regime theory tends to underemphasize how the capacity to govern a city effectively is sometimes the result of the interaction of action of people at multiple scale .', 'This article attempts to address this oversight in an analysis of Glasgow , Scotland , during the 1980s .', 'By focusing on the role of the European City of Culture in the revitalization of the city , this article demonstrates how the capacity for a ruling coalition to transform the city and to govern effectively was the consequence of the policy and administrative action undertaken at other geographical scale .', "If strategic `` planning is everything , maybe it 's nothing '' .", 'Collectively designing new image of a city to translate it into priority for investment is really too demanding .', 'It is rarely possible to do that , a special context and culture is needed , for instance , a republican culture , orienting people and decision-makers toward some common value and target , is a precondition .', 'After decade of individualism , to reconstruct a republican culture might be necessary , but it very difficult and not a short-term objective .', 'It should be kept in mind that while strategic planning and planning in general are opportunity for the government and dependent on political will , land-use planning , even in a simplified zoning form , is a necessity : the urban market needs it ; there is no way of managing city growth without some form of grid and regulation .', 'This makes a big difference between strategic planning and land-use planning .', 'Borrowing from the past to sustain the present and the future : indigenous African urban form , architecture , and sustainable urban development in contemporary Africa .', 'Urban spatial expansion resulting from urbanization in Sub-Saharan Africa ( SSA ) is not going to stop or stabilize in the near future .', 'Effort should therefore be concentrated on accommodating this phenomenon through the promotion of sustainable urban planning and development .', 'Relying on secondary data , this paper examines model of indigenous African urban form and architecture to understand these form and their characteristic , and how these model and associated management , design , and planning principle can be adopted in contemporary SSA urban development in the quest to achieve sustainable urban development .', 'This paper argues that planning is culturally and contextually defined and the specificity of a place are critical in planning .', "Developing strategy based on indigenous urban form which embody local people ' culture , aspiration , experience , and value is consistent with the concept of sustainable urban development .", 'The article concludes that there exist clear element of socially , politically , economically , culturally , and environmentally sound and responsive sustainable planning principle to be derived from indigenous urban form and architecture which can inform current urban development process in SSA .', "Integrative analysis of city system : Bangkok 'man and the biosphere ' programme study .", 'This paper argues that integrative analysis of city system helps us to see beyond their current environmental and social problem to underlying cause , and it suggests different opportunity for possible intervention .', "Focusing on a single aspect of a city or its people without understanding its context risk intervention which treat symptom rather than cause and whose short-term 'solution ' often means that the problem return in the same or perhaps a different form .", 'Our integrative analysis of Bangkok suggests that the root of its environmental ( and some social ) problem lie in decision-making structure and a political culture which has historically fostered self interested decision by stakeholder rather than the public interest .', 'This has produced a land use and built environment configuration that largely ignores the functioning of the natural flood plain ecosystem and the well-being of resident .', 'People adapt their behaviour to their environment but often in way that have serious cumulative impact on the city .', 'This analysis suggests that problem need to be addressed at their source : the nature of decision-making by stakeholder , at every level .', 'This requires the engagement of all party inside and outside government , the elite and otherwise .', 'To the extent that planning has a viable role , the focus needs to be on the source of the impact , such as national development planning , rather than in sector such as transport , where the problem are evident .', 'The urban fabric of Igbo architecture in South-eastern Nigeria in the 1990s .', 'This paper seeks to explore the extent to which local building tradition have been retained within modern urban housing development in primarily Igbo-speaking area of South-eastern Nigeria in the 1990s .', 'Its premise is that there are vestige of tradition which remain part of the urban fabric in most southern Nigerian town .', 'It is thought that these tradition can , and should , be developed further to ensure that there is a positive integration of the old with the new , in the physical form , aesthetic and theoretical interpretation of urban design .', 'Also as a development model , this integration approach has considerable relevance to other aspect of Nigerian urban life where there is the need for the accommodation of various culture and social background .', 'Relevant material , including documented data , will be used to discuss the premise and theory put forward .', 'Central to the main theme is the argument for a re-ordering of architectural design and urban planning in southern Nigeria to better accommodate the more traditional or cultural feature of life as the illustration shown will highlight .', 'The paper focuses specifically on the Igbo-speaking area of South-eastern Nigeria .', 'The development of its housing fabric has varied distinctly from that of Northern and South-western Nigeria , which both have the effect of Islamic influence and , in the latter region , Brazilian and European influence , on local culture to be considered .', 'Both these region have had more urbanised and cosmopolitan cultural indigenous development pattern than the south-east .', 'The text occasionally , however , draws architectural comparison with these Nigerian region and other developing area .', "It would seem that 'Igboland ' escaped these influence mainly due to its geographical location in the hinterland of South-eastern Nigeria .", 'Islam did not penetrate as far down from North-eastern Nigeria to the south-east as it had done from North-western Nigeria to the south-west .', 'This was partly due to the more tropical humid terrain which was detrimental to horse and mounted warfare and the way in which religious war or Jihad were traditionally fought .', 'Also , the acephalous societal organisation of the Igbos , when contrasted with the more hierarchical Northern Hausa and Western Yoruba society , were less predisposed to convert voluntarily from native individualised worship to a more structured heirarchic monotheistic religion .', 'Being away from the Atlantic coast of Nigeria meant that European influence took longer to affect hinterland Igbo lifestyles .', 'It also meant that the area had few settlement of repatriated and freed African slave who had made their way back to Nigeria from America and Brazil .', 'Called Saros and Agudas respectively , these returnees brought with them new cultural style and established residential settlement which were influential in the development of coastal town such as Lagos and Calabar .', 'Similarly , missionary and government enterprise reached the Igbo hinterland much later than the coast , thus Christianity and its cultural influence was felt much later in this area .', 'The text occasionally , however , draws architectural comparison with other Nigerian region and other developing country .', 'Hybrid coordination of city organisation : The rule of people and culture in the shadow of structure .', 'Under far-reaching reform , many city have delegated core task previously delivered by their administration to independent organisation that they formally own , e.g .', 'municipal company , or supervise , e.g .', 'municipal trust fund .', 'The coordination of these ( as we call them ) ‘ domestic ’ city organisation has proven challenging .', 'Extant literature argues that such coordination is achieved through a mix of various hierarchical , market and network mechanism .', 'Yet it is unclear how these mode are combined .', 'Addressing this gap , we ask : How do governance mode interact in the hybrid coordination of domestic city organisation ?', 'Analysing the case of Vienna , where 100 domestic organisation employ about 60,000 people , we find that while cultural mechanism , rooted in the network mode , are predominant , they unfold in the shadow of latent structural mechanism , which are associated with hierarchy and market .', 'In the background , structural mechanism keep cultural coordination effective , while cultural mechanism allow structural coordination to remain ( generally ) hidden .', 'This study aims to contribute to the literature on the governance of public organisation by exploring the relationship between governance mode as well as furthering urban governance study by applying insight from study on the coordination of public organisation to the city context .', 'Unexplored elasticity of planning and good governance in Harare , Zimbabwe .', 'The state of the city of Harare in term of its present general outlook and critical analysis of its carrying capacity as a colonial city tends to perpetuate an ingrained myth among urban planner and the common people alike that planning has failed the former so called sunshine-city .', 'Yet such a view treats with amnesia the wealth in the elasticity of planning as an instrument for change as well as a strategic force to command and direct the trajectory of city .', 'It is in this context that this paper discusses the elasticity of planning of Harare as anchored on a complex but well-knit constellation of the factor of good urban governance and political will .', 'These can allow for urban reform and smart transformation .', 'A close look at the city after 1980 shows that the city of Harare has been subjected to much bickering , contestation and intergovernmental imposition of policy hence it exemplifies policy from above as opposed to policy from below .', "This is largely explained by the central government 's hard and fast wrenching control in directing the affair of the city hence negating the role of the resident ' need and wants .", 'Recently the city has been facing several challenge , more than ever before , and the more critical challenge now is the adopted culture of colonial blaming rather that solving the deep seated problem of poor management approach .', 'The present study is skewed towards assessing the historical and contemporary socio-economic and political dynamic as far as they have inspired , championed , ignored , and arm-twisted planning .', 'This has largely been to the detriment of the city .', 'Thus , a vortex and maelstrom over the relevance of planning has been created which now requires planning to exonerate itself by proving its worthiness to the citizen and investor whose creed and needs it has betrayed over the year .', 'The socio-cultural dimension of housing : Quality in Osogbo Nigeria .', 'House-form has played a significant role in the socio-cultural adaptation of most people and society in Nigeria .', 'Specifically , within the Yoruba ethnic group of south-western part of Nigeria .', 'To them , the house represents a status symbol , which every member of a particular family identifies with .', 'The pattern and form of such dwelling have played vital role in shaping and influencing the lifestyle of the people .', 'The house to them is a place for moral and social formation as well as for physical and psychology reformation .', 'Unfortunately , the effect and infusion of western cultural contact through civilization , technological advancement and the unfolding world order of globalization on majority of African society and people have created loss of originality in housing form and pattern as well as loss of cultural value of the people .', 'This paper , which emanated from a previous resear ch by the Author , intends to evaluate the significance of house- form on housing quality as well as on the lifestyle of the Nigeria people .', 'Osogbo , a traditional as well as an urbanized township was used as case study .', '( The finding of the research are representative of the Housing situation in most Nigerian society ) .', 'The study , which identified three ( 3 ) zone of re idential and urban development revealed a significant relationship between House-form and Housing quality within the residential district of Osogbo .', 'It also affirmed the predominance of the Yoruba ethnic origin over other ethnic origin in Osogbo .', 'The paper submitted that any housing planning and de velopment that ignores the relevant socio-cultural form and pattern would invariably lack originality and relevance to the target population .', 'It , therefore , recommends that Government , housing planner and developer should take house-form of the different sub-cultures into consideration before embarking on future housing development .', 'The Delhis within Delhi .', 'Concept and technique of human settlement can not be divided from social and economic reality in which they are located .', 'One of the most important factor is the development of the historical force .', 'This is shown in the case of Delhi .', 'Today , Delhi is not one single city anymore .', 'Apart from the complexity that all similarly sized urban area show there are many district with their unique background , character , personality and culture .', "To improve living condition in the old area of the city , while still retaining their character , the `` conservative surgery ' approach may be adopted , rather than extensive re-development scheme .", 'The people for which shelter is designed must be met with confidence and their real participation must be sought .', 'For achieving all this , planning has first to start from outside Delhi , and the National Capital Region plan , the recommendation of the National Commission of Urbanization , and the National Housing Policy all have an impact .', 'In the foreseeable future , Delhi is going to be a city of flat .', 'Maybe this is the only workable solution .', 'To achieve culturally the best result , this kind of development should preferably be done through co-operatives rather than government office .', '-from Author', 'Neoliberal urban sustainability in Old Kolkata , India : Case study of contested development .', 'Neoliberalism , a contemporary form of liberalism , advocates supremacy of market economic valuation in the social choice and decision .', 'Expectedly the neoliberal political-economic compulsion have opened up scope for capitalistic investment in the city of Kolkata .', 'But , due to lack of decentralized urban facility and a typical outlook of the people to stay in the “ core ” area , construction of high-rise building replacing the traditional structure and associated culture in the old and heritage area is prominent .', 'Cost of living in the urban core has been increasing rapidly due to the advent of the affluent family , having more purchasing power parity ; and thus , the people living for generation as old-settlers have to give up their possession of land to drift towards the periphery or sustain by compromising their opulence .', 'As observed , the middle-income group are badly affected by the consequence of post-liberalized development .', "This study has been done on the basis of the author ' participant observation , and review of different published literature to build a theoretical framework , followed by perception survey of the diverse resident to understand the problem and validate the proposition .", 'It is argued , that unlike the traditional socially clustered neighbourhood , especially in old Kolkata , the renewed vertical extension of the gated habitation is promoting more social segregation and exclusion in which interdependence and cohabitation in urban governance may not be truly representative , and therefore , unsustainable in future .', 'The research can add significant knowledge in the domain of urban governance and appropriate designing of the cultural cityscape of Kolkata .', 'Migration , translation , and transformation of western urban planning model .', 'People , idea , lifestyle , culture , architecture and urban planning model have invariably traversed the world as a consequence of military compulsion , political goal , commercial motivation , or aspirational value .', 'Western model in particular have spread widely , first through colonization and , recently , as a consequence of globalization .', 'It is well-known that many city around the world have been impacted by western urban planning model but , curiously no comprehensive comparative study of these influence has so far been attempted .', 'This essay stems from 5 year of teaching and research in the field of urban history and presents a series of example from non-western context such as India , China , Africa , South America , and elsewhere to showcase the direct or indirect impact of several western urban planning model .', 'The aim is to analyse how differently these model , such as the English garden city , Le Corbusier ’ s plan voisin concept , and Haussmann ’ s plan for Paris have been adopted by a number of non-western city and the degree to which they have been transformed by local contexts .', 'Indeed , frequently , the original concept of the exported model has been completely modified .', 'The essay also identifies those western urban model which have spread most widely .', 'There are , indeed , a series of western model which have proved more popular than others and it is worth attempting to understand why they have proved to be so .', 'Divided we stand : The Indian city afer economic liberalisation .', 'In the wake of economic liberalisation in the early 1990s , the Indian city has displaced the village in public imagination as the quintessence of India as rising , modern global power .', 'The nature and rate of urbanisation and urban growth have elicited multiple interpretation , notwithstanding an emerging consensus about the importance of the city in India ’ s future .', 'With city , especially larger one , being seen to propel economic growth in post-liberalisation India , they have come to be the focus of extensive , and arguably unprecedented , development policy .', 'If urban development policy have seen a sea of change in post-liberalisation period , these have been matched with the introduction of new form of urban governance .', 'Indian city are often represented as a melting pot of people , space and culture .', 'City , as configured by institution , practice and idea of governance , relating to both private and state actor , remain exclusionary space from the perspective of the poor , despite the upsurge of ‘ inclusion ’ as a stated public commitment .', 'Planning for nomad at the urban periphery : Paradox or possibility ?', '.', 'The national identity of the nomad in Mongolia are being given importance by urban planner and aid-donating institution .', "On the contrary , the Mongolian government think otherwise as they want to end this nomadic national identity as it is being seen as a `` culture of poverty '' .", 'The Brazilian government has been criticized by Janice Perlman for pulling away the settlement of these nomad as she believes that these community can be a vibrant part of the urban .', "Meanwhile , Mongolian pastoralists can only afford a `` ger '' which is a wood-frame felt tent that can be assembled within hour .", "The traditional way of life can be seen whenever these `` gers '' are seen within the vicinity .", "However , people who are living in such `` ger '' suburb are neither considered nomad or an urban dweller .", 'It is also strange to hear the concept of planning for nomadism as they themselves do not plan at all and that planning for them involves such critical decision .', 'As Mongolia adapts this nomad , it provides a lifestyle that can be sustained and challenges the link between poverty and informality and gives an understanding of the peripheral space .', "Overcoming politically induced resistance to payment for water in South Africa 's urban area .", 'The difficulty faced by South Africa in achieving reasonable level of payment for water supplied in urban area are in many respect similar to those applicable throughout the world .', 'In some respect , however , the problem are very different .', 'Decade of having to endure a politically offensive system has created negative attitude in the bulk of the population towards authority , and indeed towards service provider .', 'These attitude will not easily change .', 'As the majority of people had not real involvement in governance in the evolving political system during the nineteen eighty they increasingly regarded all authority as illegitimate .', 'An illegitimate system quite naturally had to be resisted and replaced .', 'The objective of resistance was to make the country ungovernable and hence open to change .', 'By withholding , initially , housing rental repayment to the State and , later , service payment to local authority a powerful weapon was brought into play .', "But with it came many other attitude change , currently referred to as a 'culture of non-payment ' , which the new democratic government is now forced to grapple with .", "The degree to which the level of payment for water service can be improved to acceptable level will be dependent in a general sense upon government 's success in changing attitude and , in particular , on water authority persuasiveness in inducing customer to take responsibility for paying for service rendered ."]

['HCI & sustainable food culture : A design framework for engagement .', 'The current food practice around the world raises concern for food insecurity in the future .', 'Urban / suburban / and peri-urban environment are particularly problematic in their segregation from rural area where the natural food source are grown and harvested .', 'Soaring urban population growth only deteriorates the lack of understanding in and access to fresh produce for the people who live , work , and play in the city .', 'This paper explores the role of Human Computer Interaction ( HCI ) design in encouraging individual user to participate in creating sustainable food culture in urban environment .', 'The paper takes a disciplinary perspective of urban informatics and present five core constituent of the HCI design framework to encourage sustainable food culture in the city via ubiquitous technology : the perspective of transdisciplinarity ; the domain of interest of people , place , and technology ; and the perspective of design .', 'Study on building plan for enhancing the social health of public apartment .', "Mass-produced in a short period of time , Korea 's public apartment contributed to easing the housing anxiety of the common people .", 'Nonetheless , they also gave rise to problem of social exclusion and conflict , becoming undesirable facility that weakened social health .', 'This study examined way of producing an improved building plan that can raise the level of social health of public apartment , which were consistently built in the past but will no doubt continue to be developed in the future .', 'For this study , the survey method was employed through a questionnaire with visual content especially developed to raise the level of social health based on two idea .', 'One was to increase the possibility of social interaction among resident , and the other was to increase opportunity for resident to interact with society as well as for their social integration .', 'The result showed that resident had mostly favorable view on the proposed plan : in particular , they favored highly the formation of a lobby in each apartment building as a venue for social interaction .', 'They also responded very favorably to the plan of creating within the building spare space that will be used not only to promote a communal culture , but to open to outside society as well for integration .', 'This study showed vital idea to ensure the recovery of the residential function of promoting social health in the public apartment of Korea .', 'It has significance in inspiring an innovative approach to allow social mixture in a relatively different feasible manner from the conventional approach .', 'Rethinking urban design for a changing public life .', 'Purpose – The nature and conceptualization of public space and public life have been always associated with collective participation and socialization – in other word , the capacity to live together among stranger .', 'Today these association seem to have become challenged and problematic , and often end in questioning whether public space still matter for our public life ?', 'This paper aims to bring new understanding to the reading of public life in public space and also contribute to rethinking of the role of urban design today within our changing public life .', 'Design/methodology/approach – The paper adopts participant/observation within a case/study area , “ Parque das Nações ” , in Lisbon , Portugal .', 'Finding – The paper identifies a number of spatial , social and experiential condition that are conducive to social interaction amongst stranger .', 'Often it is the combination of three factor that generates the most interaction .', 'Research limitations/implications – Participant observation is a useful method to study public behaviour in the public realm .', 'Nevertheless , as the study was conducted in one location , the finding may not be transferable to other locations/cultures , etc .', 'Practical implication – This paper demonstrates the need to rethink and adapt urban design practice to an increasing changing public life .', 'Urban design needs to be much more sensitive to all location ( planned and unplanned ) and the favourable spatial , experiential and social condition people make use of and which can provoke positive interaction need to be recognised .', 'Social implication A better understanding of the factor that are conducive to positive interaction between stranger and non/strangers in the public realm will help to develop more favourable condition for these to take place .', 'The interaction between people is part of the fabric of social life .', 'Originality/value – This is the first paper to combine social/spatial and experiential factor in the observation of social interaction in public place .', 'From designed space to designer savvy society : The potential of idea competition in willing participation .', 'The design of public space has gained importance as city are increasingly positioned in global flow of people , capital , and idea .', 'These space speak to the culture of a place as much as to the quality of its design , but the implementation of design as an inclusive process is fraught with difficulty .', "This is particularly pertinent in discussion about better way of engaging people with urban design , where there is often a language barrier between those who specialise in spatial manipulation and the broader 'society ' that uses this space .", 'This paper gives an empirical account of how a spatial consciousness can be translated to society through an international design competition .', "The competition method of urban design relies upon promotion and 'eventfulness ' , both of which interpolate the public and contribute towards the generation of a deeper interest in the spatial imaginary of city planning .", "The creation of 'urban design consumer ' through the visual consumption of the design themselves offers an alternative way to gain public interest to the established tradition of public notice and formal public meeting .", "In this case , the competition extended the activity of urban designer beyond the mechanic of 'space production ' to include 'consumer production ' where a more intimate relationship between city planning and the people began to emerge .", 'Suggesting theoretical urban neighborhood design concept by adopting the changing discourse of social capital .', 'Purpose : The purpose of this paper is to review , analyze and synthesize different piece from literature to explore , define and describe the concept of social capital and its relationship with urban neighborhood design concept .', 'Additionally , to define the indicator and principle that can enhance social capital within urban design context .', 'Moreover , to suggest theoretical urban neighborhood design concept that can adopt the changing discourse of social capital .', 'Design/methodology/approach : This research used the theoretical , analytical and descriptive approach-driven case study method .', 'In all , 29 paper were analyzed to conclude the indicator that can measure social capital within the urban neighborhood design context and to conclude the required neighborhood design feature and principle that influence social capital .', 'Additionally , two new urban neighborhood design concept , cohousing and hybrid concept that adopt new form of social interaction , were studied , analyzed and then synthesized to suggest new neighborhood design concept , which is a heterotopia concept .', 'Finding : Heterotopia neighborhood concept aims to create real , different and heterogeneous functional space with different layer of meaning for people from different culture in one place .', 'Different visible enclosure are merged into space of otherness while the diversity gives a sense of entering another alternative place .', 'The heterotopias neighborhood design principles aim to create a wide variety of form , shape and element [ different new space for different ritual activity to reflect the otherness self-reflection ( homogeneous and scattered space ) ] and create linkage , hierarchy , contrast and mingling between space and place ; well-defined functional effective space ; different fantasy and leisure space ; high standard quality of life and otherness space ; flux in social realm and fluidity of space ; mixed use and joint experience ; and innovated technology space to offer strange new temporality .', 'Research limitations/implications : This research recommended that different community stakeholder should participate in planning process , neighborhood urban design and decision-making process about public space to strengthen the community tie and achieve a heterotopia concept .', 'Architect , urban designer and planner should adopt bottom-up design approach when designing neighborhood .', 'Additionally , to avoid poor social capital research study , the new researcher , practitioner and journal reviewer approaching social capital for the first time must read widely to gain an understanding of the concept from different perspective and narrow their scope to their particular area of interest .', 'Practical implication : This research highlights the need for empirical study to examine the relationships/interrelationships between all neighborhood design principle and social capital .', 'This might increase the knowledge on how we can design and increase the quality of neighborhood to foster social capital , which might offer interesting insight into how neighborhood urban design principle are combined to foster social capital within neighborhood context .', 'Originality/value : Neighborhood-based research encourages new suggesting concept in designing every single place in the residential neighborhood in a way that can adapt the new form of social interaction .', 'This research scanned the current concept of neighborhood design that concerned successfully with the changing form of social relationship to conclude some design feature and principle for neighborhood design to ensure and promote social public health and well-being .', 'This research offers a unique perspective for better understanding the relationship between the neighborhood urban design as a spatial dimension and social capital .', 'This research aims to enrich the socio-spatial knowledge and build a resilient urban community by suggesting theoretical urban neighborhood design concept , which is the heterotopia concept , and providing the urban designer and architect with a valuable thinking tool to design space .', 'Designing urban smart furniture for facilitating migrant ’ integration : The co-design workshop as approach for supporting inclusive design .', 'European city are changing due the immigration of people from different culture .', 'There are many issue related to the integration and dialogue between culture .', 'Urban design plays a key role in how migrant participate in their host community and it is an important driver for the inclusion process .', 'Facilitating the participation of resident in designing public space and their use helps to create a better sense of belonging .', 'Promoting in public space the interaction of different culture becomes a crucial element to facilitate social cohesion and living together .', 'The research project explores an innovative approach in the use of public space , through the design of smart urban furniture .', 'Based on a survey of the user ’ s need , and on co-design activity , the project investigates innovative solution for facilitating migrant ’ integration and the dialogue between different culture , through the design of innovative urban furniture , with smart technology embodied inside .', 'The project , based on the co-design approach of rapid prototyping , creates different kind of new interaction among urban space and people , and between user of different social or cultural background .', 'The result presented in this paper , were conducted by the research unit of the University of Florence , in cooperation with the Human Tech Institute and the School of Management of the University of Applied Sciences and Arts Western Switzerland .', 'Art in the urban landscape .', 'This paper discusses the emerging use of public art in city as a means of positively transforming the urban environment .', 'It emphasizes the need for a symbiosis between an appropriate urban design and the natural transformation that occurs with the placement of sculpture in an urban context .', 'It comment on several example of planned artistic intervention and , in particular , analyses a recent major project of urban design in Concepcion , the third largest city in Chile .', "An environmental vision , that addresses itself to the contemporary city 's development , has also to consider that urban space should provide adequate venue for leisure and civic entertainment for the inhabitant .", 'Historically , the notion of art has been associated with the degree of culture of society and , indeed , it represents the expression and spirit of our urban community .', "Hence , together with the macro-planning goal of development , there exists a chance to restore people 's sense of belonging and pride of place , providing adequate space related to artistic manifestation that can contribute to the overall quality of life in neighbourhood and inner city area .", "The conclusion suggest that these type of artistic expression can be a key factor , but only by integration , that is a combination of an appropriate scale of intervention through urban design , rather than 'parachuting ' the art into different place .", 'Monitoring of electrical consumption , including self-isolation during the COVID-19 pandemic .', 'To date , one of the most relevant task is a justified calculation of the electrical capacity of residential building and public facility .', "Study conducted by the 'Roselectromontazh ' Association have shown a significant difference between the actual and calculated electrical capacity , which is further confirmed by the report of electric grid company .", 'In some case , there is a 3-fold difference .', 'This occurs due to the emergence of a sustainable culture of electricity consumption and the use of highly energy-efficient device .', 'In 2019 , the result of the research work were taken into account in the regional urban planning standard of the Republic of Tatarstan .', 'On average , the normative value have been reduced by 2 time .', 'This enabled a significant reduction in the difference between the actual and calculated electrical capacity .', "From 2020 onwards , leading construction company in the Republic of Tatarstan are applying up-to-date value to decrease utility service ' construction cost .", "For power grid company the saving consist of reduction of electrical energy loss and 'locked electrical capacity ' and the elimination of inefficient investment .", 'It is important to note that specific value of electrical load were calculated taking into account summer and winter peak in order to exclude the emergency .', 'However , it was impossible to predict a time when people would need to stay self-isolated at home to prevent the spread of severe acute respiratory syndrome-related coronavirus SARS-CoV-2 ( COVID-2019 ) .', 'Corresponding diagram relative to 2019 were constructed to determine the impact of the electricity consumption of residential building during lockdown .', 'Pleasure-based design approach to the built environment .', 'As an exercise in discipline cross-fertilisation , this paper applies the emergent practice of pleasure-based approach in product design to the design of the built environment .', "This analysis provides insight into human ' emotional response to the environment that is provided for them .", "Jordan 's four pleasure model , composed of physio- , socio- , psycho- and ideo-pleasures , is used to undertake this analysis .", 'From this analytical process it is evident that physio- , socio- and psycho-pleasures are drawn from generic element that relate to human as a kind , and that these commonality are deeply rooted historical and cultural reference point .', "Understanding these reference point , and the design principles that emerge from them , will enable those who provide the built environment to engage with the 'super-usability ' imperative that these pleasure-based approach have been drawn from and , in so doing , to develop human-centric solution that engender positive relationship between people and the environment that is provided for them .", "However , in the absence of a 'market ' , one area will remain problematic - that of personalised and individually constructed ideo-pleasure .", 'Research on Urban Public Art Design Based on Digital Information Technology .', 'As the embodiment of human system , urban culture represents the historical development of human civilization .', "With the great improvement of people 's living standard , people pay more and more attention to the colorful city life [ 1 ] .", 'The intense impact of urban culture and life creates public art .', 'Expert believe that public art is the core idea of a city .', 'It is an important symbol of the maturity of the city .', 'In recent year , people began to study various form of public art .', 'With the development of digital information technology , some artist try to apply digital technology to urban public art .', 'On this basis , this paper briefly summarizes the public art and digital technology related knowledge and theory .', 'Finally , the principle of urban design based on digital technology are put forward .', "Alterlivability speculative design fiction and the urban good life in starhawk 's fifth sacred thing and city of refuge .", 'This article responds to two diverging notion of “ livability ” : the normative New Urbanist imaginary of livable city , where the urban good life manifest in neoliberal consumer culture , green gentrification , and inaccessible infrastructure , and the feminist and disability concept of livable world , such as those in which nonnormate life thrives .', 'Whereas the former ought to broaden its notion of “ lives worth living , ” the latter would benefit from a more specific theory of design-the making and remaking of more livable world .', 'In response , this article offers the concept of “ alterlivability , ” a design philosophy grounded in permaculture ethic .', 'Drawing on two novel by ecofeminist writer Starhawk-The Fifth Sacred Thing ( 1994 ) and City of Refuge ( 2016 ) -the article explores the genre of speculative design fiction for its insight into prototyping more livable future in the Anthropocene .', "Starhawk 's novel illustrate alterlivability as a set of political commitment , design methodology , and spatial form that place disabled , racialized , and poor people at the center of alterlivable world .", 'Creating great place : Evidence-based urban design for health and wellbeing .', 'This book provides a bold vision and roadmap for creating great place .', 'Imagining and designing urban environment where all people thrive is an extraordinary task , and in this compelling narrative , Cushing and Miller remind us that theory is a powerful starting point .', 'Drawing on international research , illustrated case study , personal experience , as well as fascinating example from history and pop culture , this practical book provides the reader with inspiration , guidance and tool .', 'The first section outline six critical theory for contemporary urban design - affordance , prospect-refuge , personal space , sense of place/genius loci , place attachment , and biophilic design .', "The second section , using their innovative 'theory-storming ' process , demonstrates how designer can create great place that are inclusive , sustainable , and salutogenic .", "Creating Great Places is an insightful , compelling , and evidence-based resource for reader who want to design urban environment that inspire , excite , and positively transform people 's life .", 'Change in the contemporary book .', 'It is more of a welcoming public space , dedicated to culture and opened for all user .', 'Designer create interesting form , bringing people together and at the same time symbolizing knowledge and wisdom .', 'The workspace are ergonomic and provide people with sufficient space and friendly environment , allowing spending a whole day in the interior .', 'This article was devoted to present finding on change that have occurred in the contemporary public space of library , aiming at architecture humanization .', 'The study were carried out on example , i.e .', ': “ Harold Library of Faculty of Architecture WrUST ( Poland ) , “ Muntpunt ” library and information centre Brussels ( Belgium ) , etc .', 'Introduction landscape of mobility : Culture , politics , and placemaking .', "Urban planner James Rojas ' 'hands-on ' planning initiative demonstrate the power of mobility .", 'He uses transportable model and moving workshop as a way to involve citizen in the urban planning process .', 'He takes a medley of recycled material of vibrant color and varied shape , texture , and sizes to urban neighborhood , street corner and public location .', 'By setting up these interactive model in publicly accessible location , he encourages curious participant to use their hand and mind to experiment and create model of their ideal city , street , public space , or building .', 'These mobile and on site event take the planning process directly to the people .', "By giving them the opportunity to have a 'hands-on ' experience in envisioning their city , workshops help participant feel more connected to the urban landscape that surrounds them .", 'These experience set the groundwork for them to get involved in urban planning , and can help provide policy maker any living culture .', 'We live in a fluid , changing world with increasingly blurred boundary between local and global practice .', 'Due to rapidly escalating technological development in social and need of the society are evolving and this can be seen on different scale .', 'This new level of connectivity brings important concern regarding privacy , protection and control .', 'Like in our daily life and through living condition etc .', 'This in turn result in change to spatial planning and architecture .', 'Technological advance and cultural change have increasingly demanded the new definition of space .', "Today architectural space becomes `` the space of all dimension '' .", 'This paper aims to investigate this evolution of space on different scale and means that caused by contemporary information technology through cultural and environmental aspect .', 'The implementation of information technology on relation and different scale of interaction based on space will be discussed , and then the change and evolution of architectural concept on will be addressed .', 'Designing for small bathroom .', 'This paper will focus on how to design a series of bathroom product that work well for small bathroom using the principle of universal design .', 'In home culture research , Quitzau and Røpke has studied bathroom transformation from hygiene to well-being .', 'Bathroom are one of the room in apartment that do not have good solution for small space .', 'This is unfortunate since it is the bathroom that has the least amount of space in urban apartment .', 'This leads many people to have too little bathroom space due to furniture , toilet , shower , etc .', "In today 's society , the bathroom is no longer just a purpose room .", 'It is used for relaxation and wellness .', "This has led to a trend where large furniture , such as freestanding bathtubs , dominate today 's market .", 'This in turn allows the few solution that exist for small bathroom to remain poorly conceived .', 'The research question was therefore how to create solution for small bathroom to get the same sense of well-being as in larger bathroom through universal design principal .', 'The principle of universal design , observation and in-depth interview were used in the study .', 'This study can help to create a greater understanding of how to design small bathroom .', 'It will be relevant in a cross disciplinary field , including for professional in plumbing , product design and technical solution .', 'This will also increase the well-being of user of the bathroom .', 'Ambient medium for the third place in urban environment .', 'As ambient computing blend into the fabric of the modern urban environment developing a positive interplay between people , place , and technology to create enlivened , interactive city becomes a necessary priority in how we imagine , understand , design , and develop city .', 'Designing technology for art , culture and gastronomic experience , that are rich in community , can provide the mean for collaborative action to ( re ) create city that are lively , engaging , and promote a sense of well being as well as belonging .', 'Urban design , socialization , and quality of life .', 'Architecture as a discipline is essentially integrative : connecting past , present and future , drawing on art , science and the social science , balancing qualitative with quantitative factor .', 'Good architecture and urban design contribute to making city both functional and attractive to resident and visitor .', 'While into consideration this important relationship between building and the beauty of the city as a whole .', 'Socialization is the process that prepares human to function in social life .', 'It should be the citizen .', 'These pattern can be taught through an effective and mutual relationship , this education should be presented to acquire the necessary ability considering the cultural value and norm of a society continually and constantly .', "In the context of globalization , calligraphy 's function in constructing `` poetic dwelling '' urban environment .", 'With the accelerated urbanization process , the spiritual life of human being faced unprecedented difficulty .', 'The high density of population , rapid pace of urban living environment , the emergence of a whole moral decline and belief in the doldrums , mind impetuous and so on .', "In fact , if we can do `` coexistence of human and nature '' , `` poetic dwelling '' , the contradiction between urban development can be solved .", "As a `` core '' of our traditional culture , the art of calligraphy is undoubtedly a good medicine to ease modern urban people 's mental issue , like feeling impulsive , mental fatigue and fragile psychology .", "Calligraphy art plays an important role in the process of constructing `` poetic dwelling '' urban environment , it can help city dweller to create a simple short calm , timeless and elegant and refined mood long , a quiet indifferent way of life .", "People 's perception and behavior pattern in Amman 's public park and plazas .", 'This study aims to research the district and the `` Culture A venue '' in a high-income commercial district .", 'Through analytical study and the utilization of questionnaire , the research concludes an overall preference of the
