["'Our tyne ' : Iconic regeneration and the revitalisation of identity in NewcastleGateshead .", 'The landscape of the north-east of England , both urban and rural , is perhaps most notable as a deindustrialised landscape .', 'Indeed , the world in which we live is determined as much by what it was as by what it is .', 'Perhaps this is no more evident than in the case of NewcastleGateshead which is often portrayed as an exemplar of the revitalising benefit of culture-led regeneration .', 'The , as yet unproven , success of NewcastleGateshead Quayside is founded upon a massive financial investment in iconic project .', 'But under what condition is , if at all , such iconography succeeding ?', 'This article addresses the impact of flagship regeneration project and their role in radically rearticulating the meaning of place and space in a so-called post-industrial world .', "It is suggested that the success of investment in iconic cultural project depends above all upon people 's sense of belonging in a place and the degree to which cultureled regeneration can engage with that sense of belonging , whilst balancing achievement of the past with ambition for the future .", 'How art and culture happen in New York : Implication for urban economic development .', 'Problem : In the last two decade , urban economic development has shifted its focus from industrial recruitment to talent and human capital , including art and culture .', 'Many have argued that talented people are drawn to artistic and cultural amenity , but few have examined art and culture as a production system and drawn meaningful insight for urban planning and economic development based on understanding its inner working .', 'Purpose : This article looks closely at the mechanism that structure and drive the cultural economy and suggests possible avenue for cultural economic development and policymaking based on these mechanism .', 'I focus on the way cultural producer obtain job , advance their career , gain value for their good and service , and interact with each other .', 'Method : I conducted 80 interview with cultural producer , cultural gatekeeper , and owner and manager of entertainment venue these group frequent .', 'Result and conclusion : I find that not only are artistic and cultural producer densely agglomerated , but that key social mechanism structure and inform this clustered production system .', 'These industry depend on unique kind of social interaction , from nightlife to gallery opening , to thrive .', 'This is more than just fun and game , and is critical to the operation of this economic sector .', 'Takeaway for practice : Cultural producer rely heavily on their social life to advance their career , obtain job , and generate value for their good , so that the local art social milieu is critical to the cultural economy .', "Cultural producer also tend to cross-fertilize , collaborating to create good and service , review each other 's product , and establish new career , meaning the ability to live and work in close proximity to one another is important .", 'Finally , a large concentration of creative people and an active cultural milieu has made New York culture a known brand .', 'While New York is unique , the cultural life of other city and region can also be economic development asset .', 'Place can strategically cultivate the social milieus that are most conducive to the production of art and culture .', "Bohemia as subculture ; `` Bohemia '' as industry : Art , culture , and economic development .", 'Artist have long been thought of as agent of revitalization , transforming warehouse and blighted neighborhood into bohemian enclave that become destination for the well-heeled , simultaneously bringing redevelopment and reinvestment .', 'Yet , the active cultivation of art as a central part of economic development is new .', 'The increasing shift in economic development focused on attracting people not smokestack has brought art and culture center-stage .', "This article considers the art in economic development through several discrete but interrelated lens : 1 ) As an amenity or consumption product 2 ) As a redevelopment and development tool 3 ) As a way to `` brand '' place 4 ) As generator of job and revenue .", 'Finally , I consider current research that begins to unpack the social and economic process necessary to cultural production .', "This line of research may enable a better understanding of the art ' function and potential in economic development .", 'The role of urban design in cultural regeneration .', 'One of the technique that has been used as a tool for urban development in recent year is that of cultural regeneration .', 'This is seen as a means of restoring and improving the quality of urban life through the enhancement and development of the unique characteristic of a place and its people .', 'This article argues that urban design is integral to the process of cultural regeneration , as such thing as mixed-use development , environmental improvement scheme and , in particular , public art help in the expression and development of the culture of an area .', 'The article looks at how specific cultural quarter are developed in city centre area , focusing on an area of Manchester known as the Northern Quarter , and outlines the way in which urban design technique are used as part of the process of wider cultural regeneration .', 'It is suggested that , for improved chance of success , the adoption of a holistic approach to urban regeneration is required , with policy-makers using culture as an organizing principle for city management and urban design .', 'Urban history and cultural resource in urban regeneration : a case of creative waterfront renewal .', 'In recent decade , the role of culture and history has often become a driving factor in the process of urban regeneration .', 'The focus on culture and history as factor in regional transformation has been particularly extensive in response not only to competitiveness among city but also to sustainability requirement in the cultural sector .', 'In the same perspective of this approach , culture in its broadest sense assumes a decisive role in constructing a system of intervention where employment and social and sustainable development become the product of the integration of place , people , economy and tradition .', 'Creative city are currently working on how to improve the interaction between regeneration building , economic development and social renewal in order to achieve more comprehensive development of the city .', 'Existing creative city may be seen to revolve around the design , promotion and activation of urban area established due to their particular local characteristic .', 'Such area become creative cluster as a result of economic and structural innovation , related to the realization of innovator project achieved with the help of local development strategy based on the economy of excellence , culture and territorial quality .', 'Starting from such premise , this article aims to show the main factor which condition creativity in city - such as new policy , participation , history , place identity , cultural resource and sustainability - and an emblematic case study of creative regeneration .', 'This concerns the HafenCity district in Hamburg , where the history has assumed an important role in re-constructing the maritime identity and for many choice of urban nature .', "'China 's leading historical and cultural city ' : Branding Dali City through public-private partnership in Bai architecture revitalization .", 'Competing with other Chinese city for investment and tourism , various governmental body with jurisdiction in Dali City have begun to make use of local historical and cultural asset in order to brand the city .', 'This paper aims to reveal how partnership between the public and private sector in heritage management have functioned as an approach to city branding , and how local people perceive and are influenced by these partnership .', "Applying perspective from the scholarly literature on city branding and public-private partnership , this paper examines two case in Dali City - Zhang 's Garden and the Linden Center - to detail how local government and elite entrepreneur have partnernered in support of Bai architecture revitalization with tourism in mind .", 'This paper also considers opinion from the local general public regarding these partnership , and investigates the complex relationship among local government , elite entrepreneur , and the public .', 'Singapore in transition : From technology to culture hub .', 'Purpose - This paper aims to present an approach to the knowledge-based economy that focuses on the developmental synergy between technology ( especially information and communication technology ) , culture and place ( hub ) as expressed in the innovative milieu of the inner city .', 'Design/methodology/approach - This paper draws on research in city and urban planning , which emphasizes the importance of quality of a place , location or city and the more intentional emphasis given to development of human and cultural resource , which are conducive to innovation , learning , creativity and change in a knowledge-based economy .', 'Finding - Singapore is chosen as a case study of analysis for a knowledge-based economy in transition because of its developmental approach and strategic shift from one focused on technology-intensive sector to one focused on high knowledge-intensive company and towards a free-spirited dynamic creative hub in the making .', 'It displays many characteristic typical of a knowledge-based economy in which people , their idea and capability are the key source of wealth and opportunity .', "Practical implication - The paper observes a missing link in the transition from technology to knowledge to culture hub , which might have implication for Singapore 's effort towards establishing itself as a cultural industry metropolis , a renaissance city using culture to re-position its international image as a global city for the art .", "Originality/value - The originality and value of the paper lie in this analysis , which makes one conclude that , although Singapore 's developmental model had created benefit in many way , it had also negatively constrained its development , particularly in the area of knowledge creation and application to entrepreneurship , innovation and creativity .", 'Key concept in event management .', 'In recent year we have seen an enormous growth of festival and event activity and the literature within the field is consequently huge .', 'In order to make sense of this rapid and dynamic development , student are dependent on a book that can lead them through the myriad of theoretical framework offered.This book naturally situates itself in the middle of this need , offering a comprehensive and illuminating account of the festival and event field .', 'Written with academic rigour yet accessible at the same time , Quinn proves herself to be an outstanding communicator and stimulator of knowledge.International in content and timely in its up to date coverage of key topic , this will be an invaluable reference source for student from Event Management , Tourism and Leisure study .', 'It will also be of great use for student from Business Studies , Marketing , Cultural Studies and Geography.The SAGE Quinn has a PhD in Human Geography from University College Dublin .", 'She currently lectures and research in the Department of Tourism at the Dublin Institute of Technology .', 'The nature and meaning of festival and festivity in contemporary society is one of her key research interest and her work on the topic has been published in a number of international journal including Urban Studies , Social and Cultural Geography , Tourism Geographies , Event Management and the Journal of Policy Research in Tourism , Leisure and Event .', 'Other research interest include the relationship between culture and tourism , leisure and social inclusion and contemporary form of tourism mobility .', 'Publication on these topic have appeared in the Annals of Tourism Research , Gender , Place and Culture and Leisure Studies as well as in various edited book collection .', 'Her teaching interest mirror her research interest and she is involved in undergraduate and postgraduate tourism management and event management programme teaching module related to cultural tourism , international festival environment , tourism study , and tourism and event policy.AcknowledgementsMy long-standing interest in festival and event has been shaped by many people , both practitioner and academic , over the year .', 'These people are too many to mention by name , but I owe all of them a debt of gratitude .', 'While writing this book I was very fortunate to be able to draw on the expertise of colleague , particularly Lucy Horan and Ruth Craggs , as well as the support and encouragement of my other colleague at the Dublin Institute of Technology .', 'Finally , a huge thank you to John , Muireann and Aoife for absolutely everything.IntroductionIn 1991 , Getz wrote that festival and holiday event represented nouveau , alternative tourism ( cited in Lee et al.', ', 2008 ) .', 'How time have changed !', 'Such an assertion is simply unimaginable today when , more than 20 year later , finding a city or town without at least one annual festival or planned event would be quite a challenge .', 'Does this constitute progress ?', 'How do festival and event contribute to contemporary society ?', 'What has the remarkable rise in festival and event meant for the development of tourism destination ; for the development of economy , be they local , national or international ?', 'These and many other question preoccupy what is now an extremely large , international community of scholar from a range of discipline who adopt a variety of research approach to study the complex and profoundly important communal celebration at the heart of the diverse festival and event treated in this volume.While it is difficult to calculate the size of festival and event activity , academic , policy and industry commentator everywhere concur that its recent growth across the world in term of number , diversity and popularity has been enormous ( Getz , 1991 ; Finkel , 2009 ; Thrane , 2002 ) .', 'In the USA it is estimated that there were 10,000 festival per year , attracting over 31 million visitor by the mid-1990s ( Janiskee , 1996 ; TIA , 2004 ) .', 'In Australia , the government notes that festival have become ubiquitous , with hundred being held every year ( Australian Government , 2012 ) .', 'In Europe , the growth has been similarly dramatic .', 'According to the International Festival and Event Association ( IFEA ) , the special event industry is estimated to comprise between 4 and 5 million regularly occurring event ( Wood , 2012 ) .', 'This significant growth in the practice of festival and event brought a parallel increase in the emergence and development of the festival and event management profession .', 'It soon also brought a rise in academic interest : closely allied to the development of tourism study , academic began to take an interest in charting development in the sector and the literature has burgeoned over the last 20 year .', 'Much of the research is published in tourism study and specific event-oriented journal , but it also finds expression in a wide range of journal dedicated to management and marketing , urban and place study , art and cultural policy , as well as many social sciences-oriented journal .', 'In the majority of case , festival and special event are presented as broadly positive phenomenon .', 'Throughout the literature , opening paragraphs emphasise the important role they play in advancing local and regional economy , branding place , attracting visitor , extending the tourism season and fostering community spirit .', 'Yet , festival and special event , the subject matter at the heart of this book represent a very substantial , complex and dynamic set of activity that can be both deeply rooted and rapidly changing in country throughout the world .', 'In academia , they are studied from diverse management , social science and humanity perspective .', 'As such , interpretation of their impact and contribution to contemporary economy and society as well as approach to valuing , managing and shaping appropriate policy for their advancement are multiple and at time conflicting.The literature in the field is now enormous and growing all the time .', 'Increasing familiarity with the literature brings an increasing awareness of the unevenness of knowledge , the fracture between academic discipline and the continuous emergence of new sub-fields .', 'The literature on the Olympic Games , for example , is now in and of itself very substantial , yet the extent to which knowledge generated on this particular event translates across into the study of other event that differ by scale and type is very unclear .', 'Getz and Andersson ( 2010 ) explained that festival tourism has been studied by many researcher from many perspective : impact ( of varying type ) , place marketing , travel pattern , displacement effect , motivation , market segmentation , quality and satisfaction , regional development , relationship to urban renewal and development , and link to culture and community .', 'However , this sector is nothing if not dynamic and while knowledge gap are closing in some area , they continue to open up elsewhere all the time .', 'This book tries to take cognisance of this dynamism in including concept that would seem very important in term of future development .', "The concept of ‘ risk management ' , so important from an applied perspective , and that of ‘ emerging economy ' , so important from a geographical perspective , are two example of this.This volume is tasked with introducing , defining and reviewing the current state of knowledge of the key concept in the contemporary study of festival and event .", 'While this involves reviewing literature that is either part of , or closely associated with , tourism study , in reality , it is a multi-disciplinary task that draws on a wide breadth of discipline area .', 'It is well recognised that festival and special event are important from community , social , cultural , political and economic perspective .', 'Despite the growth and popularity of festival and special event , researcher were initially slow in directing research beyond economic impact and motivation ( Gursoy et al.', ', 2004 ) .', 'However , this imbalance is now being corrected .', 'The recent evolution of the academic study of festival and event can not be understood in isolation from the simultaneous evolution of the academic study of tourism .', 'As theme of enquiry have emerged and developed within tourism study , they virtually always evolve into a new theme of enquiry within festival and event study .', 'This link between the two area of study is very strong , with tourism study the primary field of enquiry and festival and event a large and distinct sub-field within.The task of advancing knowledge about the meaning , practice and policy associated with festival and event remains ongoing .', 'As this volume will show , the understanding of core concept remains uneven , and our knowledge of certain dimension of festival and event activity far exceeds that of others .', 'Some of the extant gap are recent , emerging only when contemporary political and societal debate begin to highlight particular concern .', 'The concept of innovation is a case in point : question as to the role that the festival and event sector plays in promoting , adopting and managing innovation are now coming to the fore in the literature .', "Others , such as the sustainability of the sector 's activity have been an issue for longer .", 'Most recently of all , the question as to how festival and event activity are affected by global recession has begun to be investigated , in response to the harsh reality negatively affecting the health of the sector in very recent time .', 'The 35 concept that are discussed in this volume are laid out in alphabetical order .', 'Talking about art ( s ) : A theoretical framework clarifying the association between culture and place branding .', 'The purpose of this paper is to develop a conceptual framework to describe possible key feature in the relationship between culture and place branding .', 'The inspiration to redact this paper was drawn from the inadequacy of literature and attempt to introduce the theoretical framework linking these two field by asking : how do we define culture within the context of place branding ?', 'How do decision maker distinguish whether culture should be at the forefront of a place branding strategy ?', 'On one hand , the paper points out the powerful advantage while using art ( s ) and culture-based activity to promote a place .', 'On the other hand , the paper highlights the layered dilemmas for practitioner concerning the amalgamation of such a practice on a branding campaign .', "Those question ' clarification is achieved by mean of a literature review that examines this relationship from a wide range of discipline : sociology , marketing , place branding , cultural management , urban study , etc .", "The paper 's finding can be summarized in three point : first , culture plays a critical role on a place branding campaign , as long as the authentic cultural element are produced by the resident .", 'This practice helps to avoid the mass reproduction of “ borrowed ” cultural element , i.e .', 'the investment in cultural and leisure consumption industry .', 'Second , the cultural field has already deployed practice used by local authority in urban regeneration , such as cultural planning .', 'Thus , converged objective link cultural manager to place branding expert , refining multi-dimensional policy thinking towards a more integrated image .', 'Finally , the cultural aspect is related with the pre-existing reputation of a place .', 'Further , it is connected with the mind of people , fostering the contention of common essence between culture and branding .', 'This paper intends to contribute and enhance inter-professional thinking , by approaching the cultural sector with the appropriate sensitivity .', 'The paper provides deeper understanding of culture , bordering the gap between technocrat and cultural-oriented professional by contributing to the creation of a coherent communication system for the study of place branding theory .', "The cultural dimension of a place is very spacious and further research needs to be made , approaching the subject from new perspective , such as people 's perception of the brand while using art ( s ) as a branding tool .", 'Lille 2004 and the role of culture in the regeneration of Lille métropole .', 'When considering the role culture can play in the regeneration of post-industrial city , the Lille experience can be seen as a major reference , as the success of Lille 2004 , European Capital of Culture demonstrates .', 'To better understand the reason for this success , it is necessary to set it in its historic context ; 2004 was indeed a special year for Lille and its metropolitan area , but for decade , cultural factor have played a crucial role in urban development there .', "Perhaps most interesting is the fact that cultural development was not just about promoting the city 's image and developing tourism , but also a matter of increasing local people 's self-confidence and civic pride and even of boosting the industrial conversion process .", 'Cultural concern have been present for more than thirty year in regeneration initiative , and there exists a large consensus for considering culture as a decisive part of the metropolitan development strategy .', "China 's new creative cluster : Governance , human capital and investment .", "Recognising that creativity is a major driving force in the post-industrial economy , the Chinese government has recently established a range of `` creative cluster '' - industrial park devoted to medium industry , and art district - in order to promote the development of the creative industry .", 'This book examines these new creative cluster , outlining their nature and purpose , and assessing their effectiveness .', 'Drawing on case study of a range of cluster model , and comparing them with international example , the book demonstrates that creativity , both in China and internationally , is in fact a process of fitting new idea to existing pattern , model and format .', 'It shows how large and exceptionally impressive creative cluster have been successfully established , but raises the important question of whether profit or culture is the driving force , and of whether the bringing together of independent-minded , creative people , entrepreneurial businessmen , preferential policy and foreign investment may in time lead to unintended change in social and political attitude in China , including a weakening of state bureaucratic power .', 'An important contribution to the existing literature on the subject , this book will be of great interest to scholar of urban study , cultural geography , cultural economics and Asian study .', 'Urban beautification : The construction of a new identity in Chicago .', 'DURING THE LAST 20 YEARS , cultural policy has become an integral part of economic and physical redevelopment strategy for many urban center across the United States .', 'Driven by deindustrialization , population decentralization , and globalization , many city have turned to cultural strategy as a means to reposition themselves in a rapidly changing economic environment or to reaffirm their standing in an evolving metropolitan hierarchy .', 'One factor fueling culture-driven strategy in urban development is that citizen now have more leisure-expendable income than ever before .', 'This fact has led city government to increase expenditure on culture and related specialized bureaucracy .', 'As a result , policymaking body have ventured to enhance their provision of cultural service to cater to a growing , more differentiated , and increasingly sophisticated public demand .', 'The outcome of these trend has resulted in the development of an economy of urban tourism .', 'This has encouraged city and their government to turn their attention to policy that center on showcasing their cultural heritage , exporting their cultural identity , and translating these policy into revenue stream that can then be used for social and economic transformation .', 'Hence , promoting festival , art , sport , music , cinema , convention , and exhibits has come to be viewed as central activity of this strategy .', 'This trend is the focus of an April 2000 report published by the National League of Cities entitled Tourism and Entertainment as a Local Economic Development Strategy : A Survey of City Halls ( Judd et al .', '2000 ) , which discusses how tourist and entertainment infrastructure has recently emerged as a primary form of public investment in American city .', 'How has this tourism-focused economic restructuring come to fuel emerging urban-planning strategy ?', 'Although there is no simple answer to this question , multiple issue can be identified as factor that have caused the ascendance of urban tourism and associated public works activity .', 'In the past , tourism and related cultural form did not fit the planning mix and were viewed at best as inconsequential element of local economic activity ( Beauregard 1998 ) .', 'The motivation and rising demand for urban tourism may be found in two fundamental factor .', "The first can be drawn from a recent and continuing desire by people to explore the unfamiliar and to construct or to solidify their identity through travel and appropriately utilized leisure time ( Law 2002 ) .Whether it is the search for self- Actualization ( Maslow 1970 ) , the acquisition of `` cultural capital '' ( Bourdieu 1984 ) , or identity formation through consumption ( Baudrillard 1988 ) and pilgrimage to famous place ( MacCannell 1976 ) , or even the `` tourist gaze '' as projected onto destination by the medium ( Urry 1990 ) , tourism and leisure activity have entered and influenced the realm of human experience in way more powerful and profound than ever before .", 'The second factor relates more directly to the dynamic of city governance and to the contemporary condition of city .', 'The economic decline following the post war restructuring ; the impact of globalization , which substantially reduced the primacy of the U.S. economy in production activity ; and diminishing contribution by the federal government to the city and state , presented a series of challenge for local official facing the new fiscal reality of shrinking budget and service .', 'City responded by divorcing themselves from their manufacturing dependency ; instead , they searched for way to diversify and strengthen the various remaining sector of their economy .', 'Within this framework , urban tourism emerges as an appealing alternative , one that slowly has gained favor with local official and civic booster alike .', 'As city rush to take advantage of this new growth potential , they face numerous challenge , mainly in the area of urban identity and urban competition .', 'Specifically , how can a city with a formerly strong and nationally or internationally identifiable manufacturing economy convert itself intoa tourist destination ?', "Most important , how does it convince potential visitor of its new service and sense of `` attractiveness '' ?", 'Similarly , what are its competitive advantage within this reformulated environment ?', 'The rise of urban tourism increase intermunicipal competition and requires city to be more entrepreneurial .', 'In Marketing Place : Attracting Investment , Industry , and Tourism to Cities , States , and Nations , international marketing guru Philip Kotler along with Donald H. Haider and Irving Rein ( 1993 ) definitively make the point that competition is a new reality that can not be avoided : `` Place have to visualize a clearer sense of the function they perform and the role they play .', '.', '.', '.', "A place that fails to examine its prospect and potential critically is likely to lose out to more attractive competitor '' ( p. 311 ) .", 'Within this context , the city is no different from the corporation that must engage in image-building activity , market its product , and be prepared to deal with change if it wants to maintain its competitive edge .', 'The competition to attract tourist has had a tremendous impact on city as spatial transformation , increased commodification , rapid segmentation of urban form and function , and new economic and planning mechanism became widely introduced .', "The `` tourist bubble '' has emerged as a commonrestructuring strategy ( Judd 2003 ; Judd and Fainstein 1999 ) .", 'Convention center , theme park , stadium , and casino and riverboat gambling have reshaped the physical landscape and image of hundred of dying urban core .', 'The city of leisure and entertainment , aimed at attracting local and visitor , has caused a reorganization of planning policy and priority ( Clark 2003 ; Spirou and Bennett 2003 , 37-58 ) .', 'Art and cultural participation at the heart of community life .', "A COMMUNITY 'S ART-its creative and cultural expression in the form of music , dance , theater , visual art , and crafts-embodies its essence and is crucial to its well-being .", 'Through making art-amateur and professional , formal and informal1-communities preserve , invent , and assert their identity ; transmit heritage ; and comment on their existence .', 'Art and cultural participation contribute to community condition in education , economic development , civic engagement , and to stewardship of place ( Jackson et al .', '2003 ; Jackson and Herranz 2002 ) .', "Based on year of research , we know that mural , altar , choir , music band , ethnic dance troupe , embroidery and quilting group , drumming circle , theater troupe , parade , and festival are all example of what people describe as cultural asset in community around the United States.These are artistic and creative outlet that are a crucial aspect of quality of life.They are valued for the intrinsic property of art and contribute to the community 's well-being .", 'They are found in a variety of place , including formal cultural presentation venue such as museum and theater , small and midsize organization where artists gather to make art and produce event , and in community cultural center .', 'But they also occur with great frequency , formally and informally , in place and through organization that are not primarily concerned with the art , such as school , church , park , community center , social service organization , social club and benevolent society , and sometimes business and commercial retail establishment .', 'Moreover , art and non-arts entity often have to work together to make cultural participation possible ( Jackson and Herranz 2002 ) .', "Although art and cultural participation at the community level are at the heart of community life , many policy maker , urban planner , and art administrator have not acknowledged the art as an essential part of a community 's core , to the detriment of community .", 'The range of opportunity for cultural participation needed for a healthy community eludes many of these player .', 'Instead , large cultural institution concerned primarily with presenting formal professional art , often with tie to the nonprofit and public sector , have dominated with their idea of what constitutes the art world and the cultural sector .', 'Activity at all artistic skill level , often in smaller art and cultural organization as well as through other public , private , and commercial art outlet , exists at the periphery of recognition , even though in reality it is at the center of real life in community .', 'In the art administration and cultural policy field , informal art practice were formally recognized as an important aspect of the cultural sector during an American Assembly meeting in 1997 focused on the art and their public purpose.2 During that meeting , the importance of ethnographic research that could capture informal , amateur , community-based , and unincorporated art , in addition to quantitative or statistical research on other aspect of the sector , was emphasized .', 'Since that time , research on this kind of informal or unincorporated activity has continued , although work is still needed to position this aspect of the cultural sector in a way that does justice to the significance of its role in society .', 'This chapter sets out to challenge the dominant model that relegates community art and culture to the sideline ; it offers an alternative set of value that has implication for how arts administrator , urban planner , and policy maker should pursue their work in planning , urban design , funding , and cultural programming .', 'With better research about community and charged with defining and engaging with the creative economy3 and the ideology of the creative city,4 they have an opportunity to reassess their assumption and approach .', 'The material presented here is based on year of research completed by the Urban Institute on the art and artist in community life.5 Research has included participant observation of arts-related activity and event in neighborhood all over the United States as well as hundred of interview and score of focus group discussion with artist , art administrator , urban planner , community development professional , policy maker , and community resident .', 'It has also included general population survey on cultural participation and attitude toward artist .', 'Urban branding and place as a quality product : innovation in the urban experience .', 'Purpose : Starting from these premise , the aim of the paper is illustrating the role of experience in urban regeneration project and to explore how the experience of high quality product luxury place can be sustainable with existent place identity or new place identity to be suitably created .', 'Design/methodology/approach : The experience of a place may become an integral part of a product experience .', 'The enhancement of product ( Splendiani , 2013 ) : assumes a meaning which goes beyond the simple sale of material good .', 'It covers the supply of complex experience … enriched by intangible element capable to stimulate and involve the sensory and experiential component of consumption .', 'It deals with attracting people to the place where local product are made by inserting the product in the most extensive offer covering the entire territorial system of reference The experience may also be used for the spectacolarisation of a place and its commercialisation , as in the case of “ brandscapes ” ( Klingman , 2007 ) .', 'In this case , it is important not to clone every place everywhere because they could inevitably resemble each other without be able to really engage the people who move into them ( Lehtovuori , 2010 ) .', 'The methodology approach is based on a wide bibliography and internet research based on the main term connected to the topic of the paper , including experience , place identity , quality product , regeneration ; on case study – even though not illustrated – concerning place of interest for the research topic , such as : Hafencity in Hamburg , the Albert Dock in Liverpool , Abondaibarra area in Bilbao .', 'Finding : The planning of place of quality product can not be separated from interpretation of the territory as a cultural system resulting from an ensemble of historical , economic and social process .', 'In such a system , the contribution of the cultural factor must be considered propulsive , not only for its qualitative meaning but also , and especially , for the role of “ trait d ’ union ” of a number of action taken to protect and enhance place .', 'Originality/value : The increasing importance of the use of experience in the urban regeneration process is leading city to be involved in constructing suitable image and symbol of their transformed area to meet the new trend , also according with luxurious one .', 'Even though globalisation is one of the main danger in innovative itinerary , the proper planning of quality architecture and public space could prevent it by creating a suitable mix between innovation and culture .', 'Art , culture and the city : An overview .', 'More people , more organization , more town , city , region and country for more reason have found that over the last 30 year the art , their broader culture and overall creativity has something in it for them in renewal and revitalization .', 'Over the last cultural production in contemporary economy .', 'Purpose : This paper discusses the social condition for cultural production in contemporary city , in the context of a globalized economy , with rising importance of the integration of cognitive , symbolic and emotional element into tradable product and service .', 'Although the agglomeration dynamic of creative activity in urban contexts and the social or spatial inequality related to process of urban reorganization in Post-Fordist society have been analysed in the last year , the interrelation between these aspect still lack adequate investigation and empirical analysis .', 'Methodology/Approach : By synthetizing diverse theoretical contribution related to different level and interaction arising from creative activity , their transformation into tradable product ( commodification ) and some of their spatial implication in the urban context ( agglomeration , externality , identity , place branding and gentrification ) , the article emphasizes the different benefit obtained by the agent involved in this process , potentially contributing for increasing social conflict and to a process of cultural homogenization with negative implication on the uniqueness and authenticity of place .', 'Finding : Benefit arising from the externality generated by the agglomeration of cultural production and creative activity can be framed within the “ Common Pool of Resources ” approach , suggesting that a more balanced share of the benefit can be obtained by mean of participatory process for city planning and development .', 'Research Limitation/implication : The paper is based on a conceptual approach and further empirical research can be useful in order to test the formulation proposed .', 'Originality/Value of paper : for the distribution of benefit arising from cultural production , with qualitative analysis related to participatory process of urban planning and monitoring .', 'Smart Creative Cities and Urban Regeneration Policy : Culture , Innovation , and Economy at Nexus .', 'Learning from Lyon Metropolis .', 'In 1995 , the English planner Charles Landry and Franco Bianchini published “ The Creative City ” , focusing on three intertwined topic : the cultural , social , and economic impact that arises from creativity in city ; the need to promote integrated urban planning levering on knowledge from other discipline ; and the active inclusion in urban planning process of ordinary , often marginalized people .', 'A few year later , Landry issue “ The Creative City .', 'A Toolkit for Urban Innovation ” , a book in which he challenges and further develops his idea by proposing them as a “ toolbox for urban renaissance.', '” At the beginning of the twenty-first century , the American economist Richard Florida delivers what is considered a milestone on the subject of the creative city : “ The Rise of the Creative Class ” , in which he emphasizes the characteristic of people performing creative activity in city , as well as the condition that city must offer in order for the “ creative class ” to be attracted and settle in them .', 'The Smart Creative City is a more recent concept .', 'It grew out of economic science , especially the so-called Experience Economy .', 'Regarding specifically the economic development of city , creativity , art , and culture represent strategic asset in the urban regeneration process , and the socioeconomic feature of smart creative city can be considered the most evident and critical one .', 'This study thus spring from the recognition of the relevance of smart creative city , and of an integrated and visionary planning approach to urban regeneration—itself creative .', 'This analysis has been conducted focusing on selected experience developed by Lyon metropolis , aiming at understanding whether and how the municipality is levering on creativity , art and culture within its urban regeneration programme .', 'This objective is addressed through a mixed-qualitative methodology that investigates the political discourse and adopts a descriptive case study approach to analyse policy process , driver , and obstacle that are fostering or limiting that vision in the local context of Lyon .', 'The research responds to the question posed , showing both the transformative capacity and the trade-off of explicitly integrating cultural and artistic project and event , as urban “ innovative ” regeneration device , within the “ common ” planning and design practice of the municipality of Lyon .',
